17  * version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
18  *

20  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
21  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU
22  * Lesser General Public License for more details.

25  * License along with SU2. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

28 #include "../../include/fem/fem_geometry_structure.hpp"
29 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CPrimalGridFEM.hpp"
30 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CPrimalGridBoundFEM.hpp"
31 #include "../../include/adt/CADTElemClass.hpp"
32 #include "../../include/adt/CADTPointsOnlyClass.hpp"
33 
34 /* Prototypes for Lapack functions, if MKL or LAPACK is used. */
35 #if defined(HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)
36 extern "C" void dpotrf_(char*, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
37 extern "C" void dpotri_(char*, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
38 #endif
39 
40 bool CLong3T::operator<(const CLong3T& other) const {
41  if (long0 != other.long0) return (long0 < other.long0);
42  if (long1 != other.long1) return (long1 < other.long1);
43  if (long2 != other.long2) return (long2 < other.long2);
44 
45  return false;
46 }
47 
48 CReorderElements::CReorderElements(const unsigned long val_GlobalElemID, const unsigned short val_TimeLevel,
49  const bool val_CommSolution, const unsigned short val_VTK_Type,
50  const unsigned short val_nPolySol, const bool val_JacConstant) {
51  /* Copy the global elment ID, time level and whether or not this element
52  must be communicated. */
53  globalElemID = val_GlobalElemID;
54  timeLevel = val_TimeLevel;
55  commSolution = val_CommSolution;
56 
57  /* Create the element type used in this class, which stores information of
58  the VTK type, the polynomial degree of the solution and whether or not the
59  Jacobian of the transformation is constant. As it is possible that the
60  polynomial degree of the solution is zero, this convention is different
61  from the convention used in the SU2 grid file. */
62  elemType = val_VTK_Type + 100 * val_nPolySol;
63  if (!val_JacConstant) elemType += 50;
64 }
65 
66 bool CReorderElements::operator<(const CReorderElements& other) const {
67  /* Elements with the lowest time level are stored first. */
68  if (timeLevel != other.timeLevel) return timeLevel < other.timeLevel;
69 
70  /* Next comparison is whether or not the element must communicate its
71  solution data to other ranks. Elements which do not need to do this
72  are stored first. */
73  if (commSolution != other.commSolution) return other.commSolution;
74 
75  /* Elements of the same element type must be stored as contiguously as
76  possible to allow for the simultaneous treatment of elements in the
77  matrix multiplications. */
78  if (elemType != other.elemType) return elemType < other.elemType;
79 
80  /* The final comparison is based on the global element ID. */
81  return globalElemID < other.globalElemID;
82 }
83 
84 bool CSortFaces::operator()(const CFaceOfElement& f0, const CFaceOfElement& f1) {
85  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are boundary faces. ---*/
86  if (f0.faceIndicator >= 0 && f1.faceIndicator >= 0) {
87  /* Both faces are boundary faces. The first comparison is the boundary
88  marker, which is stored in faceIndicator. */
89  if (f0.faceIndicator != f1.faceIndicator) return f0.faceIndicator < f1.faceIndicator;
90 
91  /* Both faces belong to the same boundary marker. The second comparison is
92  based on the on the local volume ID's of the adjacent elements. As the
93  volumes are sorted according to the time levels for time accurate
94  local stepping, there is no need to do this check seperately here. */
95  unsigned long ind0 = f0.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f0.elemID0 : f0.elemID1;
96  unsigned long ind1 = f1.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f1.elemID0 : f1.elemID1;
97 
98  return ind0 < ind1;
99  }
100 
101  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are internal faces. ---*/
102  if (f0.faceIndicator == -1 && f1.faceIndicator == -1) {
103  /* Both faces are internal faces. First determine the minimum and maximum
104  ID of its adjacent elements. */
105  unsigned long elemIDMin0 = min(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
106  unsigned long elemIDMax0 = max(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
107 
108  unsigned long elemIDMin1 = min(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
109  unsigned long elemIDMax1 = max(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
110 
111  /* Determine the situation. */
112  if (elemIDMax0 < nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 < nVolElemTot) {
113  /* Both faces are matching internal faces. Determine whether or not these
114  faces are local faces, i.e. faces between locally owned elements. */
115  const bool face0IsLocal = elemIDMax0 < nVolElemOwned;
116  const bool face1IsLocal = elemIDMax1 < nVolElemOwned;
117 
118  /* Check if both faces have the same status, i.e. either local or
119  not local. */
120  if (face0IsLocal == face1IsLocal) {
121  /* Both faces are either local or not local. Determine the time level
122  of the faces, which is the minimum value of the adjacent volume
123  elements. */
124  const unsigned short timeLevel0 = min(volElem[elemIDMin0].timeLevel, volElem[elemIDMax0].timeLevel);
125  const unsigned short timeLevel1 = min(volElem[elemIDMin1].timeLevel, volElem[elemIDMax1].timeLevel);
126 
127  /* Internal faces with the same status are first sorted according to
128  their time level. Faces with the smallest time level are numbered
129  first. Note this is only relevant for time accurate local time
130  stepping. */
131  if (timeLevel0 != timeLevel1) return timeLevel0 < timeLevel1;
132 
133  /* The faces belong to the same time level. They are sorted according
134  to their element ID's in order to increase cache performance. */
135  if (elemIDMin0 != elemIDMin1) return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
136  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
137  } /* One face is a local face and the other is not. Make sure that
138  the local faces are numbered first. */
139  return face0IsLocal;
140 
141  } else if (elemIDMax0 >= nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 >= nVolElemTot) {
142  /* Both faces are non-matching internal faces. Sort them according to
143  their relevant element ID. The time level is not taken into account
144  yet, because non-matching faces are not possible at the moment with
145  time accurate local time stepping. */
146  return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
147  } else {
148  /* One face is a matching internal face and the other face is a
149  non-matching internal face. Make sure that the non-matching face
150  is numbered after the matching face. This is accomplished by comparing
151  the maximum element ID's. */
152  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
153  }
154  }
155 
156  /*--- One face is a boundary face and the other face is an internal face.
157  Make sure that the boundary face is numbered first. This can be
158  accomplished by using the > operator for faceIndicator. ---*/
159  return f0.faceIndicator > f1.faceIndicator;
160 }
161 
162 bool CSortBoundaryFaces::operator()(const CSurfaceElementFEM& f0, const CSurfaceElementFEM& f1) {
163  /* First sorting criterion is the index of the standard element. The
164  boundary faces should be sorted per standard element. Note that the
165  time level is not taken into account here, because it is assumed that
166  the surface elements to be sorted belong to one time level. */
167  if (f0.indStandardElement != f1.indStandardElement) return f0.indStandardElement < f1.indStandardElement;
168 
169  /* The standard elements are the same. The second criterion is the
170  corresponding volume IDs of the surface elements. */
171  return f0.volElemID < f1.volElemID;
172 }
173 
174 bool CPointFEM::operator<(const CPointFEM& other) const {
175  if (periodIndexToDonor != other.periodIndexToDonor) return periodIndexToDonor < other.periodIndexToDonor;
176  return globalID < other.globalID;
177 }
178 
179 bool CPointFEM::operator==(const CPointFEM& other) const {
180  return (globalID == other.globalID && periodIndexToDonor == other.periodIndexToDonor);
181 }
182 
183 void CVolumeElementFEM::GetCornerPointsAllFaces(unsigned short& numFaces, unsigned short nPointsPerFace[],
184  unsigned long faceConn[6][4]) {
185  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the faces, local to the element. ---*/
186  CPrimalGridFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsAllFaces(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid, numFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
187 
188  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
189  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < numFaces; ++i) {
190  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) {
191  unsigned long nn = faceConn[i][j];
192  faceConn[i][j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
193  }
194  }
195 }
196 
197 bool CInternalFaceElementFEM::operator<(const CInternalFaceElementFEM& other) const {
198  /* First comparison is the standard element, such that elements with
199  the same same standard elements are grouped together. */
200  if (indStandardElement != other.indStandardElement) return indStandardElement < other.indStandardElement;
201 
202  /* The second comparison is the element ID on side 0. */
203  if (elemID0 != other.elemID0) return elemID0 < other.elemID0;
204 
205  /* The final comparison is the element ID on side 1. */
206  return elemID1 < other.elemID1;
207 }
208 
209 void CSurfaceElementFEM::GetCornerPointsFace(unsigned short& nPointsPerFace, unsigned long faceConn[]) {
210  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the face, local to the element. ---*/
211  CPrimalGridBoundFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsFace(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
212 
213  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
214  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace; ++j) {
215  unsigned long nn = faceConn[j];
216  faceConn[j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
217  }
218 }
219 
220 CMeshFEM::CMeshFEM(CGeometry* geometry, CConfig* config) {
221  /*--- Allocate the memory for blasFunctions. ---*/
222  blasFunctions = new CBlasStructure;
223 
224  /*--- The new FEM mesh class has the same problem dimension/zone. ---*/
225  nDim = geometry->GetnDim();
226  nZone = geometry->GetnZone();
227 
228  /*--- Determine the number of variables stored per DOF. ---*/
229  /*--- This is specifically taylored towards perfect gas computations ---*/
230  /*--- and must be generalized later. As this number is also needed ---*/
231  /*--- in the solver, it is worthwhile to create a separate function ---*/
232  /*--- for this purpose. ---*/
233  MAIN_SOLVER Kind_Solver = config->GetKind_Solver();
234  const bool compressible = (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER) ||
235  (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_NAVIER_STOKES) || (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_RANS) ||
236  (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_LES);
237 
238  unsigned short nVar;
239  if (compressible)
240  nVar = nDim + 2;
241  else
242  nVar = nDim + 1;
243 
244  /*--- Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
245  of the points. ---*/
246  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
247  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < geometry->GetnPoint(); ++i)
248  globalPointIDToLocalInd[geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(i)] = i;
249 
250  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
251  /*--- Step 1: Communicate the elements and the boundary elements to the ---*/
252  /*--- ranks where they will be stored during the computation. ---*/
253  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
254 
255  /*--- Determine the ranks to which I have to send my elements. ---*/
256  vector<int> sendToRank(size, 0);
257 
258  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
259  sendToRank[geometry->elem[i]->GetColor()] = 1;
260  }
261 
262  map<int, int> rankToIndCommBuf;
263  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
264  if (sendToRank[i]) {
265  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
266  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
267  }
268  }
269 
270  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to send the element data
271  to the correct ranks. ---*/
272  int nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
273  vector<vector<short> > shortSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<short>(0));
274  vector<vector<long> > longSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<long>(0));
275  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<su2double>(0));
276 
277  /*--- The first element of longSendBuf will contain the number of elements, which
278  are stored in the communication buffers. Initialize this value to 0. ---*/
279  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
280 
281  /*--- Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. ---*/
282  int nRankRecv = nRankSend;
283 
284 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
285  vector<int> sizeRecv(size, 1);
286 
287  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
288 #endif
289 
290  /*--- Loop over the local elements to fill the communication buffers with element data. ---*/
291  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
292  int ind = (int)geometry->elem[i]->GetColor();
293  map<int, int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
294  ind = MI->second;
295 
296  ++longSendBuf[ind][0]; /* The number of elements in the buffers must be incremented. */
297 
298  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetVTK_Type());
299  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolyGrid());
300  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolySol());
301  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
302  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsSol());
303  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces());
304  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetTimeLevel());
305  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back((short)geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConsideredConstant());
306 
307  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalElemID());
308  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalOffsetDOFsSol());
309 
310  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
311  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNode(j));
312 
313  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j)
314  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNeighbor_Elements(j));
315 
316  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j) {
317  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetPeriodicIndex(j));
318  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back((short)geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConstantFace(j));
319  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back((short)geometry->elem[i]->GetOwnerFace(j));
320  }
321 
322  doubleSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetLengthScale());
323  }
324 
325  /*--- Determine for each rank to which I have to send elements the data of
326  the corresponding nodes. ---*/
327  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
328  /*--- Determine the vector with node IDs in the connectivity
329  of the elements for this rank. ---*/
330  vector<long> nodeIDs;
331 
332  unsigned long indL = 3;
333  unsigned long indS = 3;
334  for (long j = 0; j < longSendBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
335  short nDOFsGrid = shortSendBuf[i][indS], nFaces = shortSendBuf[i][indS + 2];
336  indS += 3 * nFaces + 8;
337 
338  for (short k = 0; k < nDOFsGrid; ++k, ++indL) nodeIDs.push_back(longSendBuf[i][indL]);
339  indL += nFaces + 2;
340  }
341 
342  /*--- Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. ---*/
343  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
344  auto lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
345  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
346 
347  /*--- Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]. ---*/
348  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
349  longSendBuf[i].insert(longSendBuf[i].end(), nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
350 
351  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
352  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
353  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
354  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j]);
355 
356  if (LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end()) SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
357 
358  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
359  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->nodes->GetCoord(ind, l));
360  }
361  }
362 
363  /*--- Loop over the boundaries to send the boundary data to the appropriate rank. ---*/
364  nMarker = geometry->GetnMarker();
365  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
366  /* Store the current indices in the longSendBuf, which are used to store the
367  number of boundary elements sent to this rank. Initialize this value to 0. */
368  vector<long> indLongBuf(nRankSend);
369  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
370  indLongBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i].size();
371  longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
372  }
373 
374  /* Loop over the local boundary elements in geometry for this marker. */
375  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); ++i) {
376  /* Determine the local ID of the corresponding domain element. */
377  unsigned long elemID = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement() - geometry->beg_node[rank];
378 
379  /* Determine to which rank this boundary element must be sent.
380  That is the same as its corresponding domain element.
381  Update the corresponding index in longSendBuf. */
382  int ind = (int)geometry->elem[elemID]->GetColor();
383  map<int, int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
384  ind = MI->second;
385 
386  ++longSendBuf[ind][indLongBuf[ind]];
387 
388  /* Get the donor information for the wall function treatment. */
389  const unsigned short nDonors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
390  const unsigned long* donors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
391 
392  /* Store the data for this boundary element in the communication buffers. */
393  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetVTK_Type());
394  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNPolyGrid());
395  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
396  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(nDonors);
397 
398  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement());
399  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetGlobalElemID());
400 
401  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
402  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNode(j));
403 
404  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDonors; ++j) longSendBuf[ind].push_back(donors[j]);
405  }
406  }
407 
408  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to receive
409  the element data from the other correct ranks. ---*/
410  vector<vector<short> > shortRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<short>(0));
411  vector<vector<long> > longRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
412  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<su2double>(0));
413 
414  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
415  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
416  map<int, int>::const_iterator MI;
417 
418 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
419 
420  /*--- Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
421  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(3 * nRankSend);
422  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
423 
424  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
425  int dest = MI->first;
426  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT, dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
427  &commReqs[3 * i]);
428  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG, dest, dest + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
429  &commReqs[3 * i + 1]);
430  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, dest, dest + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
431  &commReqs[3 * i + 2]);
432  }
433 
434  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
435  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
436  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
437  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
438  SU2_MPI::Status status;
439  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
440  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
441 
442  int sizeMess;
443  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
444 
445  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
446  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
447  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT, source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
448 
449  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
450  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
451  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
452  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
453  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
454 
455  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG, source, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
456 
457  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
458  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
459  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
460  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
461 
462  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE, source, rank + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
463  }
464 
465  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
466  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3 * nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
467 
468  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
469  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
470  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
471 
472 #else
473 
474  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. ---*/
475  shortRecvBuf[0] = shortSendBuf[0];
476  longRecvBuf[0] = longSendBuf[0];
477  doubleRecvBuf[0] = doubleSendBuf[0];
478 
479 #endif
480 
481  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
482  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
483  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
484  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
485  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
486  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
487  }
488 
489  /*--- Allocate the memory for the number of elements for every boundary
490  marker and initialize them to zero. ---*/
491  nElem_Bound = new unsigned long[nMarker];
492  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nMarker; ++i) nElem_Bound[i] = 0;
493 
494  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the elements stored on this rank.
495  Sort them in increasing order, such that an easy search can be done.
496  In the same loop determine the upper bound for the local nodes (without
497  halos) and the number of boundary elements for every marker. ---*/
498  nElem = nPoint = 0;
499  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) nElem += longRecvBuf[i][0];
500 
501  vector<unsigned long> globalElemID;
502  globalElemID.reserve(nElem);
503 
504  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
505  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
506  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
507  globalElemID.push_back(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
508 
509  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 3];
510  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 5];
511  indS += 3 * nFaces + 8;
512  indL += nDOFsGrid + nFaces + 2;
513  }
514 
515  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
516  nPoint += nNodesThisRank;
517  indL += nNodesThisRank + 1;
518 
519  for (unsigned iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
520  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
521  ++indL;
522  nElem_Bound[iMarker] += nBoundElemThisRank;
523 
524  for (long j = 0; j < nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
525  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 2];
526  short nDonorsWallFunction = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 3];
527  indS += 4;
528  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + nDonorsWallFunction + 2;
529  }
530  }
531  }
532 
533  sort(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end());
534 
535  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the halo elements. A vector of
536  CUnsignedLong2T is used for this purpose, such that a possible periodic
537  transformation can be taken into account. Neighbors with a periodic
538  transformation will always become a halo element, even if the element
539  is stored on this rank. Furthermore a vector of CReorderElements
540  is created for the owned elements to be able to reorder the elements,
541  see step 2 below. ---*/
542  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> haloElements;
543  vector<CReorderElements> ownedElements;
544  unsigned short maxTimeLevelLoc = 0;
545 
546  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
547  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
548  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
549  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
550  unsigned short VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS];
551  unsigned short nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 2];
552  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 3];
553  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 5];
554  unsigned short timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 6];
555  bool JacConstant = (bool)shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 7];
556  bool commSol = false;
557 
558  /* If the integration rule for constant and non-constant Jacobian
559  elements is the same, simply set JacConstant to false, such that
560  the elements with constant and non-constant Jacobians are
561  considered the same. */
562  if (JacConstant) {
563  const auto orderExactStraight = (unsigned short)ceil(nPolySol * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
564  const auto orderExactCurved = (unsigned short)ceil(nPolySol * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
565  if (orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) JacConstant = false;
566  }
567 
568  /* Update the local value of the maximum time level. */
569  maxTimeLevelLoc = max(maxTimeLevelLoc, timeLevel);
570 
571  /*--- Loop over the faces of this element to determine the halo elements
572  and the information needed to reorder the owned elements. ---*/
573  indS += 8;
574  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
575  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nFaces; ++k, indS += 3, ++indL) {
576  if (longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) { /* -1 indicates a boundary face. */
577 
578  /* Check if the neighbor of the face is also an owned element.
579  Per definition an element for which a periodic transformation
580  is carried out, is a halo element, even if the parent element
581  is stored locally. */
582  bool neighborIsInternal = false;
583  if (shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1) { /* -1 indicates no periodic transformation. */
584  neighborIsInternal = binary_search(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end(), longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
585  }
586 
587  /* Check if this neighbor is not internal and if the element owns the face. */
588  if (!neighborIsInternal) {
589  if (shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 2]) {
590  /* The face is owned by this element. As the neighboring element
591  is not owned, this implies that a halo element must be created. */
592  haloElements.emplace_back(longRecvBuf[i][indL],
593  shortRecvBuf[i][indS] + 1); /* The +1, because haloElements */
594  } /* are unsigned longs. */
595  else {
596  /* The face is not owned by this element and therefore it is owned
597  by the neighboring element on a different rank. Consequently the
598  solution of this element must be communicated. */
599  commSol = true;
600  }
601  }
602  }
603  }
604 
605  /* Store the required data for this element in ownedElements. */
606  ownedElements.emplace_back(globalID, timeLevel, commSol, VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacConstant);
607  }
608 
609  /* Skip the part with the node numbers. */
610  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
611  indL += nNodesThisRank + 1;
612 
613  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
614  for (unsigned iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
615  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
616  ++indL;
617 
618  /* Loop over the boundary elements coming from this rank. */
619  for (long j = 0; j < nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
620  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 2];
621  short nDonorsWallFunctions = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 3];
622  indS += 4;
623  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + 2;
624 
625  /* Loop over the donors for the wall functions. */
626  for (short k = 0; k < nDonorsWallFunctions; ++k, ++indL) {
627  /* Check for an external donor. If external, store it in
628  haloElements with no periodic transformation. */
629  if (!binary_search(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end(), longRecvBuf[i][indL]))
630  haloElements.emplace_back(longRecvBuf[i][indL], 0);
631  }
632  }
633  }
634  }
635 
636  /* Sort the halo elements in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
637  sort(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
638  auto lastHalo = unique(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
639  haloElements.erase(lastHalo, haloElements.end());
640 
641  /* Determine the maximum global time level and possibly reset the number
642  of time levels in config. */
643  unsigned short maxTimeLevelGlob = maxTimeLevelLoc;
644 
645 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
646  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&maxTimeLevelLoc, &maxTimeLevelGlob, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
647 #endif
648 
649  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = maxTimeLevelGlob + 1;
650  config->SetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS(nTimeLevels);
651 
652  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
653  /*--- Step 2: Find out on which rank the halo elements are stored. ---*/
654  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
655 
656  /* Determine the number of owned elements and the total number of
657  elements stored on this rank. */
658  nVolElemOwned = globalElemID.size();
659  nVolElemTot = nVolElemOwned + haloElements.size();
660 
661  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
662  sequence of ownedElements. */
663  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> mapGlobalElemIDToInd;
664  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
665 
666  /* Determine the number of elements per rank of the originally partitioned grid
667  stored in cumulative storage format. */
668  vector<unsigned long> nElemPerRankOr(size + 1);
669 
670  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nElemPerRankOr[i] = geometry->beg_node[i];
671  nElemPerRankOr[size] = geometry->end_node[size - 1];
672 
673  /* Determine to which ranks I have to send messages to find out the information
674  of the halos stored on this rank. */
675  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
676 
677  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < haloElements.size(); ++i) {
678  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
679  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
680  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(), haloElements[i].long0);
681  unsigned long rankHalo = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
682  if (*low > haloElements[i].long0) --rankHalo;
683 
684  sendToRank[rankHalo] = 1;
685  }
686 
687  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
688  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
689  if (sendToRank[i]) {
690  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
691  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
692  }
693  }
694 
695  /* Resize the first index of the long send buffers for the communication of
696  the halo data. */
697  nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
698  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
699 
700  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
701  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
702 
703 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
704  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
705 #endif
706 
707  /* Loop over the local halo elements to fill the communication buffers. */
708  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < haloElements.size(); ++i) {
709  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
710  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
711  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(), haloElements[i].long0);
712  unsigned long ind = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
713  if (*low > haloElements[i].long0) --ind;
714 
715  /* Convert this rank to the index in the send buffer. */
716  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find((int)ind);
717  ind = MI->second;
718 
719  /* Store the global element ID and the periodic index in the long buffer.
720  The subtraction of 1 is there to obtain the correct periodic index.
721  In haloElements a +1 is added, because this variable is of unsigned long,
722  which cannot handle negative numbers. */
723  long perIndex = haloElements[i].long1 - 1;
724 
725  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(haloElements[i].long0);
726  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(perIndex);
727  }
728 
729  /* Define a second set of long receive buffers, because the information from
730  the first set is still needed later on. Also define the vector to
731  store the ranks from which the message came. */
732  vector<vector<long> > longSecondRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
733  vector<int> sourceRank(nRankRecv);
734 
735  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
736  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
737 
738 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
739 
740  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
741  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
742  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
743 
744  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
745  int dest = MI->first;
746  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG, dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
747  &commReqs[i]);
748  }
749 
750  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
751  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
752  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
753  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
754  SU2_MPI::Status status;
755  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
756  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
757 
758  int sizeMess;
759  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
760 
761  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
762  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG, sourceRank[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
763  }
764 
765  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
766  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
767 
768 #else
769 
770  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
771  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
772 
773 #endif
774 
775  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
776  is deleted, the swap function is used. Afterwards resize the first index
777  of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this number of messages must
778  be sent back to the sending ranks with halo information. ---*/
779  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
780  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
781  }
782 
783  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
784 
785 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
786  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
787  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
788  commReqs.resize(nRankRecv);
789 #endif
790 
791  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill and send the send buffers again. ---*/
792  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
793  /* Determine the number of elements present in longSecondRecvBuf[i] and
794  reserve the memory for the send buffer. */
795  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size() / 2;
796  longSendBuf[i].reserve(3 * nElemBuf);
797 
798  /* Loop over the elements stored in the receive buffer. */
799  for (long j = 0; j < nElemBuf; ++j) {
800  /* Get the global element ID and periodic index from the receive buffer. */
801  const long globalID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2 * j];
802  const long perInd = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2 * j + 1];
803 
804  /* Determine the local index of the element in the original partitioning.
805  Check if the index is valid. */
806  const long localID = globalID - geometry->beg_node[rank];
807  if (localID < 0 || localID >= (long)geometry->nPointLinear[rank]) {
808  ostringstream message;
809  message << localID << " " << geometry->nPointLinear[rank] << endl;
810  message << "Invalid local element ID";
811  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
812  }
813 
814  /* Determine which rank owns this element and store everything in the
815  send buffer. */
816  longSendBuf[i].push_back(globalID);
817  longSendBuf[i].push_back(perInd);
818  longSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->elem[localID]->GetColor());
819  }
820 
821  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
822  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
823 
824  /*--- Send the send buffer back to the calling rank.
825  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
826 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
827  int dest = sourceRank[i];
828  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG, dest, dest + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
829  &commReqs[i]);
830 #endif
831  }
832 
833  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSend, such that
834  the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
835  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
836 
837  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
838  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
839 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
840 
841  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
842  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
843  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
844  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
845  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
846  SU2_MPI::Status status;
847  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
848  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
849 
850  int sizeMess;
851  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
852 
853  /* Allocate the memory for the long receive buffer and receive the message. */
854  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
855  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG, source, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
856  }
857 
858  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks, because
859  wild cards have been used. */
860  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
861  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
862 
863 #else
864 
865  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
866  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
867 
868 #endif
869 
870  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
871  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
872  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
873 
874  /* Copy the data from the receive buffers into a class of CLong3T, such that
875  it can be sorted in increasing order. Note that the rank of the element
876  is stored first, followed by its global ID and last the periodic index. */
877  vector<CLong3T> haloData;
878  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
879  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size() / 3;
880 
881  for (long j = 0; j < nElemBuf; ++j) {
882  const long j3 = 3 * j;
883  haloData.emplace_back(longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3 + 2], longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3], longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3 + 1]);
884  }
885 
886  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
887  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
888  }
889 
890  /* Sort halo data in increasing order. */
891  sort(haloData.begin(), haloData.end());
892 
893  /* Determine the number of halo elements per rank in cumulative storage.
894  The first element of this vector is nVolElemOwned, such that this vector
895  contains the starting position in the vector volElem. */
896  vector<unsigned long> nHaloElemPerRank(size + 1, 0);
897  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < haloData.size(); ++i) ++nHaloElemPerRank[haloData[i].long0 + 1];
898 
899  nHaloElemPerRank[0] = nVolElemOwned;
900  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) nHaloElemPerRank[i + 1] += nHaloElemPerRank[i];
901 
902  if (nHaloElemPerRank[size] != nVolElemTot)
903  SU2_MPI::Error("Inconsistency in total number of volume elements", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
904 
905  /* Determine the number of ranks to which I have to send data in this cycle. */
906  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
907  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
908  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
909  if (nHaloElemPerRank[i + 1] > nHaloElemPerRank[i]) {
910  sendToRank[i] = 1;
911  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
912  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
913  }
914  }
915 
916  nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
917 
918  /* Store the value of nRankSend for later use. */
919  const int nRankSendHaloInfo = nRankSend;
920 
921  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
922  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
923 
924 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
925  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
926 #endif
927 
928  /* Copy the data to be sent to the send buffers. */
929  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
930  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
931 
932  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
933  int dest = MI->first;
934  for (unsigned long j = nHaloElemPerRank[dest]; j < nHaloElemPerRank[dest + 1]; ++j) {
935  const unsigned long jj = j - nVolElemOwned;
936  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long1);
937  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long2);
938  }
939  }
940 
941  /* Resize the first index of the long receive buffer. */
942  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
943 
944  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
945  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
946 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
947 
948  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
949  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
950  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
951 
952  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
953  int dest = MI->first;
954  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG, dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
955  &commReqs[i]);
956  }
957 
958  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
959  sourceRank.resize(nRankRecv);
960 
961  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
962  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
963  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
964  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
965  SU2_MPI::Status status;
966  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
967  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
968 
969  int sizeMess;
970  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
971 
972  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
973  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG, sourceRank[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
974  }
975 
976  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks,
977  because wild cards have been used. */
978  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
979  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
980 
981 #else
982 
983  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
984  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
985 
986 #endif
987 
988  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
989  is deleted, the swap function is used. */
990  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
991  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
992  }
993 
994  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to flag the locally owned elements for
995  communication. Although the face information has already been used to
996  do this when ownedElements are constructed, elements that are donors
997  for the wall function treatment and are not direct neighbors may
998  have been missed. ---*/
999  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1000  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size() / 2;
1001  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nElemBuf; ++j) {
1002  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2 * j];
1003 
1004  auto MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1005  if (MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1006  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1007 
1008  ownedElements[MMI->second].SetCommSolution(true);
1009  }
1010  }
1011 
1012  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1013  /*--- Step 3: Determine the numbering of the owned elements. The following ---*/
1014  /*--- criteria are used for the owned elements. ---*/
1015  /*--- - Time level of the element: elements with the smallest time ---*/
1016  /*--- level are number first, etc. ---*/
1017  /*--- - For each time level the elements that do not need to send ---*/
1018  /*--- their data are numbered first, followed by the elements ---*/
1019  /*--- that must send their data to other ranks. Note that not ---*/
1020  /*--- sending the solution does not mean that the residual can ---*/
1021  /*--- be built without communication. It is possible that a face ---*/
1022  /*--- is owned by a local element, but it is adjacent to an ---*/
1023  /*--- element owned by a different rank. In that case the data ---*/
1024  /*--- from the neighboring element is communicated and stored in ---*/
1025  /*--- a halo element. However, the residual of these internal ---*/
1026  /*--- elements do not receive a contribution computed on a ---*/
1027  /*--- different rank. ---*/
1028  /*--- - Some of the elements that do not need to send their data ---*/
1029  /*--- to other ranks may still be put in that part to increase ---*/
1030  /*--- the efficiency when treating element simultaneously, see ---*/
1031  /*--- next point. ---*/
1032  /*--- - Elements of the same type are put contiguously in memory ---*/
1033  /*--- as much as possible to facilitate the simultaneous ---*/
1034  /*--- treatment in the matrix multiplications to increase ---*/
1035  /*--- performance. ---*/
1036  /*--- - A reverse Cuthill McKee renumbering takes place to obtain ---*/
1037  /*--- better cache performance for the face residuals. ---*/
1038  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1039 
1040  /* Determine the number of elements/faces that are treated simultaneously */
1041  /* in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
1042  const unsigned short nElemSimul = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding() / nVar;
1043 
1044  /* Determine the number of different element types present. */
1045  map<unsigned short, unsigned short> mapElemTypeToInd;
1046  for (auto OEI = ownedElements.begin(); OEI != ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1047  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1048 
1049  if (mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType) == mapElemTypeToInd.end()) {
1050  const unsigned short ind = mapElemTypeToInd.size();
1051  mapElemTypeToInd[elType] = ind;
1052  }
1053  }
1054 
1055  /* Determine the number of elements per element type per time level.
1056  Make a distinction between internal elements (elements that are not
1057  communicated) and elements that are communicated. Later on these vectors
1058  will be put in cumulative storage format, which explains the +1 for
1059  the second index. */
1060  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nInternalElem(nTimeLevels, vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size() + 1));
1061  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nCommElem(nTimeLevels, vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size() + 1));
1062  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) {
1063  for (unsigned long j = 0; j <= mapElemTypeToInd.size(); ++j) {
1064  nInternalElem[i][j] = 0;
1065  nCommElem[i][j] = 0;
1066  }
1067  }
1068 
1069  for (auto OEI = ownedElements.begin(); OEI != ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1070  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1071  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1072  unsigned short ind = MI->second + 1;
1073 
1074  if (OEI->GetCommSolution())
1075  ++nCommElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1076  else
1077  ++nInternalElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1078  }
1079 
1080  /* Loop again over the owned elements and check if elements, which do not
1081  have to send their solution, should be flagged as such in order to improve
1082  the gemm performance. */
1083  for (auto OEI = ownedElements.begin(); OEI != ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1084  /* Check for an internal element, i.e. an element for which the solution
1085  does not need to be communicated. */
1086  if (!OEI->GetCommSolution()) {
1087  /* Determine the time level and the index of the element type. */
1088  const unsigned short tLev = OEI->GetTimeLevel();
1089 
1090  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1091  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1092  const unsigned short ind = MI->second + 1;
1093 
1094  /* Determine whether or not this element must be moved from internal to
1095  comm elements to improve performance. Change the appropriate data
1096  when this must happen. */
1097  if (nInternalElem[tLev][ind] % nElemSimul && nCommElem[tLev][ind] % nElemSimul) {
1098  OEI->SetCommSolution(true);
1099  --nInternalElem[tLev][ind];
1100  ++nCommElem[tLev][ind];
1101  }
1102  }
1103  }
1104 
1105  /* Check whether there are enough elements in every partition for every
1106  time level to guarantee a good gemm performance. */
1107  unsigned long nFullChunks = 0, nPartialChunks = 0;
1108  for (unsigned short tLev = 0; tLev < nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1109  for (unsigned long j = 1; j < nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1110  nFullChunks += nInternalElem[tLev][j] / nElemSimul;
1111  if (nInternalElem[tLev][j] % nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1112  }
1113 
1114  for (unsigned long j = 1; j < nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1115  nFullChunks += nCommElem[tLev][j] / nElemSimul;
1116  if (nCommElem[tLev][j] % nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1117  }
1118  }
1119 
1120  unsigned long tooManyPartChunksLoc = 0;
1121  if (5 * nPartialChunks >= (nPartialChunks + nFullChunks)) tooManyPartChunksLoc = 1;
1122 
1123  /* Determine the number of ranks which contain too many partial chunks.
1124  The result only needs to be known on the master node. */
1125  unsigned long nRanksTooManyPartChunks = tooManyPartChunksLoc;
1126 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1127  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&tooManyPartChunksLoc, &nRanksTooManyPartChunks, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE,
1128  SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1129 #endif
1130 
1131  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (nRanksTooManyPartChunks != 0) && (size > 1)) {
1132  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1133  cout << "There are " << nRanksTooManyPartChunks << " partitions for which "
1134  << " the simultaneous treatment of volume elements is not optimal." << endl;
1135  cout << "This could lead to a significant load imbalance." << endl;
1136  }
1137 
1138  /* Put nInternalElem and nCommElem in cumulative storage format. */
1139  for (unsigned short tLev = 0; tLev < nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1140  if (tLev) nInternalElem[tLev][0] = nCommElem[tLev - 1].back();
1141  for (unsigned long j = 1; j < nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j) nInternalElem[tLev][j] += nInternalElem[tLev][j - 1];
1142 
1143  nCommElem[tLev][0] = nInternalElem[tLev].back();
1144  for (unsigned long j = 1; j < nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j) nCommElem[tLev][j] += nCommElem[tLev][j - 1];
1145  }
1146 
1147  /* In the solver only the number of elements per time level is needed.
1148  The number of owned elements, nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel, is stored in
1149  cumulative storage format and can be retrieved easily from nCommElem.
1150  The number of internal elements per time level is stored normally and
1151  can be retrieved from nInternalElem. */
1152  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels + 1);
1153  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
1154 
1155  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0] = 0;
1156  for (unsigned short tLev = 0; tLev < nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1157  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[tLev + 1] = nCommElem[tLev].back();
1158  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[tLev] = nInternalElem[tLev].back() - nInternalElem[tLev][0];
1159  }
1160 
1161  /* Sort the elements of ownedElements in increasing order. */
1162  sort(ownedElements.begin(), ownedElements.end());
1163 
1164  /* At the moment the elements are sorted per time level and element type. */
1165  /* This is in principle enough to make to code work with the simultaneous */
1166  /* treatment for volume elements. Below follows a renumbering within the */
1167  /* time level and element type (Reverse Cuthill-McKee), such that a better */
1168  /* cache performance is obtained for the surface elements. For high order */
1169  /* elements this effect is probably marginal. */
1170 
1171  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
1172  sequence of ownedElements. */
1173  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1174  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
1175 
1176  /*--- Create the graph of local elements. The halo elements are ignored. ---*/
1177  vector<vector<unsigned long> > neighElem(nVolElemOwned, vector<unsigned long>(0));
1178 
1179  nRankRecv = (int)longRecvBuf.size();
1180  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1181  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
1182  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1183  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
1184  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 3];
1185  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 5];
1186 
1187  auto MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(globalID);
1188  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1189 
1190  indS += 8;
1191  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
1192  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nFaces; ++k, indS += 3, ++indL) {
1193  if ((longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) && (shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1)) { // Check for internal owned node.
1194 
1195  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
1196  if (MMI != mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end()) neighElem[ind].push_back(MMI->second);
1197  }
1198  }
1199  }
1200  }
1201 
1202  /* Sort the neighbors of each element in increasing order. */
1203  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) sort(neighElem[i].begin(), neighElem[i].end());
1204 
1205  /* Define the vector, which contains the new numbering of the owned elements
1206  w.r.t. to the numbering currently stored in ownedElements. Note that signed
1207  longs are used for this purpose, because the vector is initialized with -1
1208  to indicate that no new number has been assigned yet. */
1209  vector<long> oldElemToNewElem(nVolElemOwned, -1);
1210 
1211  /*--- While loop to carry out the renumbering. A while loop is present,
1212  because the local partition may not be contiguous. ---*/
1213  unsigned long nElemRenumbered = 0;
1214  while (nElemRenumbered < nVolElemOwned) {
1215  /* Determine the first element in the list that has not been renumbered. */
1216  unsigned long indBeg;
1217  for (indBeg = 0; indBeg < nVolElemOwned; ++indBeg)
1218  if (oldElemToNewElem[indBeg] == -1) break;
1219 
1220  /* Determine the time level and element type of the element indBeg and
1221  determine the element range in which the starting element for the
1222  renumbering must be sought. */
1223  unsigned short timeLevel = ownedElements[indBeg].GetTimeLevel();
1224  unsigned short elType = ownedElements[indBeg].GetElemType();
1225 
1226  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1227  unsigned short ind = MI->second;
1228 
1229  unsigned long indEnd;
1230  if (ownedElements[indBeg].GetCommSolution())
1231  indEnd = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind + 1];
1232  else
1233  indEnd = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind + 1];
1234 
1235  /* Determine the element in the range [indBeg,indEnd) with the least number
1236  of neighbors that has not been renumbered yet. This is the starting
1237  element for the current renumbering round. */
1238  for (unsigned long i = (indBeg + 1); i < indEnd; ++i) {
1239  if ((oldElemToNewElem[i] == -1) && (neighElem[i].size() < neighElem[indBeg].size())) indBeg = i;
1240  }
1241 
1242  /* Start of the Reverse Cuthil McKee renumbering. */
1243  vector<unsigned long> frontElements(1, indBeg);
1244  while (!frontElements.empty()) {
1245  /* Vector, which stores the front for the next round. */
1246  vector<unsigned long> frontElementsNew;
1247 
1248  /* Loop over the elements of the current front. */
1249  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < frontElements.size(); ++i) {
1250  /* Carry out the renumbering for this element. */
1251  const unsigned long iFront = frontElements[i];
1252 
1253  timeLevel = ownedElements[iFront].GetTimeLevel();
1254  elType = ownedElements[iFront].GetElemType();
1255  MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1256  ind = MI->second;
1257 
1258  if (ownedElements[iFront].GetCommSolution())
1259  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1260  else
1261  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1262 
1263  /* Store the neighbors that have not been renumbered yet in the front
1264  for the next round. Set its index to -2 to indicate that the element
1265  is already on the new front. */
1266  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < neighElem[iFront].size(); ++j) {
1267  if (oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] == -1) {
1268  frontElementsNew.push_back(neighElem[iFront][j]);
1269  oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] = -2;
1270  }
1271  }
1272  }
1273 
1274  /* Update the counter nElemRenumbered. */
1275  nElemRenumbered += frontElements.size();
1276 
1277  /* Sort frontElementsNew in increasing order. */
1278  sort(frontElementsNew.begin(), frontElementsNew.end());
1279 
1280  /* Store the new front elements in frontElements for the next round. */
1281  frontElements = frontElementsNew;
1282  }
1283  }
1284 
1285  if (nElemRenumbered != nVolElemOwned) SU2_MPI::Error("Something went wrong in the renumbering", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1286 
1287  /* Determine the final mapping from the global element number to the local
1288  entry for the owned elements. First clear mapGlobalElemIDToInd before
1289  it can be used to store its correct content. */
1290  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1291  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1292  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = oldElemToNewElem[i];
1293 
1294  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1295  /*--- Step 4: Store the elements, nodes and boundary elements in the data ---*/
1296  /*--- structures used by the FEM solver. ---*/
1297  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1298 
1299  /*--- Check in parallel mode for empty partitions. If present, print a warning.
1300  The solver is capable of handling empty partitions, but it may not be
1301  efficient. ---*/
1302 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1303  unsigned long thisPartitionEmpty = nVolElemOwned ? 0 : 1;
1304  unsigned long nEmptyPartitions = 0;
1305 
1306  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&thisPartitionEmpty, &nEmptyPartitions, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE,
1307  SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1308 
1309  if (rank == MASTER_NODE && nEmptyPartitions) {
1310  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1311  cout << "There are " << nEmptyPartitions << " empty partitions present." << endl;
1312  cout << "SU2 is able to handle this, but it may be inefficient." << endl << endl;
1313  }
1314 #endif
1315 
1316  /*--- Allocate the memory for the volume elements, the nodes
1317  and the surface elements of the boundaries. ---*/
1318  volElem.resize(nVolElemTot);
1319  meshPoints.reserve(nPoint);
1320 
1321  boundaries.resize(nMarker);
1322  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1323  boundaries[iMarker].markerTag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
1324  boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY;
1325  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.reserve(nElem_Bound[iMarker]);
1326  }
1327 
1328  /*--- Copy the data from the communication buffers. ---*/
1329  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1330  /* The data for the volume elements. Loop over these elements in the buffer. */
1331  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1332  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1333  /* Determine the location in volElem where this data must be stored. */
1334  unsigned long elemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1335  auto MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1336  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1337 
1338  /* Store the data. */
1339  volElem[ind].elemIsOwned = true;
1340  volElem[ind].rankOriginal = rank;
1341  volElem[ind].periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1342 
1343  volElem[ind].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1344  volElem[ind].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1345  volElem[ind].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1346  volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1347  volElem[ind].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1348  volElem[ind].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1349  volElem[ind].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1350 
1351  volElem[ind].JacIsConsideredConstant = (bool)shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1352 
1353  volElem[ind].elemIDGlobal = elemID;
1354  volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1355 
1356  volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid);
1357  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1358  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1359 
1360  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid; ++k) volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1361 
1362  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[ind].nFaces; ++k) {
1363  long neighBorID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1364 
1365  ++indS; // At this location the periodic index of the face is stored in
1366  // shortRecvBuf, which is not stored in volElem.
1367  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool)shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1368  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = (bool)shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1369 
1370  if (neighBorID == -1) volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = true; // Boundary faces are always owned.
1371  }
1372 
1373  volElem[ind].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1374  }
1375 
1376  /* The data for the nodes. Loop over these nodes in the buffer and store
1377  them in meshPoints. */
1378  unsigned long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1379  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nNodesThisRank; ++j) {
1380  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1381  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1382  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1383  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k) thisPoint.coor[k] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1384 
1385  meshPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1386  }
1387 
1388  /* The data for the boundary markers. Loop over them. */
1389  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1390  unsigned long nElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1391  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nElemThisRank; ++j) {
1392  CSurfaceElementFEM thisSurfElem;
1393 
1394  thisSurfElem.VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1395  thisSurfElem.nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1396  thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1397  const short nDonors = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1398 
1399  thisSurfElem.volElemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1400  thisSurfElem.boundElemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1401 
1402  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid.resize(thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid);
1403  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1404  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1405 
1406  indL += nDonors;
1407 
1408  /* Convert the global volume element ID to the local one.
1409  It is essential to do this before the sorting. */
1410  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI;
1411  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(thisSurfElem.volElemID);
1412  thisSurfElem.volElemID = MMI->second;
1413 
1414  /* Store the surface element in the data structure for this boundary. */
1415  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.push_back(thisSurfElem);
1416  }
1417  }
1418  }
1419 
1420  /* Sort meshPoints in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1421  sort(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1422  auto lastPoint = unique(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1423  meshPoints.erase(lastPoint, meshPoints.end());
1424 
1425  /* Clear the contents of the map globalPointIDToLocalInd and fill
1426  it with the information present in meshPoints. */
1427  globalPointIDToLocalInd.clear();
1428  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < meshPoints.size(); ++i) globalPointIDToLocalInd[meshPoints[i].globalID] = i;
1429 
1430  /*--- All the data from the receive buffers has been copied in the local
1431  data structures. Release the memory of the receive buffers. To make
1432  sure that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1433  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1434  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1435  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1436  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1437  }
1438 
1439  /*--- Sort the surface elements of the boundaries in increasing order. ---*/
1440  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker)
1441  sort(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.begin(), boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.end());
1442 
1443  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1444  /*--- Step 5: Obtain the information of the halo elements, which are ---*/
1445  /*--- sorted per time level and afterwards per rank, where the ---*/
1446  /*--- sequence is determined by the numbering on the sending rank. ---*/
1447  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1448 
1449  /*--- Resize the first index of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this
1450  number of messages must be sent back to the sending ranks with halo
1451  information. ---*/
1452  nRankRecv = (int)longSecondRecvBuf.size();
1453  shortSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1454  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1455  doubleSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1456 
1457 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1458  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
1459  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
1460  commReqs.resize(3 * nRankRecv);
1461 #endif
1462 
1463  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill the send buffers again. ---*/
1464  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1465  /* Loop over the elements in this receive buffer to determine the local
1466  index on this rank. Note that also the periodic index must be stored,
1467  hence use an CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. As -1 cannot be stored
1468  for an unsigned long a 1 is added to the periodic transformation. */
1469  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size() / 2;
1470  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> elemBuf(nElemBuf);
1471 
1472  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nElemBuf; ++j) {
1473  const unsigned long j2 = 2 * j;
1474 
1475  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2];
1476  auto MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1477  if (MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1478  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1479 
1480  elemBuf[j].long0 = MMI->second;
1481  elemBuf[j].long1 = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2 + 1] + 1;
1482  }
1483 
1484  /* Release the memory of the long receive buffer via the swap function
1485  and sort elemBuf in increasing order. */
1486  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
1487 
1488  sort(elemBuf.begin(), elemBuf.end());
1489 
1490  /* Store the number of elements in the first element of the long send buffer. */
1491  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nElemBuf);
1492 
1493  /* Vector with node IDs that must be returned to this calling rank.
1494  Note that also the periodic index must be stored, hence use an
1495  CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. */
1496  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> nodeIDs;
1497 
1498  /* Loop over the elements to fill the send buffers. */
1499  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nElemBuf; ++j) {
1500  /* Store the global element ID in the long buffer,
1501  the periodic index in the short send buffer and
1502  the length scale in the double send buffer. */
1503  const unsigned long indV = elemBuf[j].long0;
1504  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal);
1505 
1506  const short perIndex = (short)elemBuf[j].long1 - 1; // Note the -1.
1507  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(perIndex);
1508 
1509  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].lenScale);
1510 
1511  /* Store the other relevant information of this element in the short
1512  and long communication buffers. Also store the node IDs and the
1513  periodic transformation in nodeIDs. */
1514  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].VTK_Type);
1515  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolyGrid);
1516  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolySol);
1517  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1518  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsSol);
1519  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1520  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].timeLevel);
1521 
1522  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
1523  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k]);
1524  nodeIDs.emplace_back(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k], elemBuf[j].long1);
1525  }
1526 
1527  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1528  shortSendBuf[i].push_back((short)volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k]);
1529  }
1530 
1531  /* Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1532  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1533  auto lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1534  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
1535 
1536  /* Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]
1537  and the periodix index to shortSendBuf. Note again the -1 for the
1538  periodic index, because an unsigned long cannot represent -1, the
1539  value for the periodic index when no peridicity is present. */
1540  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
1541  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1542  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1543  shortSendBuf[i].push_back((short)nodeIDs[j].long1 - 1);
1544  }
1545 
1546  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
1547  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1548  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
1549  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1550 
1551  if (LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end()) SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1552 
1553  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
1554  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(meshPoints[ind].coor[l]);
1555  }
1556 
1557  /*--- Send the communication buffers back to the calling rank.
1558  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
1559 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1560  int dest = sourceRank[i];
1561  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT, dest, dest + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1562  &commReqs[3 * i]);
1563  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG, dest, dest + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1564  &commReqs[3 * i + 1]);
1565  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, dest, dest + 3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
1566  &commReqs[3 * i + 2]);
1567 #endif
1568  }
1569 
1570  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSendHaloInfo,
1571  such that the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
1572  nRankSend = nRankSendHaloInfo;
1573  shortRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1574  longRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1575  doubleRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1576 
1577  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
1578  sourceRank.resize(nRankSend);
1579 
1580  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
1581  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
1582 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1583 
1584  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
1585  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
1586  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
1587  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
1588  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
1589  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1590  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1591  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1592 
1593  int sizeMess;
1594  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
1595 
1596  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
1597  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1598  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT, sourceRank[i], rank + 1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1599 
1600  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
1601  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
1602  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1603  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
1604  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1605 
1606  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG, sourceRank[i], rank + 2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1607 
1608  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
1609  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank + 3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1610  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
1611  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1612 
1613  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE, sourceRank[i], rank + 3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1614  }
1615 
1616  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
1617  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3 * nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1618 
1619  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1620  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1621  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1622 
1623 #else
1624 
1625  /* Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. Note that nRankSend is at most 1. */
1626  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
1627  sourceRank[i] = i;
1628  shortRecvBuf[i] = shortSendBuf[i];
1629  longRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1630  doubleRecvBuf[i] = doubleSendBuf[i];
1631  }
1632 
1633 #endif
1634 
1635  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
1636  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1637  for (int i = 0; i < nRankRecv; ++i) {
1638  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
1639  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1640  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
1641  }
1642 
1643  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1644  /*--- Step 6: Build the layer of halo elements from the information in the ---*/
1645  /*--- receive buffers shortRecvBuf, longRecvBuf and doubleRecvBuf. ---*/
1646  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1647 
1648  /*--- The halo elements must be sorted first based on the time level, followed
1649  by the rank and finally the index in the receive buffers (which represents
1650  the sequence on the sending rank. This sorting can be accomplished by
1651  using a vector of CLong3T. The contents of this vector is build below. ---*/
1652  vector<CLong3T> haloElemInfo;
1653  haloElemInfo.reserve(nVolElemTot - nVolElemOwned);
1654 
1655  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
1656  unsigned long indS = 0;
1657 
1658  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1659  const unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 6];
1660  haloElemInfo.emplace_back(shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 7], sourceRank[i], j);
1661  indS += nFaces + 8;
1662  }
1663  }
1664 
1665  sort(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end());
1666 
1667  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to store the information of the
1668  halo elements and the halo points. ---*/
1669  vector<CPointFEM> haloPoints;
1670  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
1671  /* Initialization of the indices in the communication buffers. */
1672  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1673 
1674  /* Loop over the halo elements received from this rank. */
1675  for (long j = 0; j < longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1676  /* Create an object of CLong3T and search for its position
1677  in haloElemInfo to determine the index in volElem, where
1678  this element is stored. */
1679  CLong3T thisElem(shortRecvBuf[i][indS + 7], sourceRank[i], j);
1680  vector<CLong3T>::iterator low;
1681  low = lower_bound(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end(), thisElem);
1682 
1683  unsigned long indV = low - haloElemInfo.begin();
1684  indV += nVolElemOwned;
1685 
1686  /* Retrieve the data from the communication buffers. */
1687  volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1688  volElem[indV].rankOriginal = sourceRank[i];
1689 
1690  volElem[indV].periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1691  volElem[indV].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1692  volElem[indV].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1693  volElem[indV].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1694  volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1695  volElem[indV].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1696  volElem[indV].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1697  volElem[indV].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1698 
1699  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1700  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1701  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1702 
1703  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1704  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1705  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool)shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1706 
1707  /* Give the member variables that are not obtained via communication their
1708  values. Some of these variables are not used for halo elements. */
1709  volElem[indV].elemIsOwned = false;
1710  volElem[indV].JacIsConsideredConstant = false;
1711  volElem[indV].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = ULONG_MAX;
1712 
1713  /* Halo elements do not own a face per definition. */
1714  volElem[indV].ElementOwnsFaces.assign(volElem[indV].nFaces, false);
1715 
1716  /* Get the length scale from the double receive buffer.*/
1717  volElem[indV].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1718  }
1719 
1720  /* Store the information of the points in haloPoints. */
1721  const long nPointsThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1722  for (long j = 0; j < nPointsThisRank; ++j) {
1723  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1724  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1725  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1726  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) thisPoint.coor[l] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1727 
1728  haloPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1729  }
1730 
1731  /* The communication buffers from this rank are not needed anymore.
1732  Delete them using the swap function. */
1733  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1734  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1735  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1736  }
1737 
1738  /* Remove the duplicate entries from haloPoints. */
1739  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1740  lastPoint = unique(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1741  haloPoints.erase(lastPoint, haloPoints.end());
1742 
1743  /* Initialization of some variables to sort the halo points. */
1744  Global_nPoint = geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint();
1745  unsigned long InvalidPointID = Global_nPoint + 10;
1746  short InvalidPerInd = SHRT_MAX;
1747 
1748  /*--- Search for the nonperiodic halo points in the local points to see
1749  if these points are already stored on this rank. If this is the
1750  case invalidate this halo and decrease the number of halo points.
1751  Afterwards remove the invalid halos from the vector. ---*/
1752  unsigned long nHaloPoints = haloPoints.size();
1753  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1754  if (haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1755 
1756  if (binary_search(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end(), haloPoints[i])) {
1757  haloPoints[i].globalID = InvalidPointID;
1758  haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor = InvalidPerInd;
1759  --nHaloPoints;
1760  }
1761  }
1762 
1763  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1764  haloPoints.resize(nHaloPoints);
1765 
1766  /* Increase the capacity of meshPoints, such that the halo points can be
