1767  stored in there as well. Note that in case periodic points are present
1768  this is an upper bound. Add the non-periodic halo points to meshPoints. */
1769  meshPoints.reserve(meshPoints.size() + nHaloPoints);
1770 
1771  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1772  if (haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1773 
1774  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
1775  }
1776 
1777  /* Create a map from the global point ID and periodic index to the local
1778  index in the vector meshPoints. First store the points already present
1779  in meshPoints. */
1780  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long> mapGlobalPointIDToInd;
1781  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < meshPoints.size(); ++i) {
1782  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
1783  globIndAndPer.long0 = meshPoints[i].globalID;
1784  globIndAndPer.long1 = meshPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor + 1; // Note the +1 again.
1785 
1786  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = i;
1787  }
1788 
1789  /*--- Convert the global indices in the boundary connectivities to local ones.
1790  Note that the volume ID's already contain the local number. ---*/
1791  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1792  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
1793  /* Convert the global node ID's to local values. Note that for these node
1794  ID's no periodic transformation can be present. */
1795  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
1796  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j], 0);
1797  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
1798  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
1799  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
1800  }
1801  }
1802  }
1803 
1804  /*--- The only halo points that must be added to meshPoints are the periodic
1805  halo points. It must be checked whether or not the periodic points in
1806  haloPoints match with points in meshPoints. This is done below. ---*/
1807  for (unsigned long iLow = 0; iLow < haloPoints.size();) {
1808  /* Determine the upper index for this periodic transformation. */
1809  unsigned long iUpp;
1810  for (iUpp = iLow + 1; iUpp < haloPoints.size(); ++iUpp)
1811  if (haloPoints[iUpp].periodIndexToDonor != haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor) break;
1812 
1813  /* Check for a true periodic index. */
1814  short perIndex = haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor;
1815  if (perIndex != -1) {
1816  /* Easier storage of the surface elements. */
1817  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[perIndex].surfElem;
1818 
1819  /*--- In the loop below the coordinates of the points of this local
1820  periodic boundary as well as a matching tolerance are determined.
1821  A vector of point ID's is also created, which is needed later on
1822  when it is checked whether or not a matching point is already
1823  stored in meshPoints. ---*/
1824  vector<long> indInPoints(meshPoints.size(), -1);
1825  vector<unsigned long> IDsPoints;
1826  vector<su2double> coordPoints;
1827  vector<su2double> tolPoints;
1828 
1829  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < surfElem.size(); ++j) {
1830  /* Determine the tolerance for equal points, which is a small value
1831  times the length scale of the adjacent volume element. */
1832  const su2double tolElem = 1.e-2 * volElem[surfElem[j].volElemID].lenScale;
1833 
1834  /* Loop over the nodes of this surface grid and update the points on
1835  this periodic boundary. */
1836  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < surfElem[j].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
1837  unsigned long nn = surfElem[j].nodeIDsGrid[k];
1838 
1839  if (indInPoints[nn] == -1) {
1840  /* Point is not stored yet in pointsBoundary. Do so now. */
1841  indInPoints[nn] = IDsPoints.size();
1842  IDsPoints.push_back(nn);
1843  tolPoints.push_back(tolElem);
1844 
1845  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nDim; ++l) coordPoints.push_back(meshPoints[nn].coor[l]);
1846  } else {
1847  /* Point is already stored. Update the tolerance. */
1848  nn = indInPoints[nn];
1849  tolPoints[nn] = min(tolPoints[nn], tolElem);
1850  }
1851  }
1852  }
1853 
1854  /* Create a local ADT of the points on the periodic boundary. */
1855  CADTPointsOnlyClass periodicADT(nDim, IDsPoints.size(), coordPoints.data(), IDsPoints.data(), false);
1856 
1857  /* Get the data for the periodic transformation to the donor. */
1858  auto center = config->GetPeriodicRotCenter(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1859  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1860  auto trans = config->GetPeriodicTranslation(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1861 
1862  /*--- Compute the rotation matrix and translation vector for the
1863  transformation from the donor. This is the transpose of the
1864  transformation to the donor. ---*/
1865 
1866  /* Store (center-trans) as it is constant and will be added on. */
1867  su2double translation[] = {center[0] - trans[0], center[1] - trans[1], center[2] - trans[2]};
1868 
1869  /* Store angles separately for clarity. Compute sines/cosines. */
1870  su2double theta = angles[0];
1871  su2double phi = angles[1];
1872  su2double psi = angles[2];
1873 
1874  su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
1875  su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
1876 
1877  /* Compute the rotation matrix. Note that the implicit
1878  ordering is rotation about the x-axis, y-axis, then z-axis. */
1879  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
1880  rotMatrix[0][0] = cosPhi * cosPsi;
1881  rotMatrix[0][1] = cosPhi * sinPsi;
1882  rotMatrix[0][2] = -sinPhi;
1883 
1884  rotMatrix[1][0] = sinTheta * sinPhi * cosPsi - cosTheta * sinPsi;
1885  rotMatrix[1][1] = sinTheta * sinPhi * sinPsi + cosTheta * cosPsi;
1886  rotMatrix[1][2] = sinTheta * cosPhi;
1887 
1888  rotMatrix[2][0] = cosTheta * sinPhi * cosPsi + sinTheta * sinPsi;
1889  rotMatrix[2][1] = cosTheta * sinPhi * sinPsi - sinTheta * cosPsi;
1890  rotMatrix[2][2] = cosTheta * cosPhi;
1891 
1892  /* Loop over the halo points for this periodic transformation. */
1893  for (unsigned long i = iLow; i < iUpp; ++i) {
1894  /* Apply the periodic transformation to the coordinates
1895  stored in this halo point. */
1896  su2double dx = haloPoints[i].coor[0] - center[0];
1897  su2double dy = haloPoints[i].coor[1] - center[1];
1898  su2double dz = nDim == 3 ? haloPoints[i].coor[2] - center[2] : su2double(0.0);
1899 
1900  haloPoints[i].coor[0] = rotMatrix[0][0] * dx + rotMatrix[0][1] * dy + rotMatrix[0][2] * dz + translation[0];
1901  haloPoints[i].coor[1] = rotMatrix[1][0] * dx + rotMatrix[1][1] * dy + rotMatrix[1][2] * dz + translation[1];
1902  haloPoints[i].coor[2] = rotMatrix[2][0] * dx + rotMatrix[2][1] * dy + rotMatrix[2][2] * dz + translation[2];
1903 
1904  /* Search for the nearest coordinate in the ADT. */
1905  su2double dist;
1906  unsigned long pointID;
1907  int rankID;
1908 
1909  periodicADT.DetermineNearestNode(haloPoints[i].coor, dist, pointID, rankID);
1910 
1911  /* Check whether the distance is less equal to the tolerance for
1912  a matching point. */
1913  const unsigned long nn = indInPoints[pointID];
1914  if (dist <= tolPoints[nn]) {
1915  /* The distance to the nearest point is less than the tolerance,
1916  hence this periodically transformed point is present on the
1917  boundary. Store it as such in the map mapGlobalPointIDToInd. */
1918  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
1919  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
1920  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor + 1; // Note the +1 again.
1921 
1922  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = pointID;
1923  } else {
1924  /* The distance to the nearest point is larger than the tolerance,
1925  hence this periodically transformed point is not present yet on
1926  this rank. Store it in the mapping to the local points and
1927  create it in meshPoints. */
1928  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
1929  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
1930  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor + 1; // Note the +1 again.
1931 
1932  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = meshPoints.size();
1933  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
1934  }
1935  }
1936  }
1937 
1938  /* Set iLow to iUpp for the next periodic transformation. */
1939  iLow = iUpp;
1940  }
1941 
1942  /*--- Convert the global node numbering in the elements to a local numbering and
1943  determine the value of factTimeLevel. This is the number of local time steps
1944  of the element relative to the largest time step of an element in the mesh.
1945  This value can only differ from 1 when time accurate local time stepping is
1946  used. ---*/
1947  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
1948  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
1949  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j],
1950  volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor + 1); // Again the +1.
1951  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
1952  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
1953  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
1954  }
1955 
1956  const unsigned short diffTimeLevel = nTimeLevels - 1 - volElem[i].timeLevel;
1957  volElem[i].factTimeLevel = pow(2, diffTimeLevel);
1958  }
1959 
1960  /* Determine the number of halo elements per time level in cumulative
1961  storage format. */
1962  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel.assign(nTimeLevels + 1, 0);
1963  for (unsigned long i = nVolElemOwned; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) ++nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel + 1];
1964 
1965  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[0] = nVolElemOwned;
1966  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i + 1] += nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i];
1967 }
1968 
1969 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(const unsigned short nIntegration, const unsigned short nDOFs,
1970  const su2double* matDerBasisInt, const unsigned long* DOFs,
1971  su2double* derivCoor, CConfig* config) {
1972  /* Allocate the memory to store the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. */
1973  vector<su2double> helpDxdrVec(nIntegration * nDim * nDim);
1974  su2double* dxdrVec = helpDxdrVec.data();
1975 
1976  /* Determine the gradients of the Cartesian coordinates w.r.t. the
1977  parametric coordinates. */
1978  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nIntegration, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt, DOFs, dxdrVec, config);
1979 
1980  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D to compute the derivatives drdx,
1981  drdy, etc. */
1982  switch (nDim) {
1983  case 2: {
1984  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
1985  const unsigned short off = 2 * nIntegration;
1986 
1987  /* Loop over the integration points. */
1988  unsigned short ii = 0;
1989  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
1990  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dxds and dyds from dxdrVec
1991  in this integration point. */
1992  const unsigned short jx = 2 * j;
1993  const unsigned short jy = jx + 1;
1994  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy];
1995  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx + off], dyds = dxdrVec[jy + off];
1996 
1997  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, dsdx, dsdy. */
1998  const su2double Jinv = 1.0 / (dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr);
1999 
2000  derivCoor[ii++] = dyds * Jinv; // drdx
2001  derivCoor[ii++] = -dxds * Jinv; // drdy
2002  derivCoor[ii++] = -dydr * Jinv; // dsdx
2003  derivCoor[ii++] = dxdr * Jinv; // dsdy
2004  }
2005  break;
2006  }
2007 
2008  case 3: {
2009  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
2010  const unsigned short offS = 3 * nIntegration, offT = 6 * nIntegration;
2011 
2012  /* Loop over the integration points. */
2013  unsigned short ii = 0;
2014  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
2015  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dzdr, dxds, dyds, dzds, dxdt, dydt
2016  and dzdt from dxdrVec in this integration point. */
2017  const unsigned short jx = 3 * j;
2018  const unsigned short jy = jx + 1, jz = jx + 2;
2019  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy], dzdr = dxdrVec[jz];
2020  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx + offS], dyds = dxdrVec[jy + offS], dzds = dxdrVec[jz + offS];
2021  const su2double dxdt = dxdrVec[jx + offT], dydt = dxdrVec[jy + offT], dzdt = dxdrVec[jz + offT];
2022 
2023  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, dsdy, dsdz,
2024  dtdx, dtdy, dtdz. */
2025  const su2double Jinv = 1.0 / (dxdr * (dyds * dzdt - dzds * dydt) - dxds * (dydr * dzdt - dzdr * dydt) +
2026  dxdt * (dydr * dzds - dzdr * dyds));
2027 
2028  derivCoor[ii++] = (dyds * dzdt - dzds * dydt) * Jinv; // drdx
2029  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzds * dxdt - dxds * dzdt) * Jinv; // drdy
2030  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxds * dydt - dyds * dxdt) * Jinv; // drdz
2031 
2032  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr * dydt - dydr * dzdt) * Jinv; // dsdx
2033  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr * dzdt - dzdr * dxdt) * Jinv; // dsdy
2034  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr * dxdt - dxdr * dydt) * Jinv; // dsdz
2035 
2036  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr * dzds - dzdr * dyds) * Jinv; // dtdx
2037  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr * dxds - dxdr * dzds) * Jinv; // dtdy
2038  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr * dyds - dydr * dxds) * Jinv; // dtdz
2039  }
2040 
2041  break;
2042  }
2043  }
2044 }
2045 
2046 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(const unsigned short nIntegration, const unsigned short nDOFs,
2047  const su2double* matDerBasisInt, const unsigned long* DOFs,
2048  su2double* derivCoor, CConfig* config) {
2049  /* Allocate the memory to store the coordinates as right hand side. */
2050  vector<su2double> vecRHS(nDOFs * nDim);
2051 
2052  /* Loop over the grid DOFs of the element and copy the coordinates in
2053  vecRHS in row major order. */
2054  unsigned long ic = 0;
2055  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFs; ++j) {
2056  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k, ++ic) vecRHS[ic] = meshPoints[DOFs[j]].coor[k];
2057  }
2058 
2059  /* Carry out the matrix matrix product The last argument is NULL, such
2060  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
2061  if should be included. */
2062  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim * nIntegration, nDim, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt, vecRHS.data(), derivCoor, nullptr);
2063 }
2064 
2065 void CMeshFEM::ComputeNormalsFace(const unsigned short nIntegration, const unsigned short nDOFs, const su2double* dr,
2066  const su2double* ds, const unsigned long* DOFs, su2double* normals) {
2067  /* Initialize the counter ii to 0. ii is the index in normals where the
2068  information is stored. */
2069  unsigned int ii = 0;
2070 
2071  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. */
2072  switch (nDim) {
2073  case 2: {
2074  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2075  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
2076  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr
2077  and dydr. ---*/
2078  const su2double* drr = &dr[j * nDOFs];
2079  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0;
2080  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) {
2081  dxdr += drr[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2082  dydr += drr[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2083  }
2084 
2085  /* Determine the length of the tangential vector (dxdr, dydr), which
2086  is also the length of the corresponding normal vector. Also compute
2087  the inverse of the length. Make sure that a division by zero is
2088  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2089  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(dxdr * dxdr + dydr * dydr);
2090  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0 / lenNorm;
2091 
2092  /* Store the corresponding unit normal vector and its length. The
2093  direction of the normal vector is such that it is outward pointing
2094  for the element on side 0 of the face. */
2095  normals[ii++] = dydr * invLenNorm;
2096  normals[ii++] = -dxdr * invLenNorm;
2097  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2098  }
2099 
2100  break;
2101  }
2102 
2103  case 3: {
2104  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2105  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nIntegration; ++j) {
2106  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr,
2107  dxds, dydr, dyds, dzdr and dzds. ---*/
2108  const su2double *drr = &dr[j * nDOFs], *dss = &ds[j * nDOFs];
2109  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0, dzdr = 0.0, dxds = 0.0, dyds = 0.0, dzds = 0.0;
2110  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) {
2111  dxdr += drr[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2112  dydr += drr[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2113  dzdr += drr[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2114 
2115  dxds += dss[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2116  dyds += dss[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2117  dzds += dss[k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2118  }
2119 
2120  /* Compute the vector product dxdr X dxds, where x is the coordinate
2121  vector (x,y,z). Compute the length of this vector, which is an area,
2122  as well as the inverse. Make sure that a division by zero is
2123  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2124  const su2double nx = dydr * dzds - dyds * dzdr;
2125  const su2double ny = dxds * dzdr - dxdr * dzds;
2126  const su2double nz = dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr;
2127 
2128  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(nx * nx + ny * ny + nz * nz);
2129  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0 / lenNorm;
2130 
2131  /* Store the components of the unit normal as well as its length in the
2132  normals. Note that the current direction of the normal is pointing
2133  into the direction of the element on side 0 of the face. However,
2134  in the actual computation of the integral over the faces, it is
2135  assumed that the vector points in the opposite direction.
2136  Hence the normal vector must be reversed. */
2137  normals[ii++] = -nx * invLenNorm;
2138  normals[ii++] = -ny * invLenNorm;
2139  normals[ii++] = -nz * invLenNorm;
2140  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2141  }
2142  break;
2143  }
2144  }
2145 }
2146 
2147 void CMeshFEM::MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(CBoundaryFEM* boundary, CConfig* config) {
2148  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
2149  const bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER &&
2150  config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
2151 
2152  /*--- Loop over the boundary faces stored on this rank. ---*/
2153  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < boundary->surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2154  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2155  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
2156  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
2157  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
2158  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. (nDim*nDim per integration point) ---*/
2159  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
2160  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2161 
2162  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
2163  relevant information from it. */
2164  const unsigned short ind = boundary->surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2165  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
2166 
2167  /*--- Allocate the several metric terms. ---*/
2168  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt * (nDim + 1));
2169 
2170  if (viscousTerms) boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.resize(nInt * nDim * nDim);
2171 
2172  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
2173  default value of zero. */
2174  boundary->surfElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt * nDim, 0.0);
2175 
2176  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2177  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
2178  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
2179  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2180 
2181  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
2182  its corresponding area in the integration points. */
2183  unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
2184  const su2double* dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegration();
2185  const su2double* ds = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegration();
2186 
2187  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridFace.data(),
2188  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
2189 
2190  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
2191  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
2192  of the face, if needed. */
2193  if (viscousTerms) {
2194  nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElem();
2195  dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegration();
2196 
2197  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridElement.data(),
2198  boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.data(), config);
2199  }
2200  }
2201 }
2202 
2203 void CMeshFEM::SetPositive_ZArea(CConfig* config) {
2204  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2205  /*--- Step 1: Determine the local contribution to the positive z area. ---*/
2206  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2207 
2208  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
2209  su2double PositiveZArea = 0.0;
2210  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2211  /* Determine whether or not this boundary contributes. */
2212  const unsigned short Boundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker);
2213  const unsigned short Monitoring = config->GetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker);
2214 
2215  if (((Boundary == EULER_WALL) || (Boundary == HEAT_FLUX) || (Boundary == ISOTHERMAL) ||
2216  (Boundary == LOAD_BOUNDARY) || (Boundary == DISPLACEMENT_BOUNDARY)) &&
2217  (Monitoring == YES)) {
2218  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this marker. */
2219  const vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2220 
2221  /* Loop over the surface elements. */
2222  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2223  /* Determine the number of integration points and their weights via
2224  the corresponding standard element. */
2225  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2226  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2227  const su2double* weights = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
2228 
2229  /* Loop over the integration points for this element and update PositiveZArea
2230  if the normal has a negative z-component. In that case it will give a
2231  positive contribution to PositiveZArea as this must take the normal pointing
2232  into the element into account. */
2233  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nInt; ++j) {
2234  /* Store the normal data for this integration point a bit easier and update
2235  PositiveZArea, if needed. */
2236  const su2double* normal = &surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace[j * (nDim + 1)];
2237  if (normal[nDim - 1] < 0.0) PositiveZArea -= weights[j] * normal[nDim - 1] * normal[nDim];
2238  }
2239  }
2240  }
2241  }
2242 
2243  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2244  /*--- Step 2: Perform an Allreduce such that the global value of ---*/
2245  /*--- PositiveZArea is known on all ranks. ---*/
2246  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2247 
2248 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2249  su2double locArea = PositiveZArea;
2250  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&locArea, &PositiveZArea, 1, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2251 #endif
2252 
2253  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2254  /*--- Step 3: Set the reference area, if this was not specified and write ---*/
2255  /*--- a message about the projected area if I am the master. ---*/
2256  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2257 
2258  if (config->GetRefArea() == 0.0) config->SetRefArea(PositiveZArea);
2259 
2260  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2261  if (nDim == 2)
2262  cout << "Area projection in the y-plane = " << PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2263  else
2264  cout << "Area projection in the z-plane = " << PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2265  }
2266 }
2267 
2268 CMeshFEM_DG::CMeshFEM_DG(CGeometry* geometry, CConfig* config) : CMeshFEM(geometry, config) {}
2269 
2270 void CMeshFEM_DG::SetGlobal_to_Local_Point() {
2271  Global_to_Local_Point.clear();
2272  unsigned long ii = 0;
2273  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
2274  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[i].nDOFsSol; ++j, ++ii) {
2275  Global_to_Local_Point[volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolGlobal + j] = ii;
2276  }
2277  }
2278 }
2279 
2280 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesIntegrationPoints() {
2281  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2282  /*--- Step 1: The integration points of the owned volume elements. ---*/
2283  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2284 
2285  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2286  in the integration points. ---*/
2287  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2288  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2289  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2290  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2291  const su2double* lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
2292 
2293  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2294  volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim * nInt);
2295 
2296  /* Store the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
2297  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2298  const unsigned long* DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2299 
2300  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this element and compute
2301  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2302  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
2303  su2double* coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
2304  const unsigned short jj = i * nDOFs;
2305  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDim; ++j) {
2306  coor[j] = 0.0;
2307  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) coor[j] += lag[jj + k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2308  }
2309  }
2310  }
2311 
2312  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2313  /*--- Step 2: The integration points of the internal matching faces. ---*/
2314  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2315 
2316  /*--- Loop over the internal matching faces to compute the coordinates
2317  in the integration points. ---*/
2318  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
2319  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2320  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
2321  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2322  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
2323  const su2double* lag = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
2324 
2325  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2326  matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim * nInt);
2327 
2328  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2329  const unsigned long* DOFs = matchingFaces[l].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data();
2330 
2331  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2332  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2333  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
2334  su2double* coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
2335  const unsigned short jj = i * nDOFs;
2336  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDim; ++j) {
2337  coor[j] = 0.0;
2338  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) coor[j] += lag[jj + k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2339  }
2340  }
2341  }
2342 
2343  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2344  /*--- Step 3: The integration points of the boundary faces. ---*/
2345  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2346 
2347  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers. Make sure to exclude the periodic
2348  boundaries, because these are not physical. ---*/
2349  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
2350  if (!boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) {
2351  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
2352  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2353 
2354  /* Loop over the boundary faces and determine the coordinates
2355  in the integration points. */
2356  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < surfElem.size(); ++l) {
2357  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2358  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
2359  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2360  const unsigned short nDOFs = surfElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2361  const su2double* lag = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
2362 
2363  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2364  surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim * nInt);
2365 
2366  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2367  const unsigned long* DOFs = surfElem[l].DOFsGridFace.data();
2368 
2369  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2370  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2371  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
2372  su2double* coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
2373  const unsigned short jj = i * nDOFs;
2374  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDim; ++j) {
2375  coor[j] = 0.0;
2376  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) coor[j] += lag[jj + k] * meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2377  }
2378  }
2379  }
2380  }
2381  }
2382 }
2383 
2384 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesSolDOFs() {
2385  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2386  of the solution DOFs. ---*/
2387  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2388  /* Store the grid DOFs and the number of solDOFS a bit easier. */
2389  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2390  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
2391  const unsigned long* DOFsGrid = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2392 
2393  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2394  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2395  const su2double* lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
2396 
2397  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the solution DOFs. */
2398  volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.resize(nDim * nDOFsSol);
2399 
2400  /*--- Loop over the solution DOFs of this element and compute the
2401  coordinates. Note that in case the polynomial degree of the grid
2402  and solution is the same the grid DOFs and solution DOFs coincide
2403  and the interpolation boils down to a copy of the coordinates. ---*/
2404  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFsSol; ++i) {
2405  su2double* coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i * nDim;
2406  const unsigned short jj = i * nDOFsGrid;
2407  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDim; ++j) {
2408  coor[j] = 0.0;
2409  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFsGrid; ++k) coor[j] += lag[jj + k] * meshPoints[DOFsGrid[k]].coor[j];
2410  }
2411  }
2412  }
2413 }
2414 
2415 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateFaces(CConfig* config) {
2416  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2417  /*--- Step 1: Determine the faces of the locally stored part of the grid. ---*/
2418  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2419 
2420  /*--- Loop over the volume elements stored on this rank, including the halos. ---*/
2421  vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
2422 
2423  for (unsigned long k = 0; k < nVolElemTot; ++k) {
2424  /* Determine the corner points of all the faces of this element. */
2425  unsigned short nFaces;
2426  unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2427  unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2428 
2429  volElem[k].GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2430 
2431  /* Loop over the faces of this element, set the appropriate information,
2432  create a unique numbering and add the faces to localFaces. */
2433  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nFaces; ++i) {
2434  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2435  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
2436  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
2437 
2438  /* Copy the data from the volume element. */
2439  thisFace.elemID0 = k;
2440  thisFace.nPolyGrid0 = volElem[k].nPolyGrid;
2441  thisFace.nPolySol0 = volElem[k].nPolySol;
2442  thisFace.nDOFsElem0 = volElem[k].nDOFsSol;
2443  thisFace.elemType0 = volElem[k].VTK_Type;
2444  thisFace.faceID0 = i;
2445  thisFace.faceIndicator = -2; // Initialized to an invalid face.
2446 
2447  thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = volElem[k].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[i];
2448  thisFace.elem0IsOwner = volElem[k].ElementOwnsFaces[i];
2449 
2450  /* Determine whether or not the integration rule for straight and curved
2451  faces is the same. If that is the case, the value of JacFaceIsConsideredConstant
2452  is set to false. Hence it is only needed to carry out this check for faces
2453  with a constant Jacobian. This is done to reduce the number of standard elements. */
2454  if (thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant) {
2455  auto orderExactStraight = (unsigned short)ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0 * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2456  auto orderExactCurved = (unsigned short)ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0 * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2457 
2458  if (orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) {
2459  orderExactStraight = (unsigned short)ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0 * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2460  orderExactCurved = (unsigned short)ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0 * config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2461  if (orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2462  }
2463  }
2464 
2465  /* Renumber the corner points of the face, but keep the orientation.
2466  Afterwards, add it to localFaces. */
2467  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2468 
2469  localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
2470  }
2471  }
2472 
2473  /*--- Sort the the local faces in increasing order. ---*/
2474  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2475 
2476  /*--- Loop over the faces to merge the matching faces. ---*/
2477  for (unsigned long i = 1; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2478  /* Check for a matching face with the previous face in the vector.
2479  Note that the == operator only checks the node IDs. */
2480  if (localFaces[i] == localFaces[i - 1]) {
2481  /* Faces are matching. Check if it should be kept, i.e. if one
2482  of the elements owns the face. */
2483  if (localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner || localFaces[i - 1].elem0IsOwner) {
2484  /* Store the data for this matching face in faces[i-1]. */
2485  if (localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot) {
2486  localFaces[i - 1].elemID0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2487  localFaces[i - 1].nPolyGrid0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0;
2488  localFaces[i - 1].nPolySol0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0;
2489  localFaces[i - 1].nDOFsElem0 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0;
2490  localFaces[i - 1].elemType0 = localFaces[i].elemType0;
2491  localFaces[i - 1].faceID0 = localFaces[i].faceID0;
2492  localFaces[i - 1].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2493  } else {
2494  localFaces[i - 1].elemID1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2495  localFaces[i - 1].nPolyGrid1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1;
2496  localFaces[i - 1].nPolySol1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1;
2497  localFaces[i - 1].nDOFsElem1 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1;
2498  localFaces[i - 1].elemType1 = localFaces[i].elemType1;
2499  localFaces[i - 1].faceID1 = localFaces[i].faceID1;
2500  }
2501 
2502  /* Adapt the boolean to indicate whether or not the face has a constant
2503  Jacobian of the transformation, although in principle this info
2504  should be the same for both faces. */
2505  if (!(localFaces[i - 1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant && localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant)) {
2506  localFaces[i - 1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2507  }
2508 
2509  /* Set this face indicator to -1 to indicate an internal face
2510  and set elem0IsOwner for localFaces[i] to false. */
2511  localFaces[i - 1].faceIndicator = -1;
2512  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = false;
2513  }
2514  }
2515  }
2516 
2517  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers and its boundary elements to search for
2518  the corresponding faces in localFaces. These faces should be found.
2519  Note that periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are treated
2520  via the halo elements, which are already in place. ---*/
2521  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2522  if (!boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) {
2523  for (unsigned long k = 0; k < boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++k) {
2524  /* Determine the corner points of the face of this element. */
2525  unsigned short nPointsPerFace;
2526  unsigned long faceConn[4];
2527 
2528  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].GetCornerPointsFace(nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2529 
2530  /* Create an object of CFaceOfElement to carry out the search. */
2531  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2532  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace;
2533  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nPointsPerFace; ++j) thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[j];
2534  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2535 
2536  /* Search for thisFace in localFaces. It must be found. */
2537  vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2538  low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2539 
2540  bool thisFaceFound = false;
2541  if (low != localFaces.end()) {
2542  if (!(thisFace < *low)) thisFaceFound = true;
2543  }
2544 
2545  if (thisFaceFound) {
2546  low->faceIndicator = iMarker;
2547 
2548  /* A few additional checks. */
2549  bool side0IsBoundary = low->elemID0 < nVolElemTot;
2550  unsigned long elemID = side0IsBoundary ? low->elemID0 : low->elemID1;
2551  unsigned short nPoly = side0IsBoundary ? low->nPolyGrid0 : low->nPolyGrid1;
2552 
2553  if (elemID != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].volElemID || nPoly != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].nPolyGrid)
2554  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Element ID and/or polynomial degree do not match ") +
2555  string("for this boundary element. This should not happen."),
2556  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2557  } else
2558  SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary face not found in localFaces. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2559  }
2560  }
2561  }
2562 
2563  /*--- It is possible that owned non-matching faces are present in the list.
2564  These faces are indicated by an owned face and a faceIndicator of -2.
2565  To avoid that these faces are removed afterwards, set their
2566  faceIndicator to -1. ---*/
2567  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2568  if (localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2 && localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner) localFaces[i].faceIndicator = -1;
2569  }
2570 
2571  /*--- Remove the invalid faces. This is accomplished by giving the face four
2572  points and global node ID's that are larger than the largest local point
2573  ID in the grid. In this way the sorting operator puts these faces at the
2574  end of the vector, see also the < operator of CFaceOfElement. ---*/
2575  unsigned long nFacesLoc = localFaces.size();
2576  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2577  if (localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2) {
2578  unsigned long invalID = meshPoints.size();
2579  localFaces[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
2580  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = invalID;
2581  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = invalID;
2582  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = invalID;
2583  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[3] = invalID;
2584  --nFacesLoc;
2585  }
2586  }
2587 
2588  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2589  localFaces.resize(nFacesLoc);
2590 
2591  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2592  /*--- Step 2: Preparation of the localFaces vector, such that the info ---*/
2593  /*--- stored in this vector can be separated in a contribution ---*/
2594  /*--- from the internal faces and a contribution from the faces ---*/
2595  /*--- that belong to physical boundaries. ---*/
2596  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2597 
2598  /* Sort localFaces again, but now such that the boundary faces are numbered
2599  first, followed by the matching faces and at the end of localFaces the
2600  non-matching faces are stored. In order to carry out this sorting the
2601  functor CSortFaces is used for comparison. Within the categories
2602  the sorting depends on the time levels of the adjacent volume elements
2603  of the face. */
2604  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), CSortFaces(nVolElemOwned, nVolElemTot, volElem.data()));
2605 
2606  /*--- Carry out a possible swap of side 0 and side 1 of the faces. This is
2607  done for the following reasons (in order of importance).
2608  1: The element on side 0 must always be an owned element.
2609  2: The VTK type of the element on side 0 must be less than or equal
2610  to the VTK type of the element on side 1. This is done to reduce
2611  the number of standard elements for the matching faces.
2612  3: For the same VTK types the element on side 0 must be the smallest.
2613 
2614  Furthermore, make sure that for boundary faces and non-matching faces
2615  the corresponding element is always on side 0. ---*/
2616  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2617  /* Determine whether or not the ajacent elements must be swapped. */
2618  bool swapElements;
2619  if (localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot && localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
2620  /* This is an internal matching face. First check if one of the adjacent
2621  elements is not an owned element. */
2622  if (localFaces[i].elemID0 >= nVolElemOwned || localFaces[i].elemID1 >= nVolElemOwned) {
2623  /* One of the element is not owned. Make sure that the owned element
2624  is on side 0. */
2625  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2626  } else if (localFaces[i].elemType0 == localFaces[i].elemType1) {
2627  /* The same element type on both sides. Make sure that the element
2628  with the smallest ID is stored on side 0 of the face. */
2629  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2630  } else {
2631  /* Different element types. Make sure that the lowest element
2632  type will be stored on side 0 of the face. */
2633  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemType0 > localFaces[i].elemType1;
2634  }
2635  } else {
2636  /* Either a boundary face or a non-matching face. It must be swapped
2637  if the element is currently on side 1 of the face. */
2638  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot;
2639  }
2640 
2641  /* Swap the adjacent elements of the face, if needed. Note that
2642  also the sequence of the corner points must be altered in order
2643  to obey the right hand rule. */
2644  if (swapElements) {
2645  swap(localFaces[i].elemID0, localFaces[i].elemID1);
2646  swap(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1);
2647  swap(localFaces[i].nPolySol0, localFaces[i].nPolySol1);
2648  swap(localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0, localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1);
2649  swap(localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].elemType1);
2650  swap(localFaces[i].faceID0, localFaces[i].faceID1);
2651 
2652  if (localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 2)
2653  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1]);
2654  else
2655  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]);
2656 
2657  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = !localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2658  }
2659  }
2660 
2661  /*--- For triangular faces with a pyramid as an adjacent element, it must be
2662  made sure that the first corner point does not coincide with the top of
2663  the pyramid. Otherwise it is impossible to carry the transformation to
2664  the standard pyramid element. ---*/
2665  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2666  /* Check for a triangular face. */
2667  if (localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 3) {
2668  /* Determine if the corner points correspond to a corner point of a
2669  pyramid. A pyramid can in principle occur on both sides of the face. */
2670  bool cornerIsTopPyramid[] = {false, false, false};
2671 
2672  if (localFaces[i].elemType0 == PYRAMID) {
2673  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID0].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2674  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2675  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2676  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2677  }
2678 
2679  if (localFaces[i].elemType1 == PYRAMID) {
2680  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID1].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2681  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2682  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2683  if (localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2684  }
2685 
2686  /* Check if the first element corresponds to the top of a pyramid. */
2687  if (cornerIsTopPyramid[0]) {
2688  /* The sequence of the points of the face must be altered. It is done in
2689  such a way that the orientation remains the same. Store the original
2690  point numbering. */
2691  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2692  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
2693 
2694  /* Determine the situation. */
2695  if (!cornerIsTopPyramid[1]) {
2696  /* cornerPoint[1] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will become
2697  the point 0 of the triangle. */
2698  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[1];
2699  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[2];
2700  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[0];
2701  } else {
2702  /* Only cornerPoint[2] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will
2703  become point 0 of the triangle. */
2704  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
2705  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
2706  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
2707  }
2708  } else if (cornerIsTopPyramid[1] && !cornerIsTopPyramid[2]) {
2709  /* cornerPoint[1] is a top of a pyramid and the other two corners
2710  are not. Change the sequence, such that cornerPoint[2] will become
2711  point 0 of the triangle. */
2712  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2713  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
2714  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
2715  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
2716  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
2717  }
2718  }
2719  }
2720 
2721  /*--- Determine the number of matching and non-matching internal faces.
2722  For the matching faces, determine these numbers per time level
2723  and also make a distinction between internal faces and faces that
2724  involve a halo element. ---*/
2725  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
2726  nMatchingFacesInternal.assign(nTimeLevels + 1, 0);
2727  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem.assign(nTimeLevels + 1, 0);
2728 
2729  unsigned long nNonMatchingFaces = 0;
2730  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2731  if (localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1) {
2732  const unsigned long e0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2733  const unsigned long e1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2734 
2735  if (e1 < nVolElemTot) {
2736  const unsigned short timeLevel = min(volElem[e0].timeLevel, volElem[e1].timeLevel);
2737  if (e1 < nVolElemOwned)
2738  ++nMatchingFacesInternal[timeLevel + 1];
2739  else
2740  ++nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[timeLevel + 1];
2741  } else
2742  ++nNonMatchingFaces;
2743  }
2744  }
2745 
2746  if (nNonMatchingFaces) {
2747  ostringstream message;
2748  message << nNonMatchingFaces << " non-matching internal faces found.\n"
2749  << "This is not supported yet." << endl;
2750  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2751  }
2752 
2753  /* Put nMatchingFacesInternal and nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem in
2754  cumulative storage format. */
2755  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) nMatchingFacesInternal[i + 1] += nMatchingFacesInternal[i];
2756 
2757  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[0] = nMatchingFacesInternal[nTimeLevels];
2758  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i + 1] += nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i];
2759 
2760  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2761  /*--- Step 3: Create the local face based data structure for the internal ---*/
2762  /*--- faces. These are needed for the computation of the surface ---*/
2763  /*--- integral in DG-FEM. ---*/
2764  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2765 
2766  /* Allocate the memory for the matching faces. */
2767  matchingFaces.resize(nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]);
2768 
2769  /*--- Loop over the volume elements to determine the maximum number
2770  of DOFs for the volume elements. Allocate the memory for the
2771  vector used to store the DOFs of the element. ---*/
2772  unsigned short nDOFsVolMax = 0;
2773  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
2774  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsGrid);
2775  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsSol);
2776  }
2777 
2778  vector<unsigned long> DOFsElem(nDOFsVolMax);
2779 
2780  /*--- Loop over localFaces to create the connectivity information, which
2781  is stored in matchingFaces. ---*/
2782  unsigned long ii = 0;
2783  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2784  if (localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1 && localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
2785  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs on both sides of the face for both the
2786  grid and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
2787  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = 0;
2788  unsigned short sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = 0;
2789 
2790  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
2791  switch (localFaces[i].nCornerPoints) {
2792  case 2:
2793  /* Face is a line. */
2794  VTK_Type = LINE;
2795  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
2796  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1;
2797  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
2798  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1;
2799  break;
2800 
2801  case 3:
2802  /* Face is a triangle. */
2803  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
2804  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 2) / 2;
2805  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 2) / 2;
2806  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 2) / 2;
2807  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 2) / 2;
2808  break;
2809 
2810  case 4:
2811  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
2812  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
2813  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1);
2814  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1);
2815  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1);
2816  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1);
2817  break;
2818  }
2819 
2820  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID's and store them in matchingFaces. */
2821  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2822  const unsigned long v1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2823 
2824  matchingFaces[ii].elemID0 = v0;
2825  matchingFaces[ii].elemID1 = v1;
2826 
2827  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
2828  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0);
2829  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1);
2830  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0);
2831  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1);
2832 
2833  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
2834  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid);
2835  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
2836  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsSol);
2837 
2838  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent elements in the correct
2839  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
2840  connectivities of both sides of the face are determined for the
2841  grid and solution. First for side 0. ---*/
2842  bool swapFaceInElementSide0;
2843  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
2844 
2845  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
2846  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
2847  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.data(), matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.data());
2848 
2849  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
2850 
2851  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
2852  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
2853  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
2854  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.data());
2855 
2856  /*--- And also for side 1 of the face. ---*/
2857  bool swapFaceInElementSide1;
2858  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v1].nDOFsSol; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
2859 
2860  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
2861  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolySol, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
2862  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.data(), matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.data());
2863 
2864  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid[j];
2865 
2866  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
2867  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
2868  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.data(),
2869  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.data());
2870 
2871  /*--- Search in the standard elements for faces for a matching
2872  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
2873  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
2874  match with the standard element. ---*/
2875  unsigned long j;
2876  for (j = 0; j < standardMatchingFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
2877  if (standardMatchingFacesSol[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(
2878  VTK_Type, localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
2879  localFaces[i].elemType1, localFaces[i].nPolySol1, swapFaceInElementSide0, swapFaceInElementSide1) &&
2880  standardMatchingFacesGrid[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(
2881  VTK_Type, localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
2882  localFaces[i].elemType1, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1, swapFaceInElementSide0, swapFaceInElementSide1)) {
2883  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
2884  break;
2885  }
2886  }
2887 
2888  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
2889  if (j == standardMatchingFacesSol.size()) {
2890  standardMatchingFacesSol.emplace_back(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
2891  localFaces[i].elemType1, localFaces[i].nPolySol1,
2892  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, swapFaceInElementSide0,
2893  swapFaceInElementSide1, config);
2894 
2895  standardMatchingFacesGrid.emplace_back(
2896  VTK_Type, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0, localFaces[i].elemType1,
2897  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1, localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, swapFaceInElementSide0,
2898  swapFaceInElementSide1, config, standardMatchingFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact());
2899  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
2900  }
2901 
2902  /* Update the counter ii for the next internal matching face. */
2903  ++ii;
2904  }
2905  }
2906 
2907  /* Carry out an additional sorting of matchingFaces, such that faces with the
2908  same standard face are contiguous in memory as much as possible. This allows
2909  for a simultaneous treatment of faces, which increases the gemm performance.
2910  Note that this sorting takes place for each time level, because the grouping
2911  of faces per time level is essential for the correct functioning of the code.
2912  The same holds for the distinction between internal faces and faces that
2913  are adjacent to a halo element. */
2914  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i) {
2915  sort(matchingFaces.begin() + nMatchingFacesInternal[i], matchingFaces.begin() + nMatchingFacesInternal[i + 1]);
2916 
2917  sort(matchingFaces.begin() + nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i],
2918  matchingFaces.begin() + nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i + 1]);
2919  }
2920 
2921  /* Loop over the faces to flag the elements that share one or more faces
2922  with elements from a lower time level. */
2923  vector<bool> elemAdjLowTimeLevel(nVolElemTot, false);
2924  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
2925  const unsigned long e0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
2926  const unsigned long e1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
2927 
2928  if (volElem[e0].timeLevel > volElem[e1].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e0] = true;
2929  if (volElem[e1].timeLevel > volElem[e0].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e1] = true;
2930  }
2931 
2932  /* Determine the list of elements per time level, which share one or more
2933  faces with elements of the lower time level. Make a distinction between
2934  owned and halo elements. */
2935  ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2936  haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
2937 
2938  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
2939  if (elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i]) ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
2940  }
2941 
2942  for (unsigned long i = nVolElemOwned; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
2943  if (elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i]) haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
2944  }
2945 
2946  /* Determine the offsets of the solution DOFs in the solution working vectors
2947  of the solver for the different time levels. These are needed when time
2948  accurate local time stepping is employed. */
2949  vector<unsigned long> counterDOFs(nTimeLevels, 0);
2950 
2951  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
2952  const unsigned short lev = volElem[i].timeLevel;
2953  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev];
2954  counterDOFs[lev] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
2955 
2956  if (elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i]) {
2957  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev - 1];
2958  counterDOFs[lev - 1] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
2959  } else {
2960  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = ULONG_MAX;
2961  }
2962  }
2963 
2964  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2965  /*--- Step 4: Create the local face based data structure for the faces ---*/
2966  /*--- that belong to the physical boundaries. ---*/
2967  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2968 
2969  /* Loop over the boundary markers. ---*/
2970  unsigned long indBegMarker = 0;
2971  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2972  /* Initialize the number of surface elements per time level to zero. */
2973  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem.assign(nTimeLevels + 1, 0);
2974 
2975  /*--- The periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are not physical
2976  boundaries and are treated via the halo elements. These have already
2977  been created. ---*/
2978  if (!boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) {
2979  /* Determine the end index for this marker in localFaces. Note that
2980  localFaces is sorted such that the boundary faces are first and
2981  also grouped per boundary, see the functor CSortFaces. */
2982  unsigned long indEndMarker = indBegMarker;
2983  for (; indEndMarker < localFaces.size(); ++indEndMarker) {
2984  if (localFaces[indEndMarker].faceIndicator != (short)iMarker) break;
2985  }
2986 
2987  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this boundary. */
2988  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2989 
2990  /*--- Loop over range in localFaces for this boundary marker and create
2991  the connectivity information, which is stored in surfElem. ---*/
2992  for (unsigned long i = indBegMarker; i < indEndMarker; ++i) {
2993  /* Determine the time level of the adjacent element and increment
2994  the number of surface elements for this time level. The +1 is there,
2995  because this vector will be put in cumulative storage format
2996  afterwards. */
2997  ii = i - indBegMarker;
2998  const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[surfElem[ii].volElemID].timeLevel;
2999  ++boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel + 1];
3000 
3001  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs of the face for both the grid
3002  and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
3003  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFace = 0, sizeDOFsSolFace = 0;
3004 
3005  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
3006  switch (localFaces[i].nCornerPoints) {
3007  case 2:
3008  /* Face is a line. */
3009  VTK_Type = LINE;
3010  sizeDOFsGridFace = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
3011  sizeDOFsSolFace = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
3012  break;
3013 
3014  case 3:
3015  /* Face is a triangle. */
3016  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3017  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 2) / 2;
3018  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 2) / 2;
3019  break;
3020 
3021  case 4:
3022  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
3023  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3024  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1);
3025  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1) * (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1);
3026  break;
3027  }
3028 
3029  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID. */
3030  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3031 
3032  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
3033  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.resize(sizeDOFsGridFace);
3034  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.resize(sizeDOFsSolFace);
3035 
3036  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
3037  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
3038 
3039  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent element in the correct
3040  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
3041  connectivities are determined for the grid and solution. ---*/
3042  bool swapFaceInElement;
3043  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3044 
3045  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3046  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3047  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.data(), surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.data());
3048 
3049  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j) DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3050 
3051  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints, volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3052  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid, DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3053  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.data(), surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.data());
3054 
3055  /*--- Search in the standard elements for boundary faces for a matching
3056  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
3057  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
3058  match with the standard element. ---*/
3059  unsigned long j;
3060  for (j = 0; j < standardBoundaryFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
3061  if (standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3062  localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3063  swapFaceInElement) &&
3064  standardBoundaryFacesGrid[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3065  localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3066  swapFaceInElement)) {
3067  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3068  break;
3069  }
3070  }
3071 
3072  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3073  if (j == standardBoundaryFacesSol.size()) {
3074  standardBoundaryFacesSol.emplace_back(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3075  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, swapFaceInElement, config);
3076 
3077  standardBoundaryFacesGrid.emplace_back(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3078  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant, swapFaceInElement, config,
3079  standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact());
3080  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3081  }
3082  }
3083 
3084  /* Set indBegMarker to indEndMarker for the next marker. */
3085  indBegMarker = indEndMarker;
3086 
3087  /* Put boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem in cumulative storage. */
3088  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i)
3089  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i + 1] += boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i];
3090 
3091  /* Carry out another sort of the surface elements, such that surface elements
3092  belonging to the same standard element are contiguous in memory. In this
3093  way a simultaneous treatment of several surface elements is possible, which
3094  increases the performance. Note that this renumbering must happen within
3095  each time level. */
3096  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeLevels; ++i)
3097  sort(surfElem.begin() + boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i],
3098  surfElem.begin() + boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i + 1], CSortBoundaryFaces());
3099  }
3100  }
3101 }
3102 
3103 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateStandardVolumeElements(CConfig* config) {
3104  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and create new standard elements if needed.
3105  Note that a new standard element is created when either the solution
3106  element or the grid element does not match. Note further that for the
3107  standard element of the grid the order for the integration of the
3108  solution is used, such that the metric terms are computed in the correct
3109  integration points in case the polynomial order of the solution differs
3110  from that of the grid. ---*/
3111  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3112  /* Check the existing standard elements in the list. */
3113  unsigned long j;
3114  for (j = 0; j < standardElementsSol.size(); ++j) {
3115  if (standardElementsSol[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type, volElem[i].nPolySol,
3116  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant) &&
3117  standardElementsGrid[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type, volElem[i].nPolyGrid,
3118  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant)) {
3119  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3120  break;
3121  }
3122  }
3123 
3124  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3125  if (j == standardElementsSol.size()) {
3126  standardElementsSol.emplace_back(volElem[i].VTK_Type, volElem[i].nPolySol, volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3127  config);
3128 
3129  standardElementsGrid.emplace_back(volElem[i].VTK_Type, volElem[i].nPolyGrid, volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3130  config, standardElementsSol[j].GetOrderExact(),
3131  standardElementsSol[j].GetRDOFs(), standardElementsSol[j].GetSDOFs(),
3132  standardElementsSol[j].GetTDOFs());
3133  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3134  }
3135  }
3136 }
3137 
3138 void CMeshFEM_DG::SetSendReceive(const CConfig* config) {
3139  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3140  /*--- Step 1: Determine the ranks from which this rank has to receive data ---*/
3141  /*--- during the actual communication of halo data, as well as the ---*/
3142  /* data that must be communicated. ---*/
3143  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3144 
3145  /* Determine for every element the local offset of the solution DOFs.
3146  The if statement in the line below is to avoid problems when the
3147  partition is empty. */
3148  if (nVolElemTot) volElem[0].offsetDOFsSolLocal = 0;
3149  for (unsigned long i = 1; i < nVolElemTot; ++i)
3150  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolLocal = volElem[i - 1].offsetDOFsSolLocal + volElem[i - 1].nDOFsSol;
3151 
3152  /* Determine the ranks from which this rank will receive halo data. */
3153  vector<int> recvFromRank(size, 0);
3154  for (unsigned long i = nVolElemOwned; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) recvFromRank[volElem[i].rankOriginal] = 1;
3155 
3156  map<int, int> rankToIndRecvBuf;
3157  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3158  if (recvFromRank[i]) {
3159  int ind = (int)rankToIndRecvBuf.size();
3160  rankToIndRecvBuf[i] = ind;
3161  }
3162  }
3163 
3164  ranksRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3165  map<int, int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.begin();
3166  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < rankToIndRecvBuf.size(); ++i, ++MI) ranksRecv[i] = MI->first;
3167 
3168  /* Define and determine the buffers to send the global indices of my halo
3169  elements to the appropriate ranks and the vectors which store the
3170  elements that I will receive from these ranks. */
3171  vector<vector<unsigned long> > longBuf(rankToIndRecvBuf.size(), vector<unsigned long>(0));
3172  entitiesRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3173 
3174  for (unsigned long i = nVolElemOwned; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3175  MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.find(volElem[i].rankOriginal);
3176  longBuf[MI->second].push_back(volElem[i].elemIDGlobal);
3177 
3178  entitiesRecv[MI->second].push_back(i);
3179  }
3180 
3181  /* Determine the mapping from global element ID to local owned element ID. */
3182  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> globalElemIDToLocalInd;
3183  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) globalElemIDToLocalInd[volElem[i].elemIDGlobal] = i;
3184 
3185 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3186 
3187  /*--- Parallel mode. First determine the number of ranks to which this
3188  rank has to send halo data during the actual exchange. ---*/
3189  int nRankSend;
3190  vector<int> sizeReduce(size, 1);
3191 
3192  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvFromRank.data(), &nRankSend, sizeReduce.data(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3193 
3194  /* Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to the number of
3195  ranks to which this rank has to send data. */
3196  ranksSend.resize(nRankSend);
3197  entitiesSend.resize(nRankSend);
3198 
3199  /*--- Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
3200  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(ranksRecv.size());
3201 
3202  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
3203  int dest = ranksRecv[i];
3204  SU2_MPI::Isend(longBuf[i].data(), longBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
3205  &commReqs[i]);
3206  }
3207 
3208  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data about the
3209  global element ID's that I must send. */
3210  for (int i = 0; i < nRankSend; ++i) {
3211  /* Block until a message arrivesi and determine the source. */
3212  SU2_MPI::Status status;
3213  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3214  ranksSend[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
3215 
3216  /* Determine the size of the message, allocate the memory for the
3217  receive buffer and receive the message. */
3218  int sizeMess;
3219  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
3220 
3221  entitiesSend[i].resize(sizeMess);
3222  SU2_MPI::Recv(entitiesSend[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, ranksSend[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3223 
3224  /* Convert the global indices currently stored in entitiesSend[i]
3225  to local indices. */
3226  for (int j = 0; j < sizeMess; ++j) {
3227  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3228  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(entitiesSend[i][j]);
3229 
3230  if (LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end()) SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3231 
3232  entitiesSend[i][j] = LMI->second;
3233  }
3234  }
3235 
3236  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the rank, because
3237  wild cards have been used. */
3238  SU2_MPI::Waitall(ranksRecv.size(), commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3239  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3240 
3241 #else
3242  /* Sequential mode. Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to
3243  the number of ranks to which this rank has to send data. This number is
3244  only non-zero when periodic boundaries are present in the grid. */
3245  ranksSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3246  entitiesSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3247 
3248  /* Convert the global element ID's of longBuf to local indices, which are
3249  stored in entitiesSend[0]. Note that an additional test for longBuf.size()
3250  is necessary to avoid problems. */
3251  if (longBuf.size()) {
3252  entitiesSend[0].resize(longBuf[0].size());
3253 
3254  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < longBuf[0].size(); ++i) {
3255  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3256  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(longBuf[0][i]);
3257 
3258  if (LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end()) SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3259 
3260  entitiesSend[0][i] = LMI->second;
3261  }
3262  }
3263 
3264 #endif
3265 
3266  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3267  /*--- Step 2: Determine the rotational periodic transformations as well as ---*/
3268  /*--- the halo elements for which these must be applied. ---*/
3269  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3270 
3271  /*--- Loop over the markers and determine the mapping for the rotationally
3272  periodic transformations. The mapping is from the marker to the first
3273  index in the vectors to store the rotationally periodic halo elements. ---*/
3274  map<short, unsigned short> mapRotationalPeriodicToInd;
3275 
3276  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3277  if (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
3278  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
3279  if (fabs(angles[0]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[1]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[2]) > 1.e-5) {
3280  unsigned short curSize = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size();
3281  mapRotationalPeriodicToInd[iMarker] = curSize;
3282  }
3283  }
3284  }
3285 
3286  /* Store the rotationally periodic indices in rotPerMarkers. */
3287  rotPerMarkers.reserve(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3288  for (auto SMI = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.begin(); SMI != mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end(); ++SMI)
3289  rotPerMarkers.push_back(SMI->first);
3290 
3291  /* Resize the first index of rotPerHalos to the correct size. */
3292  rotPerHalos.resize(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3293 
3294  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and store the indices of the rotationally
3295  periodic halo elements in rotPerHalos. ---*/
3296  for (unsigned long i = nVolElemOwned; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3297  if (volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor > -1) {
3298  map<short, unsigned short>::const_iterator SMI;
3299  SMI = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.find(volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor);
3300 
3301  if (SMI != mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end()) rotPerHalos[SMI->second].push_back(i);
3302  }
3303  }
3304 }
3305 
3306 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesFace(const unsigned short VTK_TypeFace, const unsigned long* cornerPointsFace,
3307  const unsigned short VTK_TypeElem, const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3308  const vector<unsigned long>& elemNodeIDsGrid, const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3309  const unsigned long* connElem, bool& swapFaceInElement,
3310  unsigned long* modConnFace, unsigned long* modConnElem) {
3311  /*--- Set swapFaceInElement to false. This variable is only relevant for
3312  triangular faces of a pyramid and quadrilateral faces of a prism.
3313  Only for these situations this variable will be passed to the
3314  appropriate functions. ---*/
3315  swapFaceInElement = false;
3316 
3317  /*--- Make a distinction between the types of the volume element and call
3318  the appropriate function to do the actual job. ---*/
3319  switch (VTK_TypeElem) {
3320  case TRIANGLE:
3321  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn, connElem,
3322  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3323  break;
3324 
3325  case QUADRILATERAL:
3326  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn, connElem,
3327  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3328  break;
3329 
3330  case TETRAHEDRON:
3331  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn, connElem,
3332  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3333  break;
3334 
3335  case PYRAMID: {
3336  switch (VTK_TypeFace) {
3337  case TRIANGLE:
3338  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn, connElem,
3339  swapFaceInElement, modConnFace, modConnElem);
3340  break;
3341 
3342  case QUADRILATERAL:
3343  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3344  connElem, modConnFace, modConnElem);
3345  break;
3346  }
3347 
3348  break;
3349  }
3350 
3351  case PRISM: {
3352  switch (VTK_TypeFace) {
3353  case TRIANGLE:
3354  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn, connElem,
3355  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3356  break;
3357 
3358  case QUADRILATERAL:
3359  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3360  connElem, swapFaceInElement, modConnFace, modConnElem);
3361  break;
3362  }
3363 
3364  break;
3365  }
3366 
3367  case HEXAHEDRON:
3368  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid, elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3369  connElem, modConnFace, modConnElem);
3370  break;
3371  }
3372 }
3373 
3374 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(
3375  const unsigned long* cornerPointsLine, const unsigned short nPolyGrid, const vector<unsigned long>& quadNodeIDsGrid,
3376  const unsigned short nPolyConn, const unsigned long* connQuad, unsigned long* modConnLine,
3377  unsigned long* modConnQuad) {
3378  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral. */
3379  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3380  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3381  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 1) - 1;
3382  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
3383 
3384  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3385  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
3386  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3387 
3388  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3389  quadNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3390  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3391  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3392  in quadNodeIDsGrid (and connQuad). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3393  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3394  of the quad. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3395  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
