3396  it is checked for security. ---*/
3397  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
3398  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3399 
3400  if (vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3401  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the quad connectivity.
3402  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3403  if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3404  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3405  a = d = 0;
3406  b = f = 1;
3407  c = e = 0;
3408  } else if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3409  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3410  a = d = 0;
3411  b = f = 0;
3412  c = e = 1;
3413  } else {
3414  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3415  }
3416  } else if (vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3417  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the quad connectivity.
3418  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3419  if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3420  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3421  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction is the negative
3422  i-direction of the original numbering. */
3423  a = 0;
3424  d = nPolyConn;
3425  b = f = 0;
3426  c = 1;
3427  e = -1;
3428  } else if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3429  /* The i-direction is negated, while the j-direction coincides.
3430  This is a left handed transformation. */
3431  a = nPolyConn;
3432  d = 0;
3433  b = -1;
3434  f = 1;
3435  c = e = 0;
3436  } else {
3437  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3438  }
3439  } else if (vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3440  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the quad connectivity.
3441  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3442  if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3443  /* Both the i- and j-direction are negated. */
3444  a = d = nPolyConn;
3445  b = f = -1;
3446  c = e = 0;
3447  } else if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3448  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3449  new j-direction is the original negative i-direction. This is a
3450  left handed transformation. */
3451  a = d = nPolyConn;
3452  b = f = 0;
3453  c = e = -1;
3454  } else {
3455  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3456  }
3457  } else if (vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3458  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 3 of the quad connectivity.
3459  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3460  if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3461  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3462  new j-direction is the original i-direction. */
3463  a = nPolyConn;
3464  d = 0;
3465  b = f = 0;
3466  c = -1;
3467  e = 1;
3468  } else if (vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3469  /* The i-directions coincide while the j-direction is negated.
3470  This is a left handed transformation. */
3471  a = 0;
3472  d = nPolyConn;
3473  b = 1;
3474  f = -1;
3475  c = e = 0;
3476  } else {
3477  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3478  }
3479  } else {
3480  /* Vert0 does not match with any of the corner vertices of the quad. */
3481  verticesDontMatch = true;
3482  }
3483 
3484  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3485  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3486 
3487  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original quad to create the connectivity
3488  of the quad that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3489  unsigned short ind = 0;
3490  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= nPolyConn; ++j) {
3491  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
3492  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3493  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnQuad. ---*/
3494  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c;
3495  unsigned short jj = d + i * e + j * f;
3496  unsigned short iind = jj * (nPolyConn + 1) + ii;
3497 
3498  modConnQuad[iind] = connQuad[ind];
3499  }
3500  }
3501 
3502  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the quadrilateral. Hence the first
3503  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnQuad are the DOFs of the line. Copy
3504  these entries from modConnQuad. ---*/
3505  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i) modConnLine[i] = modConnQuad[i];
3506 }
3507 
3508 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(const unsigned long* cornerPointsLine,
3509  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3510  const vector<unsigned long>& triaNodeIDsGrid,
3511  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3512  const unsigned long* connTria, unsigned long* modConnLine,
3513  unsigned long* modConnTria) {
3514  /* Determine the indices of the 3 corner vertices of the triangle. */
3515  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3516  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3517  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) / 2 - 1;
3518 
3519  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3520  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
3521  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3522 
3523  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3524  triaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3525  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3526  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3527  in triaNodeIDsGrid (and connTria). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3528  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3529  of the triangle. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3530  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3531  it is checked for security. ---*/
3532  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
3533  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3534 
3535  if (vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3536  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the triangle connectivity.
3537  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3538  if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3539  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3540  a = 0;
3541  b = 1;
3542  c = 0;
3543  d = 0;
3544  e = 0;
3545  f = 1;
3546  } else if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3547  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3548  a = 0;
3549  b = 0;
3550  c = 1;
3551  d = 0;
3552  e = 1;
3553  f = 0;
3554  } else {
3555  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3556  }
3557  } else if (vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3558  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the triangle connectivity.
3559  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3560  if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3561  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3562  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to
3563  a combination of the original i- and j-direction. */
3564  a = 0;
3565  b = 0;
3566  c = 1;
3567  d = nPolyConn;
3568  e = -1;
3569  f = -1;
3570  } else if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3571  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3572  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3573  to the j-direction of the original numbering. This is a left
3574  handed transformation. */
3575  a = nPolyConn;
3576  b = -1;
3577  c = -1;
3578  d = 0;
3579  e = 0;
3580  f = 1;
3581  } else {
3582  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3583  }
3584  } else if (vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3585  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the triangle connectivity.
3586  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3587  if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3588  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3589  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3590  to the i-direction of the original numbering. */
3591  a = nPolyConn;
3592  b = -1;
3593  c = -1;
3594  d = 0;
3595  e = 1;
3596  f = 0;
3597  } else if (vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3598  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the i-direction of
3599  the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to a
3600  combination of the original i- and j-direction. This is a left handed
3601  transformation. */
3602  a = 0;
3603  b = 1;
3604  c = 0;
3605  d = nPolyConn;
3606  e = -1;
3607  f = -1;
3608  } else {
3609  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3610  }
3611  }
3612 
3613  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3614  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3615 
3616  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original triangle to create the connectivity
3617  of the triangle that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3618  unsigned short ind = 0;
3619  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= nPolyConn; ++j) {
3620  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= (nPolyConn - j); ++i, ++ind) {
3621  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3622  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTria. ---*/
3623  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c;
3624  unsigned short jj = d + i * e + j * f;
3625 
3626  unsigned short iind = jj * (nPolyConn + 1) + ii - jj * (jj - 1) / 2;
3627 
3628  modConnTria[iind] = connTria[ind];
3629  }
3630  }
3631 
3632  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the triangle. Hence the first
3633  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnTria are the DOFs of the line. Copy
3634  these entries from modConnTria. ---*/
3635  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i) modConnLine[i] = modConnTria[i];
3636 }
3637 
3638 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(
3639  const unsigned long* cornerPointsQuad, const unsigned short nPolyGrid, const vector<unsigned long>& hexaNodeIDsGrid,
3640  const unsigned short nPolyConn, const unsigned long* connHexa, unsigned long* modConnQuad,
3641  unsigned long* modConnHexa) {
3642  /* Determine the indices of the eight corner points of the hexahedron. */
3643  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3644  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3645  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 1) - 1;
3646  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
3647  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 1) * nPolyGrid;
3648  const unsigned short ind5 = ind1 + ind4;
3649  const unsigned short ind6 = ind2 + ind4;
3650  const unsigned short ind7 = ind3 + ind4;
3651 
3652  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
3653  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
3654  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
3655  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
3656  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
3657 
3658  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3659  hexaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3660  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
3661  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
3662  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in hexaNodeIDsGrid
3663  (and connHexa). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
3664  depend on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points
3665  of the hexahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3666  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3667  it is checked for security. ---*/
3668  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0, l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
3669  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3670 
3671  if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
3672  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
3673  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
3674  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
3675  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
3676  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
3677  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
3678  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
3679  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
3680  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
3681  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
3682  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
3683  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
3684  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
3685  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
3686  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
3687  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
3688  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
3689  }
3690 
3691  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3692  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
3693  a = nPolyConn;
3694  b = -1;
3695  g = o = 1; // kk = k.
3696  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
3697  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3698  e = nPolyConn;
3699  f = -1;
3700  c = o = 1; // kk = k.
3701  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3702  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
3703  a = nPolyConn;
3704  b = -1;
3705  h = n = 1; // kk = j.
3706  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
3707  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3708  e = nPolyConn;
3709  f = -1;
3710  d = n = 1; // kk = j.
3711  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
3712  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
3713  l = nPolyConn;
3714  m = -1;
3715  c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3716  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
3717  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
3718  l = nPolyConn;
3719  m = -1;
3720  d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3721  }
3722 
3723  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3724  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3725  a = e = nPolyConn;
3726  c = f = -1;
3727  o = 1; // kk = k.
3728  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3729  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3730  a = e = nPolyConn;
3731  b = g = -1;
3732  o = 1; // kk = k.
3733  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3734  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
3735  a = l = nPolyConn;
3736  c = m = -1;
3737  h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3738  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
3739  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3740  e = l = nPolyConn;
3741  g = m = -1;
3742  d = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3743  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3744  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
3745  a = l = nPolyConn;
3746  b = n = -1;
3747  h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3748  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
3749  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3750  e = l = nPolyConn;
3751  f = n = -1;
3752  d = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3753  }
3754 
3755  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3756  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
3757  a = nPolyConn;
3758  c = -1;
3759  f = o = 1; // kk = k.
3760  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
3761  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3762  e = nPolyConn;
3763  g = -1;
3764  b = o = 1; // kk = k.
3765  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3766  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
3767  a = nPolyConn;
3768  c = -1;
3769  h = m = 1; // kk = i.
3770  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
3771  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3772  e = nPolyConn;
3773  g = -1;
3774  d = m = 1; // kk = i.
3775  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
3776  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
3777  l = nPolyConn;
3778  n = -1;
3779  b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3780  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
3781  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
3782  l = nPolyConn;
3783  n = -1;
3784  d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3785  }
3786 
3787  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
3788  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
3789  l = nPolyConn;
3790  o = -1;
3791  b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3792  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
3793  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
3794  l = nPolyConn;
3795  o = -1;
3796  c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3797  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
3798  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3799  e = nPolyConn;
3800  h = -1;
3801  b = n = 1; // kk = j.
3802  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3803  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
3804  a = nPolyConn;
3805  d = -1;
3806  f = n = 1; // kk = j.
3807  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
3808  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3809  e = nPolyConn;
3810  h = -1;
3811  c = m = 1; // kk = i.
3812  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3813  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
3814  a = nPolyConn;
3815  d = -1;
3816  g = m = 1; // kk = i.
3817  }
3818 
3819  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
3820  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3821  e = l = nPolyConn;
3822  f = o = -1;
3823  c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3824  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3825  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
3826  a = l = nPolyConn;
3827  b = o = -1;
3828  g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3829  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
3830  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3831  e = l = nPolyConn;
3832  h = m = -1;
3833  c = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3834  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3835  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
3836  a = l = nPolyConn;
3837  d = m = -1;
3838  g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3839  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3840  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3841  a = e = nPolyConn;
3842  d = f = -1;
3843  n = 1; // kk = j.
3844  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3845  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3846  a = e = nPolyConn;
3847  b = h = -1;
3848  n = 1; // kk = j.
3849  }
3850 
3851  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3852  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3853  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3854  b = g = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3855  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3856  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3857  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3858  c = f = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3859  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
3860  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3861  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3862  b = h = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3863  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3864  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
3865  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3866  d = f = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3867  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3868  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3869  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3870  d = g = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3871  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3872  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3873  a = e = l = nPolyConn;
3874  c = h = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
3875  }
3876 
3877  else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3878  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
3879  a = l = nPolyConn;
3880  c = o = -1;
3881  f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3882  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
3883  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3884  e = l = nPolyConn;
3885  g = o = -1;
3886  b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
3887  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
3888  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3889  a = e = nPolyConn;
3890  c = h = -1;
3891  m = 1; // kk = i.
3892  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3893  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
3894  a = e = nPolyConn;
3895  d = g = -1;
3896  m = 1; // kk = i.
3897  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
3898  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
3899  e = l = nPolyConn;
3900  h = n = -1;
3901  b = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3902  } else if (vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
3903  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
3904  a = l = nPolyConn;
3905  d = n = -1;
3906  f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
3907  }
3908 
3909  else {
3910  verticesDontMatch = true;
3911  }
3912 
3913  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3914  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3915 
3916  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original hexahedron to create the connectivity
3917  of the hexahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3918  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn + 1) * (nPolyConn + 1);
3919  unsigned short ind = 0;
3920  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
3921  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= nPolyConn; ++j) {
3922  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
3923  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3924  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnHexa. ---*/
3925  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c + k * d;
3926  unsigned short jj = e + i * f + j * g + k * h;
3927  unsigned short kk = l + i * m + j * n + k * o;
3928  unsigned short iind = kk * nn2 + jj * (nPolyConn + 1) + ii;
3929 
3930  modConnHexa[iind] = connHexa[ind];
3931  }
3932  }
3933  }
3934 
3935  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the hexahedron. Hence the first
3936  nn2 entries in modConnHexa are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
3937  these entries from modConnHexa. ---*/
3938  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nn2; ++i) modConnQuad[i] = modConnHexa[i];
3939 }
3940 
3941 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(
3942  const unsigned long* cornerPointsQuad, const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3943  const vector<unsigned long>& prismNodeIDsGrid, const unsigned short nPolyConn, const unsigned long* connPrism,
3944  bool& swapFaceInElement, unsigned long* modConnQuad, unsigned long* modConnPrism) {
3945  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
3946  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3947  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3948  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) / 2 - 1;
3949  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) * nPolyGrid / 2;
3950  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
3951  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
3952 
3953  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
3954  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
3955  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
3956  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
3957  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
3958 
3959  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3960  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
3961  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
3962  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
3963  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
3964  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
3965  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism. As a
3966  consequence also the variable swapFaceInElement is needed to cover all
3967  possible situations. The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend
3968  on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points of the
3969  prism. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to
3970  check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked
3971  for security. ---*/
3972  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
3973  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3974 
3975  if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
3976  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
3977  b = f = h = 1;
3978  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
3979  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = i.
3980  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
3981  b = f = h = 1;
3982  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
3983  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
3984  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
3985  c = e = h = 1;
3986  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
3987  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
3988  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
3989  c = e = h = 1;
3990  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
3991  }
3992 
3993  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
3994  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
3995  a = nPolyConn;
3996  b = c = -1;
3997  f = h = 1;
3998  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
3999  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4000  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4001  a = nPolyConn;
4002  b = c = -1;
4003  f = h = 1;
4004  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4005  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4006  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4007  d = nPolyConn;
4008  e = f = -1;
4009  c = h = 1;
4010  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4011  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = j.
4012  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4013  d = nPolyConn;
4014  e = f = -1;
4015  c = h = 1;
4016  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4017  }
4018 
4019  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4020  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4021  a = nPolyConn;
4022  b = c = -1;
4023  e = h = 1;
4024  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4025  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4026  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4027  a = nPolyConn;
4028  b = c = -1;
4029  e = h = 1;
4030  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4031  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4032  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4033  d = nPolyConn;
4034  e = f = -1;
4035  b = h = 1;
4036  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4037  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4038  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4039  d = nPolyConn;
4040  e = f = -1;
4041  b = h = 1;
4042  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4043  }
4044 
4045  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4046  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4047  g = nPolyConn;
4048  b = f = 1;
4049  h = -1;
4050  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4051  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = i.
4052  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
4053  g = nPolyConn;
4054  b = f = 1;
4055  h = -1;
4056  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4057  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4058  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4059  g = nPolyConn;
4060  c = e = 1;
4061  h = -1;
4062  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4063  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = j.
4064  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4065  g = nPolyConn;
4066  c = e = 1;
4067  h = -1;
4068  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4069  }
4070 
4071  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4072  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
4073  a = g = nPolyConn;
4074  b = c = h = -1;
4075  f = 1;
4076  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4077  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4078  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4079  a = g = nPolyConn;
4080  b = c = h = -1;
4081  f = 1;
4082  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4083  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4084  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4085  d = g = nPolyConn;
4086  e = f = h = -1;
4087  c = 1;
4088  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4089  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = j.
4090  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4091  d = g = nPolyConn;
4092  e = f = h = -1;
4093  c = 1;
4094  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4095  }
4096 
4097  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4098  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4099  a = g = nPolyConn;
4100  b = c = h = -1;
4101  e = 1;
4102  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4103  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4104  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
4105  a = g = nPolyConn;
4106  b = c = h = -1;
4107  e = 1;
4108  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4109  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4110  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4111  d = g = nPolyConn;
4112  e = f = h = -1;
4113  b = 1;
4114  swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4115  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4116  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4117  d = g = nPolyConn;
4118  e = f = h = -1;
4119  b = 1;
4120  swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4121  }
4122 
4123  else {
4124  verticesDontMatch = true;
4125  }
4126 
4127  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4128  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4129 
4130  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4131  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4132  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn + 1) * (nPolyConn + 2) / 2;
4133  unsigned short ind = 0;
4134  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
4135  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= nPolyConn; ++j) {
4136  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4137  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4138  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4139  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4140  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c;
4141  unsigned short jj = d + i * e + j * f;
4142  unsigned short kk = g + h * k;
4143  unsigned short iind = kk * kOff + jj * (nPolyConn + 1) + ii - jj * (jj - 1) / 2;
4144 
4145  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4146  }
4147  }
4148  }
4149 
4150  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the quadrilateral face. ---*/
4151  if (swapFaceInElement) {
4152  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad must be swapped
4153  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the prism.
4154  This means that the coordinate r of the quad runs from the base
4155  triangle to the top triangle of the prism. This corresponds to
4156  the k-direction of the prism. Hence the s-direction of the quad
4157  corresponds to the i-direction of the prism. ---*/
4158  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
4159  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i) {
4160  const unsigned short iind = i * (nPolyConn + 1) + k;
4161  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k * kOff + i];
4162  }
4163  }
4164  } else {
4165  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad correspond to the
4166  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4167  prism. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4168  unsigned short iind = 0;
4169  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
4170  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= nPolyConn; ++i, ++iind) {
4171  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k * kOff + i];
4172  }
4173  }
4174  }
4175 }
4176 
4177 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(
4178  const unsigned long* cornerPointsQuad, const unsigned short nPolyGrid, const vector<unsigned long>& pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4179  const unsigned short nPolyConn, const unsigned long* connPyra, unsigned long* modConnQuad,
4180  unsigned long* modConnPyra) {
4181  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral
4182  base of the pyramid. Note that the top of the pyramid is not needed
4183  in the comparison, because only triangular faces are attached to it. */
4184  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4185  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4186  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 1) - 1;
4187  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4188 
4189  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4190  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4191  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4192  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4193  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4194 
4195  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4196  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4197  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4198  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4199  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4200  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the quad
4201  coincide with the corner points of the quadrilateral base of the pyramid.
4202  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4203  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4204  security. Note that this mapping is less complicated than for a prism or
4205  hexahedron, because a pyramid only has one quadrilateral face and hence
4206  the k-direction has to match. ---*/
4207  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4208  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4209 
4210  if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4211  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4212  b = f = 1;
4213  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4214  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4215  c = e = 1;
4216  }
4217 
4218  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4219  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4220  d = nPolyConn;
4221  c = 1;
4222  e = -1;
4223  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4224  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4225  a = nPolyConn;
4226  b = -1;
4227  f = 1;
4228  }
4229 
4230  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4231  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4232  a = d = nPolyConn;
4233  b = f = -1;
4234  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4235  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4236  a = d = nPolyConn;
4237  c = e = -1;
4238  }
4239 
4240  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4241  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4242  a = nPolyConn;
4243  c = -1;
4244  e = 1;
4245  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4246  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4247  d = nPolyConn;
4248  b = 1;
4249  f = -1;
4250  }
4251 
4252  else {
4253  verticesDontMatch = true;
4254  }
4255 
4256  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4257  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4258 
4259  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4260  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4261  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4262  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4263  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4264 
4265  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4266  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4267 
4268  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4269  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4270  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4271  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4272 
4273  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4274  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= mPoly; ++j) {
4275  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4276  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4277  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4278  unsigned short ii = aa + i * b + j * c;
4279  unsigned short jj = dd + i * e + j * f;
4280  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj * (mPoly + 1) + ii;
4281 
4282  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4283  }
4284  }
4285 
4286  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4287  offLevel += (mPoly + 1) * (mPoly + 1);
4288  }
4289 
4290  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the pyramid. Hence the first
4291  nn2 entries in modConnPyra are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
4292  these entries from modConnPyra. ---*/
4293  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn + 1) * (nPolyConn + 1);
4294  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nn2; ++i) modConnQuad[i] = modConnPyra[i];
4295 }
4296 
4297 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(const unsigned long* cornerPointsTria,
4298  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4299  const vector<unsigned long>& prismNodeIDsGrid,
4300  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4301  const unsigned long* connPrism, unsigned long* modConnTria,
4302  unsigned long* modConnPrism) {
4303  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
4304  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4305  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4306  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) / 2 - 1;
4307  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) * nPolyGrid / 2;
4308  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
4309  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
4310 
4311  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4312  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4313  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4314  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4315 
4316  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4317  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
4318  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
4319  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
4320  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
4321  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
4322  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism.
4323  The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend on how the corner
4324  points of the triangle coincide with the corner points of the prism. This
4325  is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check if vertices
4326  do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for security. ---*/
4327  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
4328  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4329 
4330  if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4331  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4332  b = f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4333  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4334  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4335  c = e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4336  }
4337 
4338  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4339  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4340  a = nPolyConn;
4341  b = c = -1;
4342  f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4343  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4344  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4345  d = nPolyConn;
4346  e = f = -1;
4347  c = h = 1; // kk = k.
4348  }
4349 
4350  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4351  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4352  a = nPolyConn;
4353  b = c = -1;
4354  e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4355  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4356  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4357  d = nPolyConn;
4358  e = f = -1;
4359  b = h = 1; // kk = k.
4360  }
4361 
4362  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4363  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4364  g = nPolyConn;
4365  b = f = 1;
4366  h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4367  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4368  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4369  g = nPolyConn;
4370  c = e = 1;
4371  h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4372  }
4373 
4374  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4375  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4376  a = g = nPolyConn;
4377  b = c = h = -1;
4378  f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4379  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4380  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4381  d = g = nPolyConn;
4382  e = f = h = -1;
4383  c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4384  }
4385 
4386  else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4387  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4388  a = g = nPolyConn;
4389  b = c = h = -1;
4390  e = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4391  } else if (vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4392  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4393  d = g = nPolyConn;
4394  e = f = h = -1;
4395  b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4396  }
4397 
4398  else {
4399  verticesDontMatch = true;
4400  }
4401 
4402  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4403  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4404 
4405  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4406  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4407  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn + 1) * (nPolyConn + 2) / 2;
4408  unsigned short ind = 0;
4409  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
4410  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= nPolyConn; ++j) {
4411  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4412  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4413  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4414  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4415  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c;
4416  unsigned short jj = d + i * e + j * f;
4417  unsigned short kk = g + h * k;
4418  unsigned short iind = kk * kOff + jj * (nPolyConn + 1) + ii - jj * (jj - 1) / 2;
4419 
4420  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4421  }
4422  }
4423  }
4424 
4425  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the prism. Hence the first
4426  kOff entries in modConnPrism are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy
4427  these entries from modConnPrism. ---*/
4428  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < kOff; ++i) modConnTria[i] = modConnPrism[i];
4429 }
4430 
4431 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(const unsigned long* cornerPointsTria,
4432  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4433  const vector<unsigned long>& pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4434  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4435  const unsigned long* connPyra, bool& swapFaceInElement,
4436  unsigned long* modConnTria, unsigned long* modConnPyra) {
4437  /* Determine the indices of the five corner points of the pyramid. */
4438  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4439  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4440  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 1) - 1;
4441  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4442  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) * (2 * nPolyGrid + 3) / 6 - 1;
4443 
4444  /* Check if the top of the pyramid coincides with either corner point 1 or
4445  corner point 2 of the triangle. Set swapFaceInElement accordingly. */
4446  if (cornerPointsTria[1] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4])
4447  swapFaceInElement = true;
4448  else if (cornerPointsTria[2] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4])
4449  swapFaceInElement = false;
4450  else
4451  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Top of the pyramid does not coincide with either corner point 1 or 2.\n") +
4452  string("This should not happen"),
4453  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4454 
4455  /* Easier storage of the two other corner points of the triangle in the new numbering.
4456  vert0 always corresponds to cornerPointsTria[0], while vert1 contains the other
4457  point that is not equal to the top of the pyramid. This depends on swapFaceInElement. */
4458  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4459  const unsigned long vert1 = swapFaceInElement ? cornerPointsTria[2] : cornerPointsTria[1];
4460 
4461  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4462  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4463  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4464  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4465  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4466  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the triangle
4467  coincide with the corner points of the triangular face of the pyramid.
4468  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4469  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4470  security. ---*/
4471  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4472  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4473 
4474  if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = i.
4475  b = f = 1; // jj = j.
4476  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = j.
4477  c = e = 1; // jj = i.
4478  }
4479 
4480  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = j.
4481  d = nPolyConn;
4482  c = 1;
4483  e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4484  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4485  a = nPolyConn;
4486  b = -1;
4487  f = 1; // jj = j.
4488  }
4489 
4490  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4491  a = d = nPolyConn;
4492  b = f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4493  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4494  a = d = nPolyConn;
4495  c = e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4496  }
4497 
4498  else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4499  a = nPolyConn;
4500  c = -1;
4501  e = 1; // jj = i.
4502  } else if (vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = i.
4503  d = nPolyConn;
4504  b = 1;
4505  f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4506  }
4507 
4508  else {
4509  verticesDontMatch = true;
4510  }
4511 
4512  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4513  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4514 
4515  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4516  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4517  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4518  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4519  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4520 
4521  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4522  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4523 
4524  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4525  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4526  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4527  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4528 
4529  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4530  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= mPoly; ++j) {
4531  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4532  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4533  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4534  unsigned short ii = aa + i * b + j * c;
4535  unsigned short jj = dd + i * e + j * f;
4536  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj * (mPoly + 1) + ii;
4537 
4538  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4539  }
4540  }
4541 
4542  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4543  offLevel += (mPoly + 1) * (mPoly + 1);
4544  }
4545 
4546  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the triangular face. ---*/
4547  if (swapFaceInElement) {
4548  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle must be swapped
4549  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the pyramid.
4550  This means that the coordinate r of the triangle runs from the base
4551  to the top of the pyramid. This corresponds to the k-direction of the
4552  pyramid. Hence the s-direction of the triangle corresponds to the
4553  i-direction of the pyramid. ---*/
4554  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4555  offLevel = 0;
4556  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4557  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= mPoly; ++i) {
4558  unsigned short iind = i * (nPolyConn + 1) + k - i * (i - 1) / 2;
4559  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel + i];
4560  }
4561  offLevel += (mPoly + 1) * (mPoly + 1);
4562  }
4563  } else {
4564  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle correspond to the
4565  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4566  pyramid. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4567  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4568  offLevel = 0;
4569  unsigned short iind = 0;
4570  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4571  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= mPoly; ++i, ++iind) {
4572  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel + i];
4573  }
4574  offLevel += (mPoly + 1) * (mPoly + 1);
4575  }
4576  }
4577 }
4578 
4579 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(
4580  const unsigned long* cornerPointsTria, const unsigned short nPolyGrid, const vector<unsigned long>& tetNodeIDsGrid,
4581  const unsigned short nPolyConn, const unsigned long* connTet, unsigned long* modConnTria,
4582  unsigned long* modConnTet) {
4583  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the tetrahedron. */
4584  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4585  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4586  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) / 2 - 1;
4587  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid + 1) * (nPolyGrid + 2) * (nPolyGrid + 3) / 6 - 1;
4588 
4589  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4590  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4591  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4592  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4593 
4594  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4595  tetNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4596  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
4597  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
4598  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in tetNodeIDsGrid
4599  (and connTet). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
4600  depend on how the corner points of the triangle coincide with the corner points
4601  of the tetrahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
4602  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
4603  it is checked for security. ---*/
4604  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0, l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
4605  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4606 
4607  if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4608  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4609  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4610  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4611  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4612  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4613  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4614  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4615  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4616  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4617  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4618  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4619  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4620  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4621  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4622  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4623  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4624  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4625  }
4626 
4627  else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4628  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4629  a = nPolyConn;
4630  b = c = d = -1;
4631  g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4632  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4633  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4634  e = nPolyConn;
4635  f = g = h = -1;
4636  c = o = 1; // kk = k.
4637  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4638  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4639  a = nPolyConn;
4640  b = c = d = -1;
4641  h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4642  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4643  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4644  e = nPolyConn;
4645  f = g = h = -1;
4646  d = n = 1; // kk = j.
4647  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4648  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4649  l = nPolyConn;
4650  m = n = o = -1;
4651  c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4652  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4653  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4654  l = nPolyConn;
4655  m = n = o = -1;
4656  d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4657  }
4658 
4659  else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4660  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4661  a = nPolyConn;
4662  b = c = d = -1;
4663  f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4664  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4665  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4666  e = nPolyConn;
4667  f = g = h = -1;
4668  b = o = 1; // kk = k.
4669  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4670  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4671  a = nPolyConn;
4672  b = c = d = -1;
4673  h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4674  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4675  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4676  e = nPolyConn;
4677  f = g = h = -1;
4678  d = m = 1; // kk = i.
4679  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4680  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4681  a = nPolyConn;
4682  b = c = d = -1;
4683  h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4684  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4685  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4686  l = nPolyConn;
4687  m = n = o = -1;
4688  b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4689  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4690  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4691  l = nPolyConn;
4692  m = n = o = -1;
4693  d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4694  }
4695 
4696  else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4697  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4698  a = nPolyConn;
4699  b = c = d = -1;
4700  f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4701  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4702  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4703  e = nPolyConn;
4704  f = g = h = -1;
4705  b = n = 1; // kk = j.
4706  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4707  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4708  a = nPolyConn;
4709  b = c = d = -1;
4710  g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4711  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4712  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4713  e = nPolyConn;
4714  f = g = h = -1;
4715  c = m = 1; // kk = i.
4716  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4717  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4718  l = nPolyConn;
4719  m = n = o = -1;
4720  b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4721  } else if (vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4722  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4723  l = nPolyConn;
4724  m = n = o = -1;
4725  c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4726  }
4727 
4728  else {
4729  verticesDontMatch = true;
4730  }
4731 
4732  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4733  if (verticesDontMatch) SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4734 
4735  /*--- Some constants to convert the (ii,jj,kk) indices to a 1D index. ---*/
4736  const unsigned short abv1 = (11 + 12 * nPolyConn + 3 * nPolyConn * nPolyConn);
4737  const unsigned short abv2 = (2 * nPolyConn + 3) * 3;
4738  const unsigned short abv3 = (nPolyConn + 2) * 3;
4739 
4740  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original tetrahedron to create the connectivity
4741  of the tetrahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4742  unsigned short ind = 0;
4743  for (unsigned short k = 0; k <= nPolyConn; ++k) {
4744  unsigned short uppBoundJ = nPolyConn - k;
4745  for (unsigned short j = 0; j <= uppBoundJ; ++j) {
4746  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - k - j;
4747  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4748  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4749  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTet. ---*/
4750  unsigned short ii = a + i * b + j * c + k * d;
4751  unsigned short jj = e + i * f + j * g + k * h;
4752  unsigned short kk = l + i * m + j * n + k * o;
4753  unsigned short iind =
4754  (abv1 * kk + abv2 * jj + 6 * ii - abv3 * kk * kk - 6 * kk * jj - 3 * jj * jj + kk * kk * kk) / 6;
4755 
4756  modConnTet[iind] = connTet[ind];
4757  }
4758  }
4759  }
4760 
4761  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the tetrahedron. Hence the first
4762  nn2 entries in modConnTet are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy these
4763  entries from modConnTet. ---*/
4764  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn + 1) * (nPolyConn + 2) / 2;
4765  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nn2; ++i) modConnTria[i] = modConnTet[i];
4766 }
4767 
4768 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsMatchingFaces(CConfig* config) {
4769  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
4770  bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER &&
4771  config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
4772 
4773  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
4774  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
4775  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4776  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
4777  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
4778  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
4779  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. for both sides (nDim*nDim per ---*/
4780  /*--- integration point) ---*/
4781  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
4782  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4783 
4784  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
4785  relevant information from it. */
4786  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
4787  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
4788 
4789  /* Allocate the memory for the vectors to store the different face
4790  metric terms. */
4791  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt * (nDim + 1));
4792 
4793  if (viscousTerms) {
4794  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.resize(nInt * nDim * nDim);
4795  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.resize(nInt * nDim * nDim);
4796  }
4797 
4798  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
4799  default value of zero. */
4800  matchingFaces[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt * nDim, 0.0);
4801 
4802  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4803  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
4804  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
4805  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4806 
4807  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
4808  its corresponding area in the integration points. The data from side 0
4809  is used, but the data from side 1 should give the same result. */
4810  unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
4811  const su2double* dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
4812  const su2double* ds = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
4813 
4814  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
4815  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
4816 
4817  /* Check whether the viscous terms are needed in the discretization. */
4818  if (viscousTerms) {
4819  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
4820  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
4821  on side 0 of the face. */
4822  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide0();
4823  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide0();
4824 
4825  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide0.data(),
4826  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.data(), config);
4827 
4828  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
4829  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
4830  on side 1 of the face. */
4831  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide1();
4832  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide1();
4833 
4834  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide1.data(),
4835  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.data(), config);
4836  }
4837  }
4838 }
4839 
4840 void CMeshFEM_DG::LengthScaleVolumeElements() {
4841  /* Initialize the length scale of the elements to zero. */
4842  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemTot; ++i) volElem[i].lenScale = 0.0;
4843 
4844  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4845  /*--- Step 1: Determine the maximum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
4846  /*--- surrounding faces of the elements. ---*/
4847  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4848 
4849  /*--- First the physical boundaries. Loop over them. ---*/
4850  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < boundaries.size(); ++j) {
4851  if (!boundaries[j].periodicBoundary) {
4852  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < boundaries[j].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
4853  /* Easier storage of corresponding volume element and the metric data
4854  for the normals of this surface element, determine the number of
4855  integration points for this surface element and loop over them. */
4856  const unsigned long volInd = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].volElemID;
4857  const su2double* normals = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
4858  const unsigned short ind = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
4859  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
4860 
4861  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
4862  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
4863  the corresponding volume element. */
4864  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nInt; ++k)
4865  volElem[volInd].lenScale = max(volElem[volInd].lenScale, normals[k * (nDim + 1) + nDim]);
4866  }
4867  }
4868  }
4869 
4870  /*--- Loop over the matching internal faces to update the maximum Jacobian
4871  of the surrounding faces. ---*/
4872  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
4873  /* Easier storage of the ID's of the two adjacent elements, determine the
4874  corresponding standard face element, the number of integration points
4875  and store the metric data of the face a bit easier. */
4876  const unsigned long v0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
4877  const unsigned long v1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
4878  const su2double* normals = matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
4879  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
4880  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
4881 
4882  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
4883  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
4884  the neigbhoring volume elements. */
4885  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nInt; ++k) {
4886  const su2double area = normals[k * (nDim + 1) + nDim];
4887  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, area);
4888  volElem[v1].lenScale = max(volElem[v1].lenScale, area);
4889  }
4890  }
4891 
4892  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4893  /*--- Step 2: Communicate the currently stored data of the halo ---*/
4894  /*--- elements to the ranks where the original is stored. ---*/
4895  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4896 
4897 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
4898 
4899  /*--- Define the buffers needed for the communication. ---*/
4900  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendRequests(ranksSend.size());
4901  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> recvRequests(ranksRecv.size());
4902 
4903  vector<vector<su2double> > sendBuf(ranksSend.size());
4904  vector<vector<su2double> > recvBuf(ranksRecv.size());
4905 
4906  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication.
4907  Note that the inverse communication pattern must be used for this
4908  purpose. ---*/
4909  unsigned long nRecvRequests = 0;
4910  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
4911  if (ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
4912  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer. */
4913  recvBuf[i].resize(entitiesRecv[i].size());
4914 
4915  /* Fill the buffer to be sent, which is the receive
4916  information of the original communication pattern. */
4917  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j) recvBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale;
4918 
4919  /* Send the data. */
4920  SU2_MPI::Isend(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, ranksRecv[i], ranksRecv[i] + 10,
4921  SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
4922  }
4923  }
4924 
4925  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives. Exclude self communication.
4926  Also here the inverse communication pattern must be used. ---*/
4927  unsigned long nSendRequests = 0;
4928  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
4929  if (ranksSend[i] != rank) {
4930  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer and post the receive. */
4931  sendBuf[i].resize(entitiesSend[i].size());
4932 
4933  SU2_MPI::Irecv(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, ranksSend[i], rank + 10, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
4934  &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
4935  }
4936  }
4937 
4938 #endif
4939 
4940  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
4941  is outside the MPI part. First determine if self communication
4942  takes place at all. ---*/
4943  bool selfComm = false;
4944  unsigned long selfRecvInd, selfSendInd = 0;
4945  for (selfRecvInd = 0; selfRecvInd < ranksRecv.size(); ++selfRecvInd) {
4946  if (ranksRecv[selfRecvInd] == rank) {
4947  selfComm = true;
4948  break;
4949  }
4950  }
4951 
4952  /*--- Determine the send index for self communication and update the
4953  data of the owners with the halo data, if self communication
4954  takes place. ---*/
4955  if (selfComm) {
4956  for (selfSendInd = 0; selfSendInd < ranksSend.size(); ++selfSendInd) {
4957  if (ranksSend[selfSendInd] == rank) break;
4958  }
4959 
4960  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
4961  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
4962  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
4963 
4964  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, volElem[v1].lenScale);
4965  }
4966  }
4967 
4968 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
4969 
4970  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
4971  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4972  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
4973 
4974  /*--- Update the variable currently stored in lenScale for the
4975  owned elements. ---*/
4976  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
4977  if (ranksSend[i] != rank) {
4978  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j) {
4979  const unsigned long ind = entitiesSend[i][j];
4980  volElem[ind].lenScale = max(volElem[ind].lenScale, sendBuf[i][j]);
4981  }
4982  }
4983  }
4984 
4985 #endif
4986 
4987  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4988  /*--- Step 3: Determine the minimum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
4989  /*--- elements and from that the length scale of the ---*/
4990  /*--- owned elements. ---*/
4991  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4992 
4993  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
4994  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem. */
4995  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim * nDim + 1;
4996 
4997  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
4998  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
4999  /* Easier storage of the metric terms and determine the number of
5000  integration points for this element. */
5001  const su2double* metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data();
5002  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5003  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5004 
5005  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the minimum Jacobian
5006  for this element. Note that the Jacobian is the first variable stored
5007  in the metric terms of the integration points. */
5008  su2double minJacElem = metric[0];
5009  for (unsigned short k = 1; k < nInt; ++k) minJacElem = min(minJacElem, metric[k * nMetricPerPoint]);
5010 
5011  /* Determine the length scale of the element, for which the length
5012  scale of the reference element, 2.0, must be taken into account. */
5013  const su2double maxJacFaces = volElem[i].lenScale;
5014  volElem[i].lenScale = 2.0 * minJacElem / maxJacFaces;
5015  }
5016 
5017  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5018  /*--- Step 4: Set the length scale for the halo elements. ---*/
5019  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5020 
5021 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5022 
5023  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication. ---*/
5024  nSendRequests = 0;
5025  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5026  if (ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5027  /* Fill the send buffer. */
5028  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j) sendBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesSend[i][j]].lenScale;
5029 
5030  /* Send the data. */
5031  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, ranksSend[i], ranksSend[i] + 20,
5032  SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
5033  }
5034  }
5035 
5036  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives.
5037  Exclude self communication. ---*/
5038  nRecvRequests = 0;
5039  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5040  if (ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5041  /* Post the nonblocking receive. */
5042  SU2_MPI::Irecv(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE, ranksRecv[i], rank + 20, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
5043  &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
5044  }
5045  }
5046 
5047 #endif
5048 
5049  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
5050  is outside the MPI part. ---*/
5051  if (selfComm) {
5052  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
5053  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
5054  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
5055  volElem[v1].lenScale = volElem[v0].lenScale;
5056  }
5057  }
5058 
5059 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5060 
5061  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
5062  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5063  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5064 
5065  /*--- Copy the data from the receive buffers into the volElem. ---*/
5066  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5067  if (ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5068  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j) volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale = recvBuf[i][j];
5069  }
5070  }
5071 
5072 #endif
5073 }
5074 
5075 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsSurfaceElements(CConfig* config) {
5076  /*--- Compute the metric terms of the internal matching faces. ---*/
5077  MetricTermsMatchingFaces(config);
5078 
5079  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries and compute the metric
5080  terms of the boundary. ---*/
5081  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < boundaries.size(); ++i) {
