5082  if (!boundaries[i].periodicBoundary) MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(&boundaries[i], config);
5083  }
5084 }
5085 
5086 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsVolumeElements(CConfig* config) {
5087  /* Find out whether or not the full, inverse of the full and the lumped mass
5088  matrices are needed. In principle always the full mass matrix is used,
5089  unless the user explicitly indices to use the lumped mass matrix for
5090  steady and dual time stepping. Note that for the DG_FEM the mass matrix
5091  is local to the elements. Finally, when the non-aliased predictor is used
5092  for ADER-DG for the Navier-Stokes equations, the derivatives of the
5093  metric terms are needed for the computation of the 2nd derivatives. */
5094  const bool UseLumpedMassMatrix = config->GetUse_Lumped_MassMatrix_DGFEM();
5095 
5096  bool FullMassMatrix = false, FullInverseMassMatrix = false;
5097  bool LumpedMassMatrix = false, DerMetricTerms = false;
5098 
5099  if (config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::STEADY ||
5100  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::ROTATIONAL_FRAME) {
5101  if (UseLumpedMassMatrix)
5102  LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5103  else
5104  FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5105  } else if (config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::DT_STEPPING_1ST ||
5106  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::DT_STEPPING_2ND ||
5107  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::HARMONIC_BALANCE) {
5108  if (UseLumpedMassMatrix)
5109  FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5110  else
5111  FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5112  } else {
5113  /* Time accurate explicit time integration scheme. */
5114  FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = false;
5115  FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5116 
5117  /* For ADER-DG, check if the derivative of the metric terms are needed. */
5118  if (config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
5119  MAIN_SOLVER solver = config->GetKind_Solver();
5120  if (solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_NAVIER_STOKES || solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_RANS ||
5121  solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_LES) {
5122  if (config->GetKind_ADER_Predictor() == ADER_NON_ALIASED_PREDICTOR) DerMetricTerms = true;
5123  }
5124  }
5125  }
5126 
5127  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
5128  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem.
5129  Also determine the additional number of metric terms per integration
5130  point for the computation of the second derivatives. */
5131  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim * nDim + 1;
5132  const unsigned short nMetric2ndDerPerPoint = nDim * (nDim + nDim * (nDim - 1) / 2);
5133 
5134  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5135  /*--- Step 1: Determine the metric terms, drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, etc. ---*/
5136  /*--- and the Jacobian in the integration points and solution ---*/
5137  /*--- DOFs of the owned volume elements. ---*/
5138  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5139 
5140  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5141  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5142  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5143  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5144  of DOFs for the grid and solution. */
5145  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5146  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5147  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5148  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5149 
5150  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities. They are initialized to
5151  zero as default value, i.e. not moving. */
5152  volElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nDim * nInt, 0.0);
5153  volElem[i].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.assign(nDim * nDOFsSol, 0.0);
5154 
5155  /* Allocate the memory for the metric terms of this element. */
5156  volElem[i].metricTerms.resize(nMetricPerPoint * nInt);
5157  volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs.resize(nMetricPerPoint * nDOFsSol);
5158 
5159  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5160  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5161  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5162  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5163  const su2double* matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5164  const su2double* matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid * nInt;
5165 
5166  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5167  basis functions in the sol DOFs. */
5168  const su2double* matDerBasisSolDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
5169 
5170  /* Allocate the memory for the result vectors. */
5171  vector<su2double> helpVecResultInt(nInt * nDim * nDim);
5172  vector<su2double> helpVecResultDOFsSol(nDOFsSol * nDim * nDim);
5173  su2double* vecResultInt = helpVecResultInt.data();
5174  su2double* vecResultDOFsSol = helpVecResultDOFsSol.data();
5175 
5176  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5177  coordinates for this element in the integration points. */
5178  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nInt, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt, volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(), vecResultInt, config);
5179 
5180  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5181  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5182  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsSol, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisSolDOFs, volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5183  vecResultDOFsSol, config);
5184 
5185  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5186  for both the integration points and the solution DOFs. */
5187  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nInt, vecResultInt, volElem[i].metricTerms);
5188 
5189  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsSol, vecResultDOFsSol, volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs);
5190 
5191  /* Check for negative Jacobians in the integrations points and at the
5192  location of the solution DOFs. */
5193  bool negJacobian = false;
5194  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nInt; ++j) {
5195  if (volElem[i].metricTerms[nMetricPerPoint * j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5196  }
5197 
5198  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsSol; ++j) {
5199  if (volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs[nMetricPerPoint * j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5200  }
5201 
5202  if (negJacobian) SU2_MPI::Error("Negative Jacobian found.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5203  }
5204 
5205  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5206  /*--- Step 2: Determine the derivatives of the metric terms in the ---*/
5207  /*--- integration points, if needed. ---*/
5208  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5209 
5210  if (DerMetricTerms) {
5211  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5212  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5213  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5214  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5215  of DOFs for the grid. */
5216  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5217  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5218  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5219 
5220  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5221  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5222  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5223  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5224  const su2double* matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5225  const su2double* matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid * nInt;
5226 
5227  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5228  basis functions in the owned DOFs, i.e. the grid DOFs. */
5229  const su2double* matDerBasisGridDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsOwnDOFs();
5230 
5231  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5232  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5233  vector<su2double> helpVecResultGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid * nDim * nDim);
5234  su2double* vecResultGridDOFs = helpVecResultGridDOFs.data();
5235 
5236  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsGrid, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisGridDOFs, volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5237  vecResultGridDOFs, config);
5238 
5239  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5240  in the grid DOFs. */
5241  vector<su2double> metricGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid * nMetricPerPoint);
5242  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsGrid, vecResultGridDOFs, metricGridDOFs);
5243 
5244  /*--- The metric terms currently stored in metricGridDOFs are scaled
5245  with the Jacobian and also the Jacobian is part of the metric
5246  terms. For the derivatives of the metric terms, the Jacobian
5247  is not needed, but the original unscaled terms are needed.
5248  This is done in the loop below. ---*/
5249  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
5250  su2double* metOld = metricGridDOFs.data() + j * nMetricPerPoint;
5251  su2double* metNew = metricGridDOFs.data() + j * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5252 
5253  const su2double JacInv = 1.0 / metOld[0];
5254  for (unsigned short k = 1; k < nMetricPerPoint; ++k) metNew[k - 1] = JacInv * metOld[k];
5255  }
5256 
5257  /* Compute the derivatives of the metric terms w.r.t. the
5258  parametric coordinates in the integration points.
5259  First allocate the memory to store the results. */
5260  vector<su2double> helpVecDerMetrics(nDim * nInt * (nMetricPerPoint - 1));
5261  su2double* vecDerMetrics = helpVecDerMetrics.data();
5262 
5263  /* Carry out the matrix multiplication. The last argument is NULL, such
5264  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
5265  it should be included. */
5266  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim * nInt, nMetricPerPoint - 1, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt, metricGridDOFs.data(),
5267  vecDerMetrics, nullptr);
5268 
5269  /* Allocate the memory for the additional metric terms needed to
5270  compute the second derivatives. */
5271  volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.resize(nInt * nMetric2ndDerPerPoint);
5272 
5273  /*--- Loop over the integration points to compute the additional metric
5274  terms needed for the second derivatives. This is a combination of
5275  the original metric terms and derivatives of these terms.
5276  Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
5277  switch (nDim) {
5278  case 2: {
5279  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5280  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nInt; ++j) {
5281  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5282  point starts. */
5283  const su2double* metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data() + j * nMetricPerPoint;
5284  const su2double* rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5285  const su2double* sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5286  su2double* metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data() + j * nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5287 
5288  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5289  and its derivatives. */
5290  const su2double JacInv = 1.0 / metric[0];
5291  const su2double drdx = JacInv * metric[1], drdy = JacInv * metric[2];
5292  const su2double dsdx = JacInv * metric[3], dsdy = JacInv * metric[4];
5293 
5294  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1];
5295  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[2], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[3];
5296 
5297  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1];
5298  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[2], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[3];
5299 
5300  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5301  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5302  the two possibilities is taken. */
5303  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx * ddrdx_dr + dsdx * ddrdx_ds;
5304  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx * ddsdx_dr + dsdx * ddsdx_ds;
5305 
5306  metric2ndDer[2] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddrdy_dr + dsdx * ddrdy_ds + drdy * ddrdx_dr + dsdy * ddrdx_ds);
5307  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddsdy_dr + dsdx * ddsdy_ds + drdy * ddsdx_dr + dsdy * ddsdx_ds);
5308 
5309  metric2ndDer[4] = drdy * ddrdy_dr + dsdy * ddrdy_ds;
5310  metric2ndDer[5] = drdy * ddsdy_dr + dsdy * ddsdy_ds;
5311  }
5312 
5313  break;
5314  }
5315 
5316  case 3: {
5317  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5318  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nInt; ++j) {
5319  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5320  point starts. */
5321  const su2double* metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data() + j * nMetricPerPoint;
5322  const su2double* rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5323  const su2double* sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5324  const su2double* tDerMetric = sDerMetric + nInt * (nMetricPerPoint - 1);
5325  su2double* metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data() + j * nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5326 
5327  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5328  and its derivatives. */
5329  const su2double JacInv = 1.0 / metric[0];
5330  const su2double drdx = JacInv * metric[1], drdy = JacInv * metric[2], drdz = JacInv * metric[3];
5331  const su2double dsdx = JacInv * metric[4], dsdy = JacInv * metric[5], dsdz = JacInv * metric[6];
5332  const su2double dtdx = JacInv * metric[7], dtdy = JacInv * metric[8], dtdz = JacInv * metric[9];
5333 
5334  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dr = rDerMetric[2];
5335  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dr = rDerMetric[5];
5336  const su2double ddtdx_dr = rDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dr = rDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dr = rDerMetric[8];
5337 
5338  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1], ddrdz_ds = sDerMetric[2];
5339  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[3], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[4], ddsdz_ds = sDerMetric[5];
5340  const su2double ddtdx_ds = sDerMetric[6], ddtdy_ds = sDerMetric[7], ddtdz_ds = sDerMetric[8];
5341 
5342  const su2double ddrdx_dt = tDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dt = tDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dt = tDerMetric[2];
5343  const su2double ddsdx_dt = tDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dt = tDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dt = tDerMetric[5];
5344  const su2double ddtdx_dt = tDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dt = tDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dt = tDerMetric[8];
5345 
5346  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5347  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5348  the two possibilities is taken. */
5349  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx * ddrdx_dr + dsdx * ddrdx_ds + dtdx * ddrdx_dt;
5350  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx * ddsdx_dr + dsdx * ddsdx_ds + dtdx * ddsdx_dt;
5351  metric2ndDer[2] = drdx * ddtdx_dr + dsdx * ddtdx_ds + dtdx * ddtdx_dt;
5352 
5353  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddrdy_dr + dsdx * ddrdy_ds + dtdx * ddrdy_dt + drdy * ddrdx_dr +
5354  dsdy * ddrdx_ds + dtdy * ddrdx_dt);
5355  metric2ndDer[4] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddsdy_dr + dsdx * ddsdy_ds + dtdx * ddsdy_dt + drdy * ddsdx_dr +
5356  dsdy * ddsdx_ds + dtdy * ddsdx_dt);
5357  metric2ndDer[5] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddtdy_dr + dsdx * ddtdy_ds + dtdx * ddtdy_dt + drdy * ddtdx_dr +
5358  dsdy * ddtdx_ds + dtdy * ddtdx_dt);
5359 
5360  metric2ndDer[6] = drdy * ddrdy_dr + dsdy * ddrdy_ds + dtdy * ddrdy_dt;
5361  metric2ndDer[7] = drdy * ddsdy_dr + dsdy * ddsdy_ds + dtdy * ddsdy_dt;
5362  metric2ndDer[8] = drdy * ddtdy_dr + dsdy * ddtdy_ds + dtdy * ddtdy_dt;
5363 
5364  metric2ndDer[9] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddrdz_dr + dsdx * ddrdz_ds + dtdx * ddrdz_dt + drdz * ddrdx_dr +
5365  dsdz * ddrdx_ds + dtdz * ddrdx_dt);
5366  metric2ndDer[10] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddsdz_dr + dsdx * ddsdz_ds + dtdx * ddsdz_dt + drdz * ddsdx_dr +
5367  dsdz * ddsdx_ds + dtdz * ddsdx_dt);
5368  metric2ndDer[11] = 0.5 * (drdx * ddtdz_dr + dsdx * ddtdz_ds + dtdx * ddtdz_dt + drdz * ddtdx_dr +
5369  dsdz * ddtdx_ds + dtdz * ddtdx_dt);
5370 
5371  metric2ndDer[12] = 0.5 * (drdy * ddrdz_dr + dsdy * ddrdz_ds + dtdy * ddrdz_dt + drdz * ddrdy_dr +
5372  dsdz * ddrdy_ds + dtdz * ddrdy_dt);
5373  metric2ndDer[13] = 0.5 * (drdy * ddsdz_dr + dsdy * ddsdz_ds + dtdy * ddsdz_dt + drdz * ddsdy_dr +
5374  dsdz * ddsdy_ds + dtdz * ddsdy_dt);
5375  metric2ndDer[14] = 0.5 * (drdy * ddtdz_dr + dsdy * ddtdz_ds + dtdy * ddtdz_dt + drdz * ddtdy_dr +
5376  dsdz * ddtdy_ds + dtdz * ddtdy_dt);
5377 
5378  metric2ndDer[15] = drdz * ddrdz_dr + dsdz * ddrdz_ds + dtdz * ddrdz_dt;
5379  metric2ndDer[16] = drdz * ddsdz_dr + dsdz * ddsdz_ds + dtdz * ddsdz_dt;
5380  metric2ndDer[17] = drdz * ddtdz_dr + dsdz * ddtdz_ds + dtdz * ddtdz_dt;
5381  }
5382 
5383  break;
5384  }
5385  }
5386  }
5387  }
5388 
5389  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5390  /*--- Step 3: Determine the mass matrix (or its inverse) and/or the ---*/
5391  /*--- lumped mass matrix. ---*/
5392  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5393 
5394  /* Determine the time coefficients in the iteration matrix of the ADER-DG
5395  predictor step. */
5396  if (config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(config);
5397 
5398  /* Define the double vector to define the values of the mass matrix
5399  contributions of the standard element in the integration points. */
5400  vector<vector<su2double> > valMMInt;
5401  valMMInt.resize(standardElementsSol.size());
5402 
5403  /* Loop over the different standard elements. */
5404  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < standardElementsSol.size(); ++i) {
5405  /* Get the required data from the standard element. */
5406  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[i].GetNIntegration();
5407  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[i].GetNDOFs();
5408  const su2double* lag = standardElementsSol[i].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5409  const su2double* w = standardElementsSol[i].GetWeightsIntegration();
5410 
5411  /* Allocate the memory for valMMInt[i]. */
5412  valMMInt[i].resize(nDOFs * nDOFs * nInt);
5413 
5414  /* Create the values of valMMInt[i], which is a matrix of size
5415  nDOFs2XnInt stored in row major order. */
5416  unsigned int ll = 0;
5417  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k)
5418  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFs; ++j)
5419  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nInt; ++l, ++ll)
5420  valMMInt[i][ll] = w[l] * lag[l * nDOFs + k] * lag[l * nDOFs + j];
5421  }
5422 
5423  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5424  for (unsigned long i = 0; i < nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5425  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element and
5426  get the necessary information from it. */
5427  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5428  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5429  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5430  const unsigned int nDOFs2 = nDOFs * nDOFs;
5431  const su2double* valInt = valMMInt[ind].data();
5432 
5433  /* Copy the data of the Jacobian in the integration points in
5434  a separate vector. */
5435  vector<su2double> JacVec(nInt);
5436  su2double* Jac = JacVec.data();
5437 
5438  for (unsigned short l = 0; l < nInt; ++l) Jac[l] = volElem[i].metricTerms[l * nMetricPerPoint];
5439 
5440  /* Allocate the memory for working vector for the construction
5441  of the mass matrix. */
5442  vector<su2double> massMat(nDOFs2);
5443 
5444  /* Create the mass matrix, which is a BLAS gemv operation. */
5445  blasFunctions->gemv(nDOFs2, nInt, valInt, Jac, massMat.data());
5446 
5447  /* Store the full mass matrix in volElem[i], if needed. */
5448  if (FullMassMatrix) volElem[i].massMatrix = massMat;
5449 
5450  /*--- Check if the lumped mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5451  if (LumpedMassMatrix) {
5452  /* Allocate the memory for the lumped mass matrix and initialize them to zero.. */
5453  volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix.assign(nDOFs, 0.0);
5454 
5455  /* Loop over the DOFs to compute the elements of the local lumped mass
5456  matrix. It is the sum of the absolute values of the row. */
5457  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nDOFs; ++j) {
5458  const su2double* val = massMat.data() + j * nDOFs;
5459  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix[j] += fabs(val[k]);
5460  }
5461  }
5462 
5463  /*--- Check if the inverse of mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5464  if (FullInverseMassMatrix) {
5465  /*--- Check if LAPACK/MKL can be used to compute the inverse. ---*/
5466 
5467 #if (defined(HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)) && !(defined(CODI_REVERSE_TYPE) || defined(CODI_FORWARD_TYPE))
5468 
5469  /* The inverse can be computed using the Lapack routines dpotrf
5470  and dpotri. As the mass matrix is positive definite, a
5471  Cholesky decomposition is used, which is much more efficient
5472  than a standard inverse. */
5473  char uplo = 'L';
5474  int NN = nDOFs, errorCode;
5475  dpotrf_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5476  if (errorCode != 0) {
5477  ostringstream message;
5478  if (errorCode < 0) {
5479  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotrf. Error code: " << errorCode;
5480  } else {
5481  message << "Mass matrix not positive definite. " << endl;
5482  message << "This is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule," << endl;
5483  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5484  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5485  }
5486 
5487  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5488  }
5489 
5490  dpotri_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5491  if (errorCode != 0) {
5492  ostringstream message;
5493  if (errorCode < 0) {
5494  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotri. Error code: " << errorCode;
5495  } else {
5496  message << "Mass matrix is singular. " << endl;
5497  message << "The is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule, " << endl;
5498  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5499  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5500  }
5501 
5502  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5503  }
5504 
5505  /* The Lapack routines for a Cholesky decomposition only store the upper
5506  part of the matrix. Copy the data to the lower part. */
5507  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFs; ++k) {
5508  for (unsigned short j = (k + 1); j < nDOFs; ++j) {
5509  massMat[j * nDOFs + k] = massMat[k * nDOFs + j];
5510  }
5511  }
5512 #else
5513  /* No support for Lapack. Hence an internal routine is used.
5514  This does not do all the checking the Lapack routines do. */
5515  CFEMStandardElementBase::InverseMatrix(nDOFs, massMat);
5516 #endif
5517  /* Store the inverse of the mass matrix in volElem[i]. */
5518  volElem[i].invMassMatrix = massMat;
5519  }
5520  }
5521 }
5522 
5523 void CMeshFEM_DG::TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(CConfig* config) {
5524  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5525  /*--- Determine the coefficients that appear in the iteration matrix of ---*/
5526  /*--- the prediction step of ADER-DG. ---*/
5527  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5528 
5529  /* Determine the number of time DOFs in the predictor step of ADER as well
5530  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5531  const unsigned short nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5532  const su2double* TimeDOFs = config->GetTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5533 
5534  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix and its inverse in the time DOFs. */
5535  vector<su2double> rTimeDOFs(nTimeDOFs);
5536  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) rTimeDOFs[i] = TimeDOFs[i];
5537 
5538  vector<su2double> V(nTimeDOFs * nTimeDOFs);
5539  CFEMStandardElementBase timeElement;
5540  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, V);
5541 
5542  vector<su2double> VInv = V;
5543  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, VInv);
5544 
5545  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for r = 1, i.e. the end of the interval. */
5546  vector<su2double> rEnd(1);
5547  rEnd[0] = 1.0;
5548  vector<su2double> VEnd(nTimeDOFs);
5549  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rEnd, VEnd);
5550 
5551  /*--- Determine the matrix products VEnd*VInv to get the correct expression
5552  for the values of the Lagrangian interpolation functions for r = 1. ---*/
5553  vector<su2double> lEnd(nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5554  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5555  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) lEnd[j] += VEnd[k] * VInv[j * nTimeDOFs + k];
5556  }
5557 
5558  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5559  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5560  roundoff. ---*/
5561  su2double val = 0.0;
5562  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) val += lEnd[j];
5563 
5564  if (fabs(val - 1.0) > 1.e-6) SU2_MPI::Error("Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5565 
5566  val = 1.0 / val;
5567  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) lEnd[j] *= val;
5568 
5569  /*--- Compute the mass matrix in time, which is the inverse of V^T V. Note that
5570  this definition is different from the one used in Hesthaven, because their
5571  V is our V^T. Furthermore note that the mass matrix should be a diagonal
5572  matrix, due to the choice of the DOFs (Gauss Legendre points). ---*/
5573  vector<su2double> MassTime(nTimeDOFs * nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5574  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5575  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5576  const unsigned short ji = j * nTimeDOFs + i;
5577  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) MassTime[ji] += V[k * nTimeDOFs + j] * V[k * nTimeDOFs + i];
5578  }
5579  }
5580 
5581  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, MassTime);
5582 
5583  /* Compute the gradient of the Vandermonde matrix in the time DOFs. */
5584  vector<su2double> VDr(nTimeDOFs * nTimeDOFs);
5585  timeElement.GradVandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, VDr);
5586 
5587  /* Compute the product VDr VInv. Store the result in V. Note that in both
5588  matrices the transpose is stored compared to the definition of Hesthaven. */
5589  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5590  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5591  const unsigned short ji = j * nTimeDOFs + i;
5592  V[ji] = 0.0;
5593  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) V[ji] += VDr[k * nTimeDOFs + j] * VInv[i * nTimeDOFs + k];
5594  }
5595  }
5596 
5597  /* Compute the time stiffness matrix S = M Dr. */
5598  vector<su2double> S(nTimeDOFs * nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5599  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5600  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5601  const unsigned short ji = j * nTimeDOFs + i;
5602  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) S[ji] += MassTime[j * nTimeDOFs + k] * V[k * nTimeDOFs + i];
5603  }
5604  }
5605 
5606  /* Compute the time coefficients of the iteration matrix in the predictor step. */
5607  timeCoefADER_DG.assign(nTimeDOFs * nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5608  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5609  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i)
5610  timeCoefADER_DG[j * nTimeDOFs + i] = lEnd[j] * lEnd[i] - S[i * nTimeDOFs + j];
5611  }
5612 
5613  /* Determine the inverse of timeCoefADER_DG, because this is needed in the
5614  iteration matrix of the predictor step of ADER-DG. */
5615  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, timeCoefADER_DG);
5616 
5617  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5618  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
5619  /*--- to the time integration points. Note that in many cases this ---*/
5620  /*--- interpolation matrix is the identity matrix, i.e. the DOFs and the ---*/
5621  /*--- integration points coincide. ---*/
5622  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5623 
5624  /* Determine the number of time integration points of ADER as well
5625  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5626  unsigned short nTimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5627  const su2double* TimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5628 
5629  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for the time integration points. */
5630  vector<su2double> rTimeIntPoints(nTimeIntegrationPoints);
5631  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) rTimeIntPoints[i] = TimeIntegrationPoints[i];
5632 
5633  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints * nTimeDOFs);
5634  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
5635 
5636  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
5637  them to zero. */
5638  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints * nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5639 
5640  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
5641  mTimeInterpolDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view the
5642  transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation data
5643  for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
5644  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5645  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
5646  const unsigned short ii = i * nTimeDOFs + j;
5647 
5648  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
5649  const unsigned short indV = k * nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
5650  const unsigned short indVInv = j * nTimeDOFs + k;
5651 
5652  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV] * VInv[indVInv];
5653  }
5654  }
5655  }
5656 
5657  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5658  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5659  roundoff. ---*/
5660  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
5661  const unsigned short jj = j * nTimeDOFs;
5662 
5663  val = 0.0;
5664  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) val += timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj + i];
5665 
5666  if (fabs(val - 1.0) > 1.e-6) SU2_MPI::Error("Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5667 
5668  val = 1.0 / val;
5669  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj + i] *= val;
5670  }
5671 
5672  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5673  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
5674  /*--- of adjacent elements of a higher time level to the time ---*/
5675  /*--- integration points. ---*/
5676  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5677 
5678  /* Determine the location of the time integration points from the
5679  perspective of an adjacent element with twice the time step. Note that
5680  the time step of this adjacent element covers two fine time steps and
5681  hence the number of integration points double and the position is
5682  determined via the transformation xxi = 0.5(xi-1) and xi varies between
5683  -1 and 3. */
5684  rTimeIntPoints.resize(2 * nTimeIntegrationPoints);
5685  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i)
5686  rTimeIntPoints[i] = 0.5 * (TimeIntegrationPoints[i] - 1.0);
5687 
5688  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
5689  const unsigned short ii = i + nTimeIntegrationPoints;
5690  rTimeIntPoints[ii] = 0.5 * (TimeIntegrationPoints[i] + 1.0);
5691  }
5692 
5693  nTimeIntegrationPoints *= 2;
5694 
5695  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for these time integration points. */
5696  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints * nTimeDOFs);
5697  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
5698 
5699  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
5700  them to zero. */
5701  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints * nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5702 
5703  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
5704  mTimeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view
5705  the transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation
5706  data for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
5707  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5708  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
5709  const unsigned short ii = i * nTimeDOFs + j;
5710 
5711  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
5712  const unsigned short indV = k * nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
5713  const unsigned short indVInv = j * nTimeDOFs + k;
5714 
5715  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV] * VInv[indVInv];
5716  }
5717  }
5718  }
5719 
5720  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5721  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5722  roundoff. ---*/
5723  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
5724  const unsigned short jj = j * nTimeDOFs;
5725 
5726  val = 0.0;
5727  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) val += timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj + i];
5728 
5729  if (fabs(val - 1.0) > 1.e-6) SU2_MPI::Error("Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5730 
5731  val = 1.0 / val;
5732  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nTimeDOFs; ++i) timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj + i] *= val;
5733  }
5734 }
5735 
5736 void CMeshFEM_DG::VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(const unsigned short nEntities, const su2double* gradCoor,
5737  vector<su2double>& metricTerms) {
5738  /*--- Convert the dxdr, dydr, etc., stored in coorGradients, to the
5739  required metric terms. Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
5740  switch (nDim) {
5741  case 2: {
5742  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
5743  const unsigned short off = 2 * nEntities;
5744 
5745  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
5746  unsigned short ii = 0;
5747  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nEntities; ++j) {
5748  const unsigned short jx = 2 * j;
5749  const unsigned short jy = jx + 1;
5750  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy];
5751  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx + off], dyds = gradCoor[jy + off];
5752 
5753  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr * dyds - dxds * dydr; // J
5754  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds; // J drdx
5755  metricTerms[ii++] = -dxds; // J drdy
5756  metricTerms[ii++] = -dydr; // J dsdx
5757  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr; // J dsdy
5758  }
5759 
5760  break;
5761  }
5762 
5763  case 3: {
5764  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
5765  unsigned short offS = 3 * nEntities, offT = 6 * nEntities;
5766 
5767  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
5768  unsigned short ii = 0;
5769  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nEntities; ++j) {
5770  const unsigned short jx = 3 * j;
5771  const unsigned short jy = jx + 1, jz = jx + 2;
5772  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy], dzdr = gradCoor[jz];
5773  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx + offS], dyds = gradCoor[jy + offS], dzds = gradCoor[jz + offS];
5774  const su2double dxdt = gradCoor[jx + offT], dydt = gradCoor[jy + offT], dzdt = gradCoor[jz + offT];
5775 
5776  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr * (dyds * dzdt - dzds * dydt) - dxds * (dydr * dzdt - dzdr * dydt) +
5777  dxdt * (dydr * dzds - dzdr * dyds); // J
5778 
5779  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds * dzdt - dzds * dydt; // J drdx
5780  metricTerms[ii++] = dzds * dxdt - dxds * dzdt; // J drdy
5781  metricTerms[ii++] = dxds * dydt - dyds * dxdt; // J drdz
5782 
5783  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr * dydt - dydr * dzdt; // J dsdx
5784  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr * dzdt - dzdr * dxdt; // J dsdy
5785  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr * dxdt - dxdr * dydt; // J dsdz
5786 
5787  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr * dzds - dzdr * dyds; // J dtdx
5788  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr * dxds - dxdr * dzds; // J dtdy
5789  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr * dyds - dydr * dxds; // J dtdz
5790  }
5791 
5792  break;
5793  }
5794  }
5795 }
5796 
5797 void CMeshFEM_DG::WallFunctionPreprocessing(CConfig* config) {
5798  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5799  /*--- Step 1: Check whether wall functions are used at all. ---*/
5800  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5801 
5802  bool wallFunctions = false;
5803  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
5804  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
5805  case ISOTHERMAL:
5806  case HEAT_FLUX: {
5807  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
5808  if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) wallFunctions = true;
5809  break;
5810  }
5811  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
5812  break;
5813  }
5814  }
5815 
5816  /* If no wall functions are used, nothing needs to be done and a
5817  return can be made. */
5818  if (!wallFunctions) return;
5819 
5820  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5821  /*--- Step 2. Build the local ADT of the volume elements. The halo ---*/
5822  /*--- elements are included such that also direct neighbors are ---*/
5823  /*--- guaranteed to be found as donor element. Note that the ADT ---*/
5824  /*--- is built with the linear subelements. This is done to ---*/
5825  /*--- avoid relatively many expensive Newton solves for high ---*/
5826  /*--- order elements. ---*/
5827  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5828 
5829  /* Define the vectors, which store the mapping from the subelement to the
5830  parent element, subelement ID within the parent element, the element
5831  type and the connectivity of the subelements. */
5832  vector<unsigned long> parentElement;
5833  vector<unsigned short> subElementIDInParent;
5834  vector<unsigned short> VTK_TypeElem;
5835  vector<unsigned long> elemConn;
5836 
5837  /* Loop over the locally stored volume elements (including halo elements)
5838  to create the connectivity of the subelements. */
5839  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nVolElemTot; ++l) {
5840  /* Determine the necessary data from the corresponding standard element. */
5841  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
5842 
5843  unsigned short VTK_Type[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1(), standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2()};
5844  unsigned short nSubElems[] = {0, 0};
5845  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem[] = {0, 0};
5846  const unsigned short* connSubElems[] = {nullptr, nullptr};
5847 
5848  if (VTK_Type[0] != NONE) {
5849  nSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
5850  nDOFsPerSubElem[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[0]);
5851  connSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1();
5852  }
5853 
5854  if (VTK_Type[1] != NONE) {
5855  nSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType2();
5856  nDOFsPerSubElem[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[1]);
5857  connSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2();
5858  }
5859 
5860  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
5861  const unsigned long* DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
5862 
5863  /* Loop over the number of subelements and store the required data. */
5864  unsigned short jj = 0;
5865  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
5866  unsigned short kk = 0;
5867  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nSubElems[i]; ++j, ++jj) {
5868  parentElement.push_back(l);
5869  subElementIDInParent.push_back(jj);
5870  VTK_TypeElem.push_back(VTK_Type[i]);
5871 
5872  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDOFsPerSubElem[i]; ++k, ++kk) elemConn.push_back(DOFs[connSubElems[i][kk]]);
5873  }
5874  }
5875  }
5876 
5877  /* Copy the coordinates in a vector that can be used by the ADT. */
5878  vector<su2double> volCoor;
5879  volCoor.reserve(nDim * meshPoints.size());
5880 
5881  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < meshPoints.size(); ++l) {
5882  for (unsigned short k = 0; k < nDim; ++k) volCoor.push_back(meshPoints[l].coor[k]);
5883  }
5884 
5885  /* Build the local ADT. */
5886  CADTElemClass localVolumeADT(nDim, volCoor, elemConn, VTK_TypeElem, subElementIDInParent, parentElement, false);
5887 
5888  /* Release the memory of the vectors used to build the ADT. To make sure
5889  that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
5890  vector<unsigned short>().swap(subElementIDInParent);
5891  vector<unsigned short>().swap(VTK_TypeElem);
5892  vector<unsigned long>().swap(parentElement);
5893  vector<unsigned long>().swap(elemConn);
5894  vector<su2double>().swap(volCoor);
5895 
5896  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5897  /*--- Step 3. Search for donor elements at the exchange locations in ---*/
5898  /*--- the local elements. ---*/
5899  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5900 
5901  /* Loop over the markers and select the ones for which a wall function
5902  treatment must be carried out. */
5903  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; ++iMarker) {
5904  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
5905  case ISOTHERMAL:
5906  case HEAT_FLUX: {
5907  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
5908  if (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) {
5909  /* An LES wall model is used for this boundary marker. Determine
5910  which wall model and allocate the memory for the member variable. */
5911  switch (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag)) {
5912  case WALL_FUNCTIONS::EQUILIBRIUM_MODEL: {
5913  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses an Equilibrium Wall Model." << endl;
5914 
5915  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModel1DEQ(config, Marker_Tag);
5916  break;
5917  }
5918  case WALL_FUNCTIONS::LOGARITHMIC_MODEL: {
5919  if (rank == MASTER_NODE)
5920  cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses the Reichardt and Kader analytical laws for the Wall Model."
5921  << endl;
5922 
5923  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModelLogLaw(config, Marker_Tag);
5924  break;
5925  }
5926  default: {
5927  SU2_MPI::Error("Wall function not present yet", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5928  }
5929  }
5930 
5931  /* Retrieve the double information for this wall model. The height
5932  of the exchange location is the first element of this array. */
5933  const su2double* doubleInfo = config->GetWallFunction_DoubleInfo(Marker_Tag);
5934 
5935  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
5936  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
5937  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < surfElem.size(); ++l) {
5938  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
5939  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
5940  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
5941  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
5942  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5943 
5944  /* Allocate the memory for the memory to store the donors and
5945  the parametric weights. The donor elements are stored in an
5946  CUnsignedLong2T, such that they can be sorted. */
5947  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> donorElements(nInt);
5948  vector<su2double> parCoorInDonor(nInt * nDim);
5949 
5950  /* Loop over the integration points. */
5951  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
5952  /* Easier storage of the normals and coordinates of this
5953  integration point. */
5954  const su2double* normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i * (nDim + 1);
5955  const su2double* Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
5956 
5957  /* Determine the coordinates of the exchange location. Note that the normals
5958  point out of the domain, so the normals must be subtracted. */
5959  su2double coorExchange[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; // To avoid a compiler warning.
5960  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim)
5961  coorExchange[iDim] = Coord[iDim] - doubleInfo[0] * normals[iDim];
5962 
5963  /* Search for the element, which contains the exchange location. */
5964  unsigned short subElem;
5965  unsigned long parElem;
5966  int rank;
5967  su2double parCoor[3], weightsInterpol[8];
5968  if (localVolumeADT.DetermineContainingElement(coorExchange, subElem, parElem, rank, parCoor,
5969  weightsInterpol)) {
5970  /* Subelement found that contains the exchange location. However,
5971  what is needed is the location in the high order parent element.
5972  Determine this. */
5973  HighOrderContainmentSearch(coorExchange, parElem, subElem, weightsInterpol, parCoor);
5974 
5975  /* Store the info in donorElements and parCoorInDonor. */
5976  donorElements[i].long0 = parElem;
5977  donorElements[i].long1 = i;
5978  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) parCoorInDonor[nDim * i + iDim] = parCoor[iDim];
5979  } else {
5980  /* No subelement found that contains the exchange location.
5981  The partitioning is done such that this should not happen.
5982  Print an error message and exit. */
5983  SU2_MPI::Error("Exchange location not found in ADT", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5984  }
5985  }
5986 
5987  /* Sort donorElements in increasing order, such that the
5988  integration points with the same donor are grouped together. */
5989  sort(donorElements.begin(), donorElements.end());
5990 
5991  /* Store the donor information in the member variables of surfElem. */
5992  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[0].long0);
5993  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(0);
5994  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor.resize(nInt);
5995  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[0] = donorElements[0].long1;
5996 
5997  for (unsigned short i = 1; i < nInt; ++i) {
5998  if (donorElements[i].long0 != surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back()) {
5999  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[i].long0);
6000  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(i);
6001  }
6002  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i] = donorElements[i].long1;
6003  }
6004 
6005  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(nInt);
6006 
6007  /* Determine whether or not halo information is needed to apply
6008  the boundary conditions for this surface. If needed, set
6009  haloInfoNeededForBC of the boundary to true. As DonorsWallFunction
6010  is sorted in increasing order, it suffices to check the last element. */
6011  if (surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back() >= nVolElemOwned) boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC = true;
6012 
6013  /* Allocate the memory of the first index of the interpolation
6014  matrices for the donordata. */
6015  surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor.resize(surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size());
6016 
6017  /* Loop over the different donors for the wall function data. */
6018  for (unsigned long j = 0; j < surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size(); ++j) {
6019  /* Easier storage of the donor and the vector for the
6020  interpolation data for this donor. */
6021  const unsigned long donor = surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction[j];
6022  vector<su2double>& matDonor = surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor[j];
6023 
6024  /* Determine the number of DOFs in the donor element. Note that
6025  the standard element of the solution must be used for this
6026  purpose. */
6027  const unsigned short ind = volElem[donor].indStandardElement;
6028  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNDOFs();
6029 
6030  /* Allocate the memory for the vector used to compute the
6031  Lagrangian interpolation functions in the parametric coordinates,
6032  i.e. the interpolation weights, and for matDonor, which stores
6033  all these weights. */
6034  const unsigned short nIntThisDonor =
6035  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j + 1] - surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6036  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6037  matDonor.reserve(nIntThisDonor * nDOFs);
6038 
6039  /* Loop over the integration points for this donor element. */
6040  for (unsigned short i = surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6041  i < surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j + 1]; ++i) {
6042  /* Determine the pointer to the parametric coordinates of the
6043  donor point of this integration point. */
6044  const unsigned short ii = surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i];
6045  const su2double* parCoor = parCoorInDonor.data() + ii * nDim;
6046 
6047  /* Determine the interpolation weights for this point and
6048  store it in matDonor. */
6049  standardElementsSol[ind].BasisFunctionsInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis);
6050  matDonor.insert(matDonor.end(), lagBasis.begin(), lagBasis.end());
6051  }
6052  }
6053  }
6054  }
6055 
6056  break;
6057  }
6058  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6059  break;
6060  }
6061  }
6062 }
6063 
6064 void CMeshFEM_DG::HighOrderContainmentSearch(const su2double* coor, const unsigned long parElem,
6065  const unsigned short subElem, const su2double* weightsSubElem,
6066  su2double* parCoor) {
6067  /* Definition of the maximum number of iterations in the Newton solver
6068  and the tolerance level. */
6069  const unsigned short maxIt = 50;
6070  const su2double tolNewton = 1.e-10;
6071 
6072  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6073  /* Step 1: Create an initial guess for the parametric coordinates from */
6074  /* interpolation in the linear sub-element of the parent element. */
6075  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6076 
6077  /* Abbreviate the index in the standard element a bit easier. */
6078  const unsigned short ind = volElem[parElem].indStandardElement;
6079 
6080  /* Define the variables to store the number of DOFs and the connectivity
6081  of the sub element in which the given coordinate resides. */
6082  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem = 0;
6083  const unsigned short* connSubElems;
6084 
6085  /* Check if the sub element is of the first sub-element type. */
6086  const unsigned short nSubElemType1 = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
6087  if (subElem < nSubElemType1) {
6088  /* Determine the element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6089  switch (standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1()) {
6090  case TRIANGLE:
6091  nDOFsPerSubElem = 3;
6092  break;
6093  case QUADRILATERAL:
6094  nDOFsPerSubElem = 4;
6095  break;
6096  case TETRAHEDRON:
6097  nDOFsPerSubElem = 4;
6098  break;
6099  case PYRAMID:
6100  nDOFsPerSubElem = 5;
6101  break;
6102  case PRISM:
6103  nDOFsPerSubElem = 6;
6104  break;
6105  case HEXAHEDRON:
6106  nDOFsPerSubElem = 8;
6107  break;
6108  default:
6109  break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6110  }
6111 
6112  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6113  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1() + subElem * nDOFsPerSubElem;
6114  } else {
6115  /* The sub-element is of the second sub-element type. Determine the
6116  element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6117  switch (standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2()) {
6118  case TRIANGLE:
6119  nDOFsPerSubElem = 3;
6120  break;
6121  case QUADRILATERAL:
6122  nDOFsPerSubElem = 4;
6123  break;
6124  case TETRAHEDRON:
6125  nDOFsPerSubElem = 4;
6126  break;
6127  case PYRAMID:
6128  nDOFsPerSubElem = 5;
6129  break;
6130  case PRISM:
6131  nDOFsPerSubElem = 6;
6132  break;
6133  case HEXAHEDRON:
6134  nDOFsPerSubElem = 8;
6135  break;
6136  default:
6137  break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6138  }
6139 
6140  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6141  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2() + (subElem - nSubElemType1) * nDOFsPerSubElem;
6142  }
6143 
6144  /* Get the parametric coordinates of the DOFs from the standard element. */
6145  const vector<su2double>* locDOFs[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetRDOFs(), standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSDOFs(),
6146  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetTDOFs()};
6147 
6148  /* Create the initial guess of the parametric coordinates by interpolation
6149  in the sub-element. */
6150  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) {
6151  parCoor[iDim] = 0.0;
6152  const su2double* coorDOFs = locDOFs[iDim]->data();
6153  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFsPerSubElem; ++i) parCoor[iDim] += weightsSubElem[i] * coorDOFs[connSubElems[i]];
6154  }
6155 
6156  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6157  /* Step 2: The Newton algorithm to compute the parametric coordinates in */
6158  /* the high order element. */
6159  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6160 
6161  /* Determine the number of DOFs of the standard element and allocate the
6162  memory to store the basis functions and its derivatives. */
6163  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFs();
6164 
6165  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6166  vector<vector<su2double> > dLagBasis(nDim, vector<su2double>(nDOFs));
6167 
6168  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
6169  const unsigned long* DOFs = volElem[parElem].nodeIDsGrid.data();
6170 
6171  /* Loop over the maximum number of iterations. */
6172  unsigned short itCount;
6173  for (itCount = 0; itCount < maxIt; ++itCount) {
6174  /* Compute the Lagrangian basis functions and its derivatives in
6175  the current parametric coordinate. */
6176  standardElementsGrid[ind].BasisFunctionsAndDerivativesInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis, dLagBasis);
6177 
6178  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D in order to have the most
6179  efficient code. */
6180  bool converged = false;
6181  switch (nDim) {
6182  case 2: {
6183  /* Two dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6184  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6185  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1];
6186  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0;
6187  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFs; ++i) {
6188  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6189  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6190 
6191  f0 -= x * lagBasis[i];
6192  f1 -= y * lagBasis[i];
6193 
6194  a00 += x * dLagBasis[0][i];
6195  a01 += x * dLagBasis[1][i];
6196  a10 += y * dLagBasis[0][i];
6197  a11 += y * dLagBasis[1][i];
6198  }
6199 
6200  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6201  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6202  const su2double detInv = 1.0 / (a00 * a11 - a01 * a10);
6203  const su2double dr = detInv * (f0 * a11 - f1 * a01);
6204  const su2double ds = detInv * (f1 * a00 - f0 * a10);
6205 
6206  parCoor[0] += dr;
6207  parCoor[1] += ds;
6208 
6209  /* Check for convergence. */
6210  if (fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton) converged = true;
6211  break;
6212  }
6213 
6214  case 3: {
6215  /* Three dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6216  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6217  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1], f2 = coor[2];
6218  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a02 = 0.0;
6219  su2double a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0, a12 = 0.0;
6220  su2double a20 = 0.0, a21 = 0.0, a22 = 0.0;
6221 
6222  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFs; ++i) {
6223  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6224  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6225  const su2double z = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[2];
6226 
6227  f0 -= x * lagBasis[i];
6228  f1 -= y * lagBasis[i];
6229  f2 -= z * lagBasis[i];
6230 
6231  a00 += x * dLagBasis[0][i];
6232  a01 += x * dLagBasis[1][i];
6233  a02 += x * dLagBasis[2][i];
6234  a10 += y * dLagBasis[0][i];
6235  a11 += y * dLagBasis[1][i];
6236  a12 += y * dLagBasis[2][i];
6237  a20 += z * dLagBasis[0][i];
6238  a21 += z * dLagBasis[1][i];
6239  a22 += z * dLagBasis[2][i];
6240  }
6241 
6242  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6243  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6244  const su2double detInv = 1.0 / (a00 * a11 * a22 - a00 * a12 * a21 - a01 * a10 * a22 + a01 * a12 * a20 +
6245  a02 * a10 * a21 - a02 * a11 * a20);
6246  const su2double dr = detInv * (a01 * a12 * f2 - a01 * a22 * f1 - a02 * a11 * f2 + a02 * a21 * f1 +
6247  a11 * a22 * f0 - a12 * a21 * f0);
6248  const su2double ds = -detInv * (a00 * a12 * f2 - a00 * a22 * f1 - a02 * a10 * f2 + a02 * a20 * f1 +
6249  a10 * a22 * f0 - a12 * a20 * f0);
6250  const su2double dt = detInv * (a00 * a11 * f2 - a00 * a21 * f1 - a01 * a10 * f2 + a01 * a20 * f1 +
6251  a10 * a21 * f0 - a11 * a20 * f0);
6252  parCoor[0] += dr;
6253  parCoor[1] += ds;
6254  parCoor[2] += dt;
6255 
6256  /* Check for convergence. */
6257  if (fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton && fabs(dt) <= tolNewton) converged = true;
6258  break;
6259  }
6260  }
6261 
6262  /* Break the loop if the Newton algorithm converged. */
6263  if (converged) break;
6264  }
6265 
6266  /* Terminate if the Newton algorithm did not converge. */
6267  if (itCount == maxIt) SU2_MPI::Error("Newton did not converge", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6268 }
6269 
6270 void CMeshFEM_DG::InitStaticMeshMovement(const CConfig* config, const unsigned short Kind_Grid_Movement,
6271  const unsigned short iZone) {
6272  /*--- Get the reference values for the non-dimensionalization of the
6273  prescribed velocities. ---*/
6274  const su2double L_Ref = config->GetLength_Ref();
6275  const su2double Omega_Ref = config->GetOmega_Ref();
6276  const su2double Vel_Ref = config->GetVelocity_Ref();
6277 
6278  /*--- Make a distinction between the possibilities. ---*/
6279  switch (Kind_Grid_Movement) {
6280  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6281 
6282  case ROTATING_FRAME: {
6283  /* Get the rotation rate and rotation center from config. */
6284  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin(0), config->GetMotion_Origin(1),
6285  config->GetMotion_Origin(2)};
6286  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate(0) / Omega_Ref, config->GetRotation_Rate(1) / Omega_Ref,
6287  config->GetRotation_Rate(2) / Omega_Ref};
6288 
6289  /* Array used to store the distance to the rotation center. */
6290  su2double dist[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6291 
6292  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6293  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6294  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6295  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6296  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6297  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6298 
6299  /* Determine the grid velocities in the integration points. */
6300  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6301  const su2double* coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
6302  su2double* gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6303 
6304  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim] - Center[iDim]) / L_Ref;
6305 
6306  gridVel[0] = Omega[1] * dist[2] - Omega[2] * dist[1];
6307  gridVel[1] = Omega[2] * dist[0] - Omega[0] * dist[2];
6308  if (nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0] * dist[1] - Omega[1] * dist[0];
6309  }
6310 
6311  /* Determine the grid velocities in the solution DOFs. */
6312  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFs; ++i) {
6313  const su2double* coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i * nDim;
6314  su2double* gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i * nDim;
6315 
6316  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim] - Center[iDim]) / L_Ref;
6317 
6318  gridVel[0] = Omega[1] * dist[2] - Omega[2] * dist[1];
6319  gridVel[1] = Omega[2] * dist[0] - Omega[0] * dist[2];
6320  if (nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0] * dist[1] - Omega[1] * dist[0];
6321  }
6322  }
6323 
6324  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6325  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6326  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6327  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6328  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6329 
6330  /* Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6331  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6332  const su2double* coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
6333  su2double* gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6334 
6335  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim] - Center[iDim]) / L_Ref;
6336 
6337  gridVel[0] = Omega[1] * dist[2] - Omega[2] * dist[1];
6338  gridVel[1] = Omega[2] * dist[0] - Omega[0] * dist[2];
6339  if (nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0] * dist[1] - Omega[1] * dist[0];
6340  }
6341  }
6342 
6343  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6344  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6345  if (!boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) {
6346  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6347  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6348 
6349  /* Check if this is a shroud boundary. */
6350  bool shroudBoundary = false;
6351  for (unsigned short iShroud = 0; iShroud < config->GetnMarker_Shroud(); ++iShroud) {
6352  if (boundaries[iMarker].markerTag == config->GetMarker_Shroud(iShroud)) {
6353  shroudBoundary = true;
6354  break;
6355  }
6356  }
6357 
6358  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6359  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6360  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6361  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6362  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6363 
6364  /* For a shroud boundary the grid velocities must be set to zero. */
6365  if (shroudBoundary) {
6366  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < (nInt * nDim); ++i) surfElem[l].gridVelocities[i] = 0.0;
6367  } else {
6368  /* Normal boundary. Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6369  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6370  const su2double* coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i * nDim;
6371  su2double* gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6372 
6373  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim] - Center[iDim]) / L_Ref;
6374 
6375  gridVel[0] = Omega[1] * dist[2] - Omega[2] * dist[1];
6376  gridVel[1] = Omega[2] * dist[0] - Omega[0] * dist[2];
6377  if (nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0] * dist[1] - Omega[1] * dist[0];
6378  }
6379  }
6380  }
6381  }
6382  }
6383 
6384  break;
6385  }
6386 
6387  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6388 
6389  case STEADY_TRANSLATION: {
6390  /* Get the translation velocity from config. */
6391  const su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate(0) / Vel_Ref, config->GetTranslation_Rate(1) / Vel_Ref,
6392  config->GetTranslation_Rate(2) / Vel_Ref};
6393 
6394  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6395  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6396  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6397  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6398  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6399  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6400 
6401  /* Set the grid velocity in both the integration points and
6402  the sol DOFs. */
6403  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6404  su2double* gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6405  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6406  }
6407 
6408  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nDOFs; ++i) {
6409  su2double* gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i * nDim;
6410  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6411  }
6412  }
6413 
6414  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6415  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6416  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6417  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6418  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6419 
6420  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6421  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6422  su2double* gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6423  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6424  }
6425  }
6426 
6427  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6428  for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6429  if (!boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary) {
6430  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6431  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6432 
6433  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6434  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6435  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6436  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6437  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6438 
6439  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6440  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < nInt; ++i) {
6441  su2double* gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i * nDim;
6442  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6443  }
6444  }
6445  }
6446  }
6447 
6448  break;
6449  }
6450 
6451  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6452 
6453  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6454  break;
6455  }
6456 
6457  if (config->GetSurface_Movement(MOVING_WALL)) {
6458  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries. Skip the periodic boundaries. ---*/
6459  for (unsigned short i = 0; i < boundaries.size(); ++i) {
6460  if (!boundaries[i].periodicBoundary) {
6461  /* Check if for this boundary a motion has been specified. */
6462  if (config->GetMarker_All_Moving(i) == YES) {
6463  /* Determine the prescribed translation velocity, rotation rate
6464  and rotation center. */
6465  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin(0), config->GetMotion_Origin(1),
6466  config->GetMotion_Origin(2)};
6467  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate(0) / Omega_Ref, config->GetRotation_Rate(1) / Omega_Ref,
6468  config->GetRotation_Rate(2) / Omega_Ref};
6469  const su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate(0) / Vel_Ref,
6470  config->GetTranslation_Rate(1) / Vel_Ref,
6471  config->GetTranslation_Rate(2) / Vel_Ref};
6472 
6473  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
6474  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM>& surfElem = boundaries[i].surfElem;
6475 
6476  for (unsigned long l = 0; l < surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6477  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
6478  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
6479  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
6480  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6481  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6482 
6483  /* Loop over the number of integration points. */
6484  for (unsigned short j = 0; j < nInt; ++j) {
6485  /* Set the pointers for the coordinates and grid velocities
6486  for this integration points. */
6487  const su2double* Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + j * nDim;
6488  su2double* gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + j * nDim;
6489 
6490  /* Calculate non-dim. position from rotation center. */
6491  su2double r[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6492  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) r[iDim] = (Coord[iDim] - Center[iDim]) / L_Ref;
6493 
6494  /* Cross Product of angular velocity and distance from center to
6495  get the rotational velocity. Note that we are adding on the
6496  velocity due to pure translation as well. Note that for the
6497  2D case only Omega[2] can be non-zero. */
6498  su2double velGrid[] = {vTrans[0] + Omega[1] * r[2] - Omega[2] * r[1],
6499  vTrans[1] + Omega[2] * r[0] - Omega[0] * r[2],
6500  vTrans[2] + Omega[0] * r[1] - Omega[1] * r[0]};
6501 
6502  /* Store the grid velocities. */
6503  for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim) gridVel[iDim] = velGrid[iDim];
6504  }
6505  }
6506  }
6507  }
6508  }
6509  }
6510 }
6511 
6512 CDummyMeshFEM_DG::CDummyMeshFEM_DG(CConfig* config) : CMeshFEM_DG() {
6513  nZone = config->GetnZone();
6514 
6515  nPoint_P2PSend = new int[size]();
6516  nPoint_P2PRecv = new int[size]();
6517 
6518  nVertex = new unsigned long[config->GetnMarker_All()]();
6519 
6520  Tag_to_Marker = new string[config->GetnMarker_All()];
6521 
6522  for (unsigned short i = 0; i <= config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS(); i++) {
6523  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem.push_back(0);
6524  }
6525 
6526  boundaries.resize(config->GetnMarker_All());
6527 
6528  nDim = CConfig::GetnDim(config->GetMesh_FileName(), config->GetMesh_FileFormat());
6529 }
